tagline: Life Remembers Itself.
summary:
**The Problem**
In today's fast-paced world, it's easy to forget important events and overlook small details. For many, this is a minor inconvenience, but for individuals living with Alzheimer's disease, it's a significant daily challenge. The need for a reliable, private, and easy-to-use memory support tool has never been greater.

**Our Solution: Memento**
Memento is an innovative, AI-powered mobile application designed to act as a digital memory assistant. It helps users manage their daily lives by organizing events, providing smart reminders, and even answering questions about their past activities.

Our primary goal is to support the general public while placing a special emphasis on enhancing the independence and quality of life for those with Alzheimer‚Äôs.

**Key Features & Technology**
- Intelligent Task Management: Seamlessly schedule events and receive timely, intelligent reminders.

- Memory Recall: Ask the app questions like, "What did I do last Tuesday?" and get instant, accurate answers.

- Complete Privacy: Memento is powered by Google's Gemma 3n, a state-of-the-art language model that runs directly on your device. This means all your data stays with you, ensuring complete privacy and offline functionality‚Äîno internet connection required.

- User-Friendly Design: Through extensive usability testing, we've confirmed the app is simple and effective for everyone, including elderly users who may not be tech-savvy.

**Impact & Vision**
By providing a dependable memory aid, Memento empowers users to live more independently and reduces the stress on caregivers. Our project aligns with ethical AI principles, offering a sustainable and intelligent solution to the universal challenge of memory loss and the specific needs of Alzheimer's care. Memento isn't just an app; it's a step toward a better, more supported daily life.

tagline: We present a novel workflow for the parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) of a 4-bit quantized multimodal large language model (LLM), Gemma
summary:
Gemma-3n-4b- Academic papers-finetuning-inference: 
LoRA-Augmented Fine-Tuning of a 4-bit Multimodal Language Model on Scientific Literature

ABSTRACT

We present a novel workflow for the parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) of a 4-bit quantized multimodal large language model (LLM), Gemma 3N-E4B, on a curated corpus of 20 state-of-the-art research papers in AI, climate science, healthcare, and computer vision. Leveraging LoRA adapters, we freeze the majority of the backbone weights and fine-tune only low-rank updates in attention and MLP modules, achieving substantial memory savings. We introduce a robust PDF download and parsing module using streaming requests and PyPDF2 to extract full-text content at scale. To address version conflicts in a heterogeneous dependency environment (Colab vs. local), we propose an ordered, pinned installation sequence that ensures reproducible environments. Our training regime‚Äî1 GPU, 4-bit weights, batch size 1 with gradient accumulation‚Äîcompletes 40 LoRA steps under early-stopping criteria, consuming under 8 GB of GPU memory. We report fine-tuned performance across training, validation, and holdout sets using a novel mixed relevance/overlap accuracy metric, achieving 82.4% average accuracy and demonstrating strong generalization (Œî < 5%). Finally, we release our code, LoRA adapters, and detailed memory and performance plots, providing a blueprint for resource-constrained scientific LLM fine-tuning.

Keywords
LoRA, 4-bit quantization, Gemma 3N, multimodal LLM, PDF parsing, PyPDF2, PEFT, early stopping, memory efficiency, reproducible dependencies

tagline: Auralia is an offline Android voice assistant using Gemma 3n to help blind users control their phone and daily tasks entirely¬†by¬†voice.
authors: mouhssine ELH, STBilal, NHO1902, Said Nichan, Meryeme Boussaid
summary:
**Auralia** is a fully **offline Android voice assistant** specifically designed to empower *blind and visually impaired users* with private, hands-free access to their smartphones. It integrates speech recognition, natural language understanding, and task automation to enable users to perform everyday actions, such as setting alarms, sending SMS, making calls, opening apps, or navigating the web, using only their voice, without needing to look at or touch the screen.

Auralia operates entirely offline, preserving user privacy by using the Gemma 3n AI model via the Ollama framework for natural language processing directly on the device. The wake word "Hey Gemma" activates the assistant instantly, and real-time feedback is provided through natural-sounding text-to-speech, haptic signals, and audio cues.

To ensure accessibility, Auralia includes an integrated accessibility service, optimized interface components using Jetpack Compose, and a voice-based navigation system adapted to blind users. Features such as multilingual support, noise cancellation, speech-to-text transcription, and offline command processing make Auralia reliable, even in low-connectivity environments.

By prioritizing privacy, usability, and independence, Auralia represents a step forward in inclusive mobile technology, turning any Android device into an intelligent assistant tailored for those who rely on voice over vision.

project_title: LeRepairBot: Multimodal Assistant to Help Repair Electronics and Reduce E-Waste
tagline: Empowering anyone to repair electronics locally using on-device, offline Gemma 3n guidance to reduce e-waste
summary:
Every year, we generate over 50 million tonnes of electronic waste. Much of it is caused by small, repairable issues like a broken port, a loose wire, a dead battery. But instead of fixing, we throw things away. As sometimes, replacing is easier, faster, cheaper. But what we often don‚Äôt realize is the true cost.

That discarded device ends up in a landfill, polluting soil, water, and harming communities far away from where it was used
As someone passionate about sustainability and electronics repairability .I built LeRepairBot: An offline, repair assistant powered by Gemma 3n and LeRobot arm. It guides users through real-time repairs using retrieved repair guides and multimodal understanding . 

**Build process :**

a. Dataset preparation:
I started by creating a [repairdataset](https://huggingface.co/datasets/ankithreddy/repairdataset-mini) of real repair guides and pushed it to Hugging Face. 

b. Fine-Tuning Gemma 3n (Vision + Text)
Then I fine-tuned Gemma3n on both modalities using my dataset. I was excited to see the training loss decrease, signaling that the model was learning. 
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F2331282%2F047218067e153f24c105417e62b66e69%2FScreenshot%202025-07-31%20at%2010.02.24AM.png?generation=1753976565652625&alt=media)

But I realised true measure of fine tuning effort is not training loss , but how the model responds. The outputs were slightly better than the base model and showed some understanding of repair concepts, but they lacked precision. The model returned generalized answers, not the exact tools and steps, which is critical for real repair tasks

c. Switching to RAG for precision
That's when I moved to Retrieval Augmented Generation ,semantically fetching product specific instructions from the dataset .This approach gave me the accuracy and grounding I needed. 

[gemma3n_RAG_notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/code/ankithreddy/gemma3n-multimodal-rag)


d. Robot Integration 
I assembled the LeRobot s0101 arm and began recording datasets through teleoperation, starting with simple tasks like ‚Äúpass the screwdriver.‚Äù

![datasetrecording](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F2331282%2F6946423b91f084ed7253a73c97b20422%2Frerunscreenshotlerobot.png?generation=1754123935329628&alt=media)


e. Gemma 3n as a VLA Model
Next, I worked on turning Gemma 3n into a Vision-Language-Action (VLA) model to control LeRobot based on task and visual input with the dataset I recorded previously .
[added_gemma3nvla: github](https://github.com/ankithreddypati/lerobot/tree/adding_gemma3nvla)

I have recorded 100 episodes of robot doing the task with teleoperation
[Datasets](https://huggingface.co/datasets/ankithreddy/so101_pickplace_tools)
The dataset includes 100 recordings at 1280√ó720 resolution, 30 FPS picking up and placing in box.

I fine-tuned the gemma3n VLA model on this dataset for 20,000 steps, which took approximately 18 hours on an NVIDIA A100 GPU.
[colabFinetunenotebook](https://colab.research.google.com/#fileId=https%3A//storage.googleapis.com/kaggle-colab-exported-notebooks/ankithreddy/gemma3nvla-lerepairbot-v0.a30562dd-3898-4c4a-9fa9-54e992b29efb.ipynb%3FX-Goog-Algorithm%3DGOOG4-RSA-SHA256%26X-Goog-Credential%3Dgcp-kaggle-com%2540kaggle-161607.iam.gserviceaccount.com/20250806/auto/storage/goog4_request%26X-Goog-Date%3D20250806T232032Z%26X-Goog-Expires%3D259200%26X-Goog-SignedHeaders%3Dhost%26X-Goog-Signature%)
[kaggleFinetunenotebook](https://www.kaggle.com/code/ankithreddy/gemma3nvla-lerepairbot-v0)
[modelevaluationepisode](https://huggingface.co/spaces/lerobot/visualize_dataset?path=%2Fankithreddy%2Feval_repair_2%2Fepisode_0)


Async inference:
I was able to do async inference of the task with gemm3nvla

![Async inference](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PfZar3Z35c0)



f. local inference 
To keep everything fully offline, I ran inference using mlx-vlm which supported multimodal inference 

![localinference](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F2331282%2F5262992d9ab482cca75a04fb3cf3010b%2FScreenshot%202025-08-06%20at%207.06.28PM.png?generation=1754521630595590&alt=media)

[mlxvlmlocalinference](https://github.com/ankithreddypati/repairbotmlx-inference)
[gemma3nvlalocalrocminference](https://github.com/ankithreddypati/lerobot/tree/adding_gemma3nvla)

g. Note:
a. Library compatibility: I used transformers==4.55.0.dev0 during development. I later found that newer versions throws errors

project_title: Gemma Kavach: AI-Powered Safety Suite for Crowded Events
tagline: AI to prevent stampedes and manage chaos at crowded public events
summary:
**Author :Aditya Bhatt**
**Date :08-July-2025**

**Abstract**

Large-scale public gatherings in India frequently become sites of crowd-related disasters ‚Äî over 3,000 people lost their lives in stampedes between 2001 and 2022, and 121 fatalities occurred in a single crowd crush in Hathras in July 2024 [1](https://factly.in/data-over-3000-lives-lost-in-stampedes-between-2001-2022/?).We present Gemma Kavach, an AI-powered safety suite designed to proactively manage high-density events. The system features:

1. Real-time video analysis to detect crowd density, motion anomalies, and panic indicators

2. A voice-based system that delivers instant Hindi-English alerts and allows authorities to issue hands-free updates

3. A citizen-facing app enabling the public to report emergencies like lost children, medical needs, or fire

Powered by Google‚Äôs Gemma 3n multimodal model, fine-tuned via Unsloth, and deployed efficiently using both its lightweight and high-capacity modes, Gemma Kavach empowers event staff and attendees to detect threats and respond in real time ‚Äî reducing risk and preventing tragedy.

**Introduction**

Mass public events such as religious gatherings, political rallies, and festivals in India often attract tens of thousands of people into dense, high-risk zones. These environments are highly prone to chaos, panic, and crowd crush incidents. Traditional public safety mechanisms ‚Äî including CCTV monitoring, manual announcements, and delayed ground response ‚Äî are insufficient in identifying early signs of danger or mobilizing quick action.

To address this urgent public safety need, we built Gemma Kavach, an AI-powered safety suite that leverages real-time video understanding, voice-mode operations, and a crowd-sourced incident reporting system to deliver intelligent, scalable crowd management.

Our solution is built on Gemma 3n , a new-generation multimodal model from Google, optimized for real-time performance on devices such as phones, laptops, and tablets. Gemma 3n includes innovations like Per-Layer Embedding (PLE) and the MatFormer architecture, which enable parameter-efficient processing and reduce compute and memory demands ‚Äî making it ideal for real-time edge deployments.

This problem domain was chosen deliberately because traditional AI and surveillance systems are too heavy, too cloud-dependent, and often unaffordable at scale ‚Äî especially in countries like India where digital infrastructure adoption is still uneven. Despite a growing population and increased mobile usage, many Indian regions have yet to fully embrace cloud computing. For such environments, AI models must be both cost-efficient and capable of running inference locally or with minimal connectivity, without sacrificing real-world responsiveness.

Gemma Kavach fills this gap by pairing powerful AI perception with practical deployment, enabling both event authorities and everyday citizens to play an active role in crowd safety ‚Äî before disaster strikes.

**Background**

The cost of inaction in public safety is often measured not in rupees, but in human lives. For years, deploying AI-driven solutions in real-world environments remained impractical due to the high computational cost, internet dependency, and cloud-centric infrastructure requirements of large-scale models.

However, with the advent of open-source, multimodal models like Gemma 3n, we now have the capability to run powerful AI inference directly on-device at near-zero cost. This marks a significant shift: developers can now fine-tune, align, and deploy models to suit hyper-local needs, rather than relying on expensive, rigid cloud pipelines.

In a country like India, where infrastructural limitations, budget constraints, and regional diversity are constant challenges, the winning formula is simple ‚Äî lightweight, mobile-first, and multimodal AI that works seamlessly with local languages and hardware. With Gemma 3n, we finally have the tools to solve previously unreachable problems, and to do so in a way that is scalable, inclusive, and impactful.

**System Architecture Overview**

Gemma Kavach is implemented as a comprehensive AI-powered crowd safety suite built on Google's Gemma 3n multimodal model. The system architecture follows a modular design with four interconnected components: a centralized Gemma 3n inference server, a real-time crowd monitoring system, a voice command interface, and an emergency reporting application. This design enables seamless integration while maintaining the flexibility to deploy each component independently based on operational requirements. The overall architecture leverages Gemma 3n's multimodal capabilities to process text, image, and audio inputs through a unified inference pipeline. The system is designed for edge deployment, ensuring low-latency responses and offline functionality - critical requirements for crowd safety applications where network connectivity may be unreliable during emergencies.

**Gemma 3n Server Infrastructure**

The core of Gemma Kavach is built around a centralized Gemma 3n inference server that provides unified multimodal processing capabilities. We utilized the unsloth/gemma-3n-E4B-it model variant, specifically chosen for its optimized performance on edge devices and enhanced multimodal understanding capabilities. The server implementation uses FastAPI as the web framework, providing three distinct endpoints for different modalities: /generate for text-only processing, /ask_image for vision tasks, and /ask for audio transcription. A critical design decision was the implementation of a universal generation function that uses the raw tokenizer for all requests, eliminating template conflicts that typically arise when mixing text-only and multimodal operations. The model configuration employs automatic precision detection with 4-bit quantization enabled for optimized edge deployment while maintaining multimodal compatibility. This approach ensures consistent performance across all three modalities while preserving the model's ability to process interleaved audio, text, and image inputs. The server architecture supports both sampling-based generation for creative tasks and greedy decoding for consistent classification outputs. For deployment optimization, we implemented aggressive compilation disabling and CUDA launch blocking to ensure stable inference on resource-constrained devices.

**Crowd Monitoring Vision Solution**

The crowd monitoring system represents the core safety component of Gemma Kavach, designed to provide real-time analysis of crowd density and motion patterns. The system implements a dual-analysis approach that simultaneously evaluates crowd density levels and motion behavior patterns to generate comprehensive risk assessments. The vision processing pipeline captures video frames at 2-second intervals and submits them to the Gemma 3n server for concurrent analysis using specialized prompts for crowd density classification (Low/Medium/High) and motion behavior analysis (Calm/Chaotic). This dual-prompt approach allows for more nuanced risk assessment compared to single-metric systems. Risk determination follows a matrix-based algorithm where chaotic motion combined with high density triggers critical alerts, while isolated high density or chaotic motion results in moderate risk classifications. The system maintains detailed analytics including frame-by-frame analysis history, flagging rates, and temporal risk progression. Session management is implemented through Google Cloud Storage, enabling persistent monitoring across multiple operators and locations. The system automatically saves flagged frames with high-risk classifications and maintains detailed metadata for post-incident analysis. Email alerting is triggered when risk scores exceed 70% or when multiple critical frames are detected within a short timespan, with comprehensive alert emails sent via Gmail SMTP containing analysis breakdowns, flagged frame attachments, and detailed risk assessment reports. The frontend interface provides real-time visualization of risk metrics, session statistics, and analysis breakdowns through a cyberpunk-themed responsive design optimized for both desktop and mobile deployment scenarios.

**Voice Command System**

The voice command system addresses the need for hands-free operation during crowd management scenarios, particularly crucial when security personnel need to obtain quick status updates without diverting attention from crowd monitoring activities. The system implements a complete speech-to-speech pipeline supporting Hindi and English voice commands. Audio processing begins with browser-based MediaRecorder API, with format prioritization optimized for mobile devices - particularly iOS Safari which requires MP4 format support. Audio conversion to WAV format is performed client-side using Web Audio API to ensure server compatibility. Voice transcription leverages Gemma 3n's audio processing capabilities through multimodal message formatting, where audio files are processed alongside textual prompts for context-aware transcription. The system implements intelligent zone information extraction using language model-based parsing to identify specific areas (Zone A, B, C, D) from natural language voice commands. Database integration connects voice queries to real-time crowd monitoring session data, enabling voice-based status retrieval for specific zones. Response generation uses specialized prompts to create natural Hindi language responses that are subsequently converted to speech using Google Text-to-Speech API. Mobile compatibility required extensive optimization for iOS and Android platforms, including audio format compatibility testing, user interaction requirements for audio playback, and alternative playback mechanisms for restrictive browser environments.

**Emergency Reporting Application**

The emergency reporting application provides a citizen-facing interface for reporting various emergency situations commonly encountered in large gatherings. The system implements a sophisticated text classification model fine-tuned specifically for emergency categorization in Indian contexts. The classification model was developed using Unsloth framework for efficient fine-tuning of the Gemma 3n E2B model on a dataset of 60,000 emergency scenarios across six categories: child_lost, crowd_panic, lost_item, medical_help, need_interpreter, and small_fire. The fine-tuning process employed LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) with rank 16, alpha 16, and dropout 0.1 to achieve efficient parameter updates while maintaining model stability. The application workflow integrates text classification with image capture and geolocation data to create comprehensive emergency reports. Upon submission, the system performs immediate AI classification of the emergency description, captures and stores associated images in Google Cloud Storage, and generates unique report identifiers for tracking purposes. Background processing handles email alert generation with embedded images and detailed emergency information sent to emergency response teams including classification results, location data, timestamp information, and attached photographic evidence via Gmail SMTP integration. The frontend implementation uses a progressive web application approach with drag-and-drop image upload, real-time form validation, and step-by-step processing visualization providing immediate feedback on classification results and confirmation of successful emergency report submission.

**Technology Stack and Integration**

The complete Gemma Kavach system integrates multiple technologies to deliver a cohesive crowd safety solution. The backend infrastructure centers on FastAPI servers providing RESTful APIs for each system component, with shared dependencies including Google Cloud Storage for data persistence and Google Text-to-Speech for audio generation. Frontend implementations vary by use case: the crowd monitoring system employs a real-time dashboard with polling for live updates, the voice command system uses Web Audio APIs for browser-based audio processing, and the emergency reporting application implements a progressive web app with offline capabilities. Data persistence is managed through Google Cloud Storage with structured JSON formatting for session data and binary storage for images and audio files. The system implements automatic cleanup procedures and configurable retention policies for long-term data management. Integration points between components include shared session identifiers, common alert mechanisms, and unified reporting formats. The modular architecture allows for independent scaling of components based on operational demands while maintaining consistent data formats and API contracts across the entire system. The deployment architecture supports both cloud and edge deployment scenarios, with the Gemma 3n server capable of running on GPU-equipped edge devices while maintaining connectivity to cloud storage and notification services for comprehensive functionality.

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F5141429%2F1196e1041d061d12a2957124eeeadf6b%2Ftech_arch.PNG?generation=1751983897334670&alt=media)

**Technical Challenges**

The development of Gemma Kavach involved solving critical real-world problems that traditional surveillance and emergency response systems fail to address effectively. The project began with the recognition that existing crowd monitoring relies heavily on human operators who suffer from attention fatigue and cannot simultaneously monitor multiple video feeds effectively. Traditional CCTV systems lack the intelligence to automatically detect early warning signs of crowd disasters, often resulting in delayed responses when seconds matter most. The first major challenge was establishing a stable multimodal inference server capable of handling text, image, and audio processing reliably. Initial attempts using standard transformers libraries resulted in frequent infinity and NaN errors due to Gemma 3n's FP16 numerical instability issues, particularly with convolutional weights that exceed float16's maximum range of 65,504. This critical issue was resolved by migrating to Unsloth's optimized framework, which provides stable bfloat16 operations specifically designed for Gemma models, eliminating the numerical overflow problems while maintaining model performance.

The crowd monitoring system development revealed the need for more sophisticated analysis beyond simple object detection. Initial single-metric approaches proved insufficient for accurately assessing crowd safety, leading to the innovation of the dual-analysis framework that separately evaluates crowd density and motion patterns. This approach significantly improved accuracy by distinguishing between high-density but calm situations (which are manageable) versus chaotic motion in any density (which requires immediate attention). The development process involved extensive testing to optimize the risk assessment matrix, determining that chaotic motion combined with high density represents the highest risk scenario requiring critical alerts, while isolated factors result in moderate risk classifications.

The voice command system presented unique challenges related to Indian accents and Hindi language processing in noisy environments typical of large gatherings. Initial experiments with Gemma 3n's native audio capabilities showed poor performance for Indian English and Hindi, particularly in environments with background noise. Following Google's official audio preprocessing guidelines (16kHz resampling, mono conversion, float32 normalization) produced unexpected results where preprocessing improved performance on poor-quality audio but degraded performance on high-quality recordings. This led to the critical insight that adaptive preprocessing based on audio quality assessment was necessary, fundamentally changing the approach from universal preprocessing to intelligent, context-aware audio handling. 

The system now implements a multi-stage pipeline with intelligent zone extraction and database integration for real-time status retrieval.

The emergency reporting application required solving the challenge of creating an intelligent classification system for diverse emergency scenarios in Indian contexts. The breakthrough came through fine-tuning a separate Gemma 3n E2B model using synthetic training data generated specifically for Indian emergency scenarios. The initial training attempt with 600 samples showed minimal learning, but scaling to 60,000 samples (a 100x increase) dramatically improved classification accuracy, validating the importance of data volume in compute-optimal training as described in the Chinchilla paper. The fine-tuning process using Unsloth's LoRA optimization revealed critical insights about training stability on cloud platforms, requiring the implementation of background process management using nohup commands to prevent training interruptions from connection drops. This experience highlighted the practical challenges of distributed training and the importance of robust checkpoint recovery mechanisms.

**Hardware Specifications and Performance Analysis**

The entire Gemma Kavach system was developed and deployed on RTX 4090 hardware rented through RunPod's cloud GPU infrastructure. The RTX 4090 provided 24GB of VRAM, which proved essential for handling the multimodal processing demands of the Gemma 3n models. During peak operation with all three system components running simultaneously, the system achieved approximately 70% VRAM utilization, leaving sufficient headroom for stable operation while processing concurrent video analysis, voice transcription, and emergency classification tasks. The RTX 4090's native bfloat16 support was crucial for resolving the numerical stability issues encountered with Gemma 3n, as the model's convolutional weights require the extended range provided by bfloat16 precision to avoid infinity overflow conditions that plague FP16 implementations.

The current hardware configuration successfully demonstrates the feasibility of edge deployment for crowd safety applications, proving that sophisticated multimodal AI can operate effectively on consumer-grade GPU hardware. However, for broader deployment scenarios where hardware costs and power consumption are critical factors, future development plans include fine-tuning the full 4B parameter Gemma 3n model and subsequently compressing it to a 2B parameter variant optimized for 10GB VRAM systems. This approach would enable deployment on more accessible hardware platforms such as RTX 3080 or RTX 4070 systems, significantly reducing the barrier to entry for organizations seeking to implement intelligent crowd monitoring solutions. The planned compression strategy leverages Gemma 3n's mix-n-match capability, where larger models naturally contain smaller submodels that can be extracted and optimized independently, providing a clear path toward more resource-efficient deployments without sacrificing core functionality.

**Scenario Demo**

To contextualize the real-world application of Gemma Kavach, we consider a deployment scenario at a high-density cultural festival in Lucknow, India, with an estimated footfall exceeding 30,000 attendees. The venue is segmented into multiple zones (Zone A through Zone E), each equipped with static CCTV feeds, public address systems, and stationed security personnel. The system is actively deployed in a live event setting, with all three components‚Äîvision monitoring, voice-based command, and citizen reporting‚Äîoperating in tandem.

At approximately 6:00 PM, during peak crowd ingress, the crowd monitoring module begins capturing and analyzing video frames from Zone C at two-second intervals. Gemma 3n‚Äôs multimodal inference server receives each frame and processes two concurrent prompts: one for crowd density classification and another for motion pattern analysis. Initially, the system identifies "High Density + Calm Motion", but within ten minutes, movement patterns begin exhibiting characteristics of crowd agitation. The dual-prompt system upgrades its classification to ‚ÄúHigh Density + Chaotic Motion‚Äù, surpassing the critical risk threshold in the decision matrix. This triggers an automated alert via email to the event control center, attaching flagged frames and corresponding panic probability scores. The real-time dashboard interface simultaneously updates, visually rendering Zone C in red, accompanied by a risk score of 87%, prompting immediate review by operators.

In response to this alert, a security officer positioned near Zone C engages with the system via voice command using a standard walkie-talkie microphone integrated into a mobile device. The officer asks in Hindi, ‚ÄúZone C ka kya haal hai?‚Äù (What‚Äôs the status of Zone C?). This audio input is transcribed and interpreted by the voice command pipeline, which maps the query to current session data and generates a synthesized Hindi response: ‚ÄúZone C: Bheed bahut zyada hai aur halchal zyada ho gayi hai. Turant action lena zaroori hai.‚Äù (Zone C: The crowd is extremely dense and movement has become chaotic. Immediate action is necessary). This response is converted into speech and delivered back to the officer within seconds. Based on the alert and voice feedback, command authorities issue an evacuation instruction, redirect personnel, and broadcast calming announcements via loudspeakers.

Simultaneously, a citizen present in Zone D notices a child separated from their guardian. Using the citizen-facing mobile application, the user selects the ‚ÄúChild Lost‚Äù category, types a brief note, and uploads a photo. The emergency classification model, fine-tuned on 60,000 Indian emergency samples, correctly identifies the report as "child_lost" with high confidence. A unique report ID is generated, the image and geolocation data are stored in cloud storage, and an alert is dispatched via email to the command center, including the image, location, and classification metadata. This allows field officers to quickly locate and reunite the child with their family.

This scenario underscores the synergistic impact of Gemma Kavach‚Äôs multimodal AI stack. The real-time vision system facilitates early risk detection, the voice module ensures frictionless interaction in the field, and the citizen reporting system decentralizes situational awareness. Together, they enable high-fidelity, low-latency decision-making that reduces response time and mitigates the risk of large-scale human harm.


![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F5141429%2Fc926fde10c89f963f6b888a2b811d4b5%2Fprac_example.PNG?generation=1751985389804314&alt=media)


**Impact Potential**

Gemma Kavach directly addresses the systemic gaps in crowd management observed during mass gatherings in India. Traditional surveillance systems rely heavily on human attention, which is limited by fatigue, reaction time, and coverage capacity. In contrast, Gemma Kavach introduces autonomous AI-driven perception and decision support, significantly enhancing both the speed and scale of situational awareness.

The vision module introduces a two-pronged detection mechanism ‚Äî analyzing both crowd density and motion turbulence ‚Äî allowing the system to identify early signs of disorder that would otherwise go unnoticed until escalation. While traditional setups often require manual scanning of multiple camera feeds, Gemma Kavach continuously evaluates visual inputs and flags risk conditions in near real-time, reducing the detection burden on human operators.

The voice interface enables hands-free querying of zone conditions, especially useful in dynamic field operations where typing or navigating dashboards may not be feasible. By supporting natural Hindi and English commands, the system ensures accessibility for on-ground personnel, many of whom may not be proficient in English or familiar with digital interfaces.

The citizen-facing reporting system fills a critical gap by enabling the public to actively participate in event safety. Through structured inputs and image attachments, it empowers attendees to report localized emergencies (e.g., lost children, minor fires, or medical incidents), giving authorities immediate, geotagged alerts. This decentralization of incident reporting creates a mesh of awareness that scales far beyond centralized monitoring, especially in vast or segmented venues.

Overall, Gemma Kavach transforms crowd safety from a reactive, siloed process into a distributed, multimodal intelligence network ‚Äî making timely intervention possible where human oversight alone would be inadequate. While full-scale deployment studies are planned, the current architecture lays the foundation for measurable reductions in detection latency, communication bottlenecks, and false negatives ‚Äî all of which are crucial factors in preventing stampede-related tragedies.

**Future Work**

While Gemma Kavach currently operates as a proof-of-concept for crowd safety at public events, the underlying architecture is designed with extensibility in mind ‚Äî particularly for broader disaster response use cases in India. The system leverages the smallest multimodal model available with real-time capabilities (Gemma 3n E2B and E4B), making it uniquely suited for deployment in low-resource, infrastructure-constrained settings. As such, Gemma Kavach is not limited to cultural gatherings or religious festivals; its architecture can generalize to other domains such as flood management, public protests, pilgrimage corridors, or high-traffic transportation hubs.

A key direction for future work includes integration with geospatial data and drone-based imagery, enabling large-area monitoring without relying solely on static CCTV infrastructure. Additionally, offline-first deployment for the citizen-facing application ‚Äî including SMS and IVR (Interactive Voice Response) integration ‚Äî could significantly improve accessibility in rural or low-connectivity zones. On the vision side, extending the current dual-prompt detection to incorporate human pose estimation or thermal inputs could improve early-stage anomaly detection, especially in night-time or obscured scenarios.

There is also scope for hierarchical coordination between AI agents, where multiple deployed nodes (e.g., across zones or districts) can collaborate and escalate alerts through a federated system. Given the lightweight nature of Gemma 3n models, such a decentralized intelligence framework remains technically feasible and financially viable ‚Äî especially in a country where disaster management often suffers from fragmented data systems and reactive coordination.

Long-term, we envision Gemma Kavach evolving into a standardized safety interface ‚Äî one that public authorities, private organizers, and citizens alike can rely on to mitigate human risk in dense environments. By combining efficient multimodal AI, localized deployment strategies, and citizen participation, this system lays the groundwork for an India-centric, AI-first public safety infrastructure.

project_title: EmpowerEd is a mobile application powered by Gemma 3n
tagline: Ed is a mobile application powered by Gemma 3n, designed to revolutionize education in low-connectivity regions by providing an offline-firs
summary:
Overview
EmpowerEd is a mobile application powered by Gemma 3n, designed to revolutionize education in low-connectivity regions by providing an offline-first, multimodal learning assistant. It addresses the challenge of unequal access to quality education by delivering personalized, interactive, and engaging learning experiences to students in remote or underserved areas, where internet access is unreliable or nonexistent.Real-World ChallengeOver 250 million children globally lack access to quality education due to geographic isolation, poverty, or lack of infrastructure (UNESCO, 2023). In many regions, schools struggle with limited resources, untrained teachers, and no internet connectivity. EmpowerEd leverages Gemma 3n‚Äôs offline capabilities, multimodal understanding, and multilingual support to provide a scalable, private, and accessible solution for students aged 6‚Äì18.How EmpowerEd WorksEmpowerEd is an Android/iOS app that runs entirely on-device, using Gemma 3n‚Äôs optimized 4B model (with a 2B submodel for resource-constrained devices). 

How EmpowerEd Works
EmpowerEd is an Android/iOS app that runs entirely on-device, using Gemma 3n‚Äôs optimized 4B model (with a 2B submodel for resource-constrained devices). It offers:
1. Personalized Learning Paths:
Upon first use, EmpowerEd conducts a simple, game-like assessment to gauge the student's knowledge level in core subjects like math, science, and literacy. Based on the results, Gemma 3n curates a unique learning path, ensuring content is challenging but not overwhelming. The path adapts in real-time based on the student's performance on quizzes and exercises.
2. Interactive AI Tutor:
Students can ask questions in their natural language (typed or spoken) and receive instant, conversational answers. The AI Tutor acts as a patient, always-available guide. It can explain complex concepts in simple terms, provide step-by-step solutions to problems, and use the Socratic method to encourage critical thinking rather than just giving away the answer.
3. Multimodal "Snap & Solve":
Leveraging Gemma 3n's multimodal understanding, students can use their device's camera to take a picture of a problem‚Äîfrom a textbook, a worksheet, or even handwritten notes. EmpowerEd recognizes the text and images (e.g., a math equation, a diagram of a plant cell) and provides a detailed explanation, a visual breakdown, or a guided solution.
4. On-Device Generative Tools:
Visual Explainer: When a student struggles with an abstract concept like the water cycle or planetary orbits, EmpowerEd can generate simple diagrams, charts, and illustrations on the fly to provide a visual aid.
Story Weaver: To boost literacy and creativity, students can provide a prompt (e.g., "a story about a brave rabbit who explores a cave"), and Gemma 3n will generate a short, age-appropriate story that the student can read or have read to them using text-to-speech.
5. Localized and Multilingual Content:
The app is pre-loaded with core curriculum modules that can be rendered in multiple languages, focusing on the dialects spoken in the target regions. Students can learn in their mother tongue, breaking down significant barriers to comprehension. The AI Tutor is also fine-tuned to understand and respond in these local languages.
6. Offline-First Architecture with Smart Sync:
All core features‚Äîtutoring, problem-solving, and content access‚Äîfunction perfectly without an internet connection. The app utilizes a "Smart Sync" feature. When the device occasionally connects to a network (e.g., at a community Wi-Fi hotspot), it automatically downloads new learning modules, language packs, and model updates in the background, ensuring the content remains fresh and relevant.
7. Progress Tracking and Gamification:
To keep students motivated, EmpowerEd incorporates gamified elements. Students earn points, unlock badges for mastering new skills, and can view their progress on a "learning tree" that visually represents their academic journey. This provides a sense of accomplishment and encourages consistent engagement.
For Educators and Facilitators:
The app also includes a simple, secure "Facilitator Mode." A teacher or community volunteer can view anonymized, aggregated class progress, identify common challenges where students are struggling, and access on-device teaching guides and lesson plan ideas generated by Gemma 3n to better support their students.

File Data digestion: Each each file undergoes multiple processes parsing, and file

formation_type, specific
weight_on_bit_klbs/rotary_speed_rpm/torque_ft_lbs interplay, or potential
bit dulling) but also suggest an optimal drilling parameter window for that
specific formation_type?ÀÆ
‚ÄúFor all npt_reason events recorded in the HistoricalLogEntry (e.g.,
'Equipment Maintenance', 'Daylight delays'), can DrillIntel perform a root
cause analysis to quantify their impact on project cost and schedule?
Specifically, for recurrent NPT types, can DrillIntel use the
DetailedAnalysis.csv insights and recommendations to show how
proactive maintenance alerts or optimized operational procedures could
have reduced the Non-Productive Time by a specific percentage, thereby
translating directly into tangible cost savings and increased rop_ft_hr over
the drilling program?ÀÆ
‚ÄúCan DrillIntel analyze if the Weather_Temperature_F and
Weather_Wind_Speed_mph from Well.csv show any statistically significant

or extreme weather events? If so, what insight and recommendation from

‚Äúplot Weather_Temperature_F and Weather_Wind_Speed_mph versus ROP
with timeÀÆ
Recommendation System: The system not just give reactive analysis, but by
contiously monitering the incoming data and properly analyzing it, It
automatically provide you with potential alerts flags like bit wear, loss of
circulation, stuck pipe. Each alert is analyzed and teh system provide you with
the proper recommendation
Dynamic Visualization: The platform renders dynamic dashboards. Users can
visualize multiple parameters that is crucial for monitering the well, detecting
anamolies and help in taking the proper decision. Transforming static reports
into dynamic analytical dashboard
Automated Clean Data Infrastructure for Manual Analysis and Machine
learning projects: A primary function of the framework is to provide a robust
data foundation. Every file uploaded is transformed into a clean, structured
dataset, saving tremendous amount of time, and errors related to manual data
preprocessing
Foundation for Digital Twin Ecosystems: By providing a standardized, high
quality data, DrillIntel is designed to be the foundation for building high
accuracy digital twins or rigs, wells, and fields

- Comparison: Drill-Intel vs. Data Scientist Team (Manual)

| **Task** | **DrillIntel Performance** | **Data Scientist Team (Manual, Estimated)** | **Time Savings (Illustrative)** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Process Daily Drilling Report** | ~2 minutes per report | ~1‚Äì2 hours per report | **Massive (>95%)** |
| *Total for 1000 Reports (Preprocessing & Storage)* | **~33 hours** | **~1000‚Äì2000 hours** | **~97‚Äì98% saved** |
| **Get Actionable Insights (e.g., avg. ROP, NPT by reason)** | ~1 minute per query | ~15‚Äì30 minutes per complex query | **90‚Äì95% faster** |
| *Total for 1000 Insight Queries* | **~17 hours** | **~250‚Äì500 hours** | **~93‚Äì96% saved** |
| **Continuous Monitoring & Alerts** | ‚úÖ Automated & Real-Time | ‚ùå Manual, Delayed Review | **Transforms Workflow** |

- Conclusion

Drill-Intel ingest files, analyze it, provide insights, detailed analysis, understanding, interpreting the data and providing proper recommendation. The platform renders dynamic dashboard for all the vital parameters in drilling helping in monitering the trends, detecting anamolies, and take proactive mitigation strategies. The chatting with database help in finding the needed information in the huge amount of data saving hours of time, also helping in getting vital insights, recommendation, active alerts, and plotting varoius parameters providing best practises. Constructing a clean data infrastructure for future projects such as: Digital twins, Machine learning models, manual data analysis, making Drill-Intel as powerful future asset.

tagline: Web app that convert scientific research paper in PDF to accessible Markdown format
summary:
**Scholar Express** is an AI-powered platform that transforms inaccessible scientific research papers into interactive, screen-reader compatible documents to address critical accessibility barriers faced by students with disabilities in academic research. 

The system leverages a specialized ensemble of AI models - including **Gemma 3n** variants for alt text generation and document chat, **DOLPHIN** for PDF layout analysis, and **Sentence-Transformer** for semantic search - to process complex academic PDFs with mathematical equations, figures, and diagrams that are typically inaccessible to screen readers. 

Through its comprehensive pipeline that converts PDFs to images, analyzes layouts, extracts elements, and generates descriptive alt text, Scholar Express creates structured **markdown** documents while also providing **RAG-powered chatbot** functionality and **real-time voice interactions** enabling the 18-54% of undergraduate students with disabilities to access the same research literature as their peers while enhancing the research experience for all users.

project_title: Species Protection Meets Gen AI: Use Gemma3n For Orangutan Conservation
tagline: Channelizing Gen AI To Conserve Endangered Species In Tropical Areas With Limited Internet Connectivity
summary:
Introduction- Why Are Orangutans At Risk Of Extinction

Orangutans, scientifically classified under the genus Pongo, represent one of humanity's closest extant relatives, sharing approximately 97% of their DNA with humans, and are among the most intelligent primates. As the only great apes native to Asia, orangutans are endemic to the islands of Sumatra and Kalimantan (John, 2022; Xie, 2025). Bornean orangutans, along with Sumatran and Tapanuli orangutans, are critically endangered according to the International Union for Conservation of Nature Red List (Sherman et al., 2021).  These remarkable creatures, whose name translates to "person of the forest" in Malay, play a crucial role in the biodiversity and ecological balance of their rainforest habitats (Pandong et al., 2019). Kalimantan, the Indonesian portion of Borneo Island, harbours a significant population of Bornean orangutans (*Pongo pygmaeus*), one of the three recognised species of orangutans, and its diverse ecosystems and natural resources are essential for the survival of this species (Leo et al., 2021). 

Vital orangutan habitats are under immense threat due to deforestation, habitat fragmentation, and illegal hunting, posing severe conservation challenges for orangutans and the biodiversity they support. The rapid expansion of oil palm plantations has generated controversy because of their negative impact on orangutans (Barcelos et al., 2015). The conversion of forests into agricultural land, logging activities, and mining operations has drastically reduced the available habitat for orangutans, forcing them into increasingly smaller and isolated areas. The primary threats to orangutan populations in Kalimantan stem from habitat loss driven by agricultural expansion, particularly oil palm plantations, logging, and mining activities. As rainforests are cleared to make way for these industries, orangutans are displaced, leading to increased competition for resources and heightened conflict with humans.
Furthermore, the fragmentation of forests isolates orangutan populations, limiting gene flow and reducing their ability to adapt to environmental changes. Illegal hunting and the pet trade also pose significant threats, with orangutans being targeted for their meat or captured for sale as pets, further decimating their numbers (Galingging et al., 2021). Additionally, forest fires, often deliberately set to clear land for agriculture, can have devastating impacts on orangutan populations, destroying their habitats and directly killing individuals (Dalheimer et al., 2024). Field surveys to monitor orangutan populations along with their habitats and anthropogenic threats such as roads and oil palm plantations is vital for conservation efforts. However, fieldwork in the tropics is challenging due to a variety of factors, including rugged terrain and inaccessible, remote sites, which often have low rates of internet connectivity. 

**My Motivation** - Having spent months conducting fieldwork in the dense rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly on Borneo, I witnessed firsthand the immense logistical and connectivity challenges that conservation teams face on the ground. Navigating rugged landscapes, dealing with unpredictable weather, and working in areas with little to no internet access often made real-time data collection and decision-making nearly impossible. These experiences inspired me to create an offline-first, lightweight, mobile-friendly solution powered by Gemma 3n, ensuring that rangers, researchers, and local communities can access critical information, monitor habitats, and respond to threats, even in the most remote locations, without relying on constant connectivity.

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F6345345%2F3f73ddd83a34c1383bd7f61321941a2e%2FScreenshot%202025-07-26%20at%2011.48.33.png?generation=1753527182190267&alt=media)
                                                                                  Figure 1: Me Doing Fieldwork in Borneo

tagline: AfyaSpeak is an offline, multimodal medical interpreter designed to bridge language barriers in healthcare for rural communities by enab
summary: In many rural and semi-urban areas, effective healthcare is often hindered not by a lack of medical expertise, but by a profound communication gap. Patients struggle to articulate their symptoms in a language understood by caregivers, leading to potential misdiagnoses and ineffective treatments, a challenge compounded by the absence of reliable internet access for online translation. AfyaSpeak addresses this critical issue by providing a private, portable, and multimodal medical interpreter that operates entirely offline. This innovative solution leverages the power of Gemma 3n, efficiently fine-tuned with Unsloth for local dialect and medical vocabulary nuances, and deployed on-device via Google AI Edge. The application facilitates real-time audio-to-audio and audio-to-text interpretation, incorporates visual aids like body diagrams for symptom pointing, and maintains an intelligent local history, ensuring seamless, confidential, and accurate communication between patients and caregivers, even in the most isolated settings.

tagline: Flight Guard AI is an offline real-time system that analyzes cockpit audio for tone, risk, and summaries using a quantized Gemma 3n model.
summary:
Flight Guard AI is a real-time, onboard cockpit voice analysis system designed to detect stress, miscommunication, and potential risks during flight. Its primary purpose is to enhance flight safety by continuously analyzing cockpit audio to identify emotional tone, flag concerning behavior, and generate concise summaries. The system works without requiring internet access.

It is powered by a 4-bit dynamically quantized version of the Gemma 3n language model, optimized for low-resource edge deployment. Because it runs entirely offline, Flight Guard AI is ideal for aircraft environments where privacy, reliability, and autonomy are essential.

Flight Guard processes audio in overlapping time-based segments using a sliding window approach. This ensures context is preserved across chunk boundaries. For each segment, the system detects tone (for example, calm or urgent), assigns a risk level (LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH), and generates a natural-language summary of the ongoing situation.

The output includes structured CSV and JSON files, as well as a visual risk-level plot that can be displayed in real-time dashboards or used in post-flight analysis. Use cases include cockpit risk monitoring, pilot behavior profiling, incident timeline reconstruction, and human factors research.

Built to operate under aviation constraints, Flight Guard AI delivers context-aware safety insights onboard the aircraft in real time without the need for cloud infrastructure.

summary:
CIVIL is an offline-first, AI-powered voice response system that turns any phone call into real-time disaster coordination ‚Äî even when apps and internet fail.

During emergencies, traditional systems break down due to overloaded networks and poor coordination. CIVIL solves this by allowing anyone to call a number, state their location and emergency, and receive immediate help. Using local speech processing and Gemma 3n for decision-making, CIVIL:
1. Detects disaster type and urgency
2. Routes to the correct services (medical, rescue, fire, etc.)
3. Notifies nearby volunteers and NGOs via SMS or radio
4. Provides live safety instructions while help is en route

Built with Twilio, Gemma 3n, and a disaster-specific workflow engine, CIVIL operates on low-power hardware with no dependency on cloud infrastructure mmaking it ideal for refugee camps, remote villages, and disaster zones.

One call. Total coordination. No app, no internet, just a lifeline.

project_title: Graph‚ÄêBased Cost Learning and Gemma 3n for Robotic Sensing
tagline: We train a robot to sense faster in disasters (using Gemma and adaptive cost learning), allowing teams to explore unknown zones ~20% faster.
summary:
**Graph-Based Cost Learning and Gemma 3n for Robotic Sensing - Gemma 3n Impact Challenge**

[**INTRODUCTION (Excerpt From Full Report)**
Robotic exploration in unstructured indoor environments must balance coverage, hazard detection, energy use, and time. Classic frontier-based planners ensure coverage but ignore sensing costs. Modern learned approaches‚Äîdeep Reinforcement Learning, POMDP planners‚Äîadapt to dynamics yet lack safety guarantees and treat scanning as free. While movement can be planned efficiently, each sensing action adds significant overhead, often dominating total mission time. Clearly, scanning time‚Äîthe duration to collect LiDAR, thermal, gas, and audio data‚Äîremains a major caveat hindering speed and efficiency. We introduce a novel, scanning-time‚Äìfirst pipeline built on LeRobot and powered by Gemma 3n. The contributions are as follows:

‚Ä¢ Gemma 3n Plan Generation: Few-shot prompting yields diverse candidate sequences.
‚Ä¢ IGMC Cost Learning: Graph-based matrix completion predicts plan latencies with uncertainty.
‚Ä¢ Contextual Fusion: A lightweight MLP refines predictions with room features in sub-millisecond time.
‚Ä¢ Adaptive Gating: Gemma 3n is selectively called when the cost model is uncertain, minimizing time taken for inference and maximizing Gemma 3n‚Äôs reasoning capabilities.

We show that our approach runs entirely on-device with Gemma 3n‚Äôs on-device capabilities, achieves real-time inference, and delivers a 17% speedup to 95% coverage compared to the baseline (nearest-frontier).]

**-This is an excerpt from the full technical report in the attachments section of this writeup. Please refer to that to understand the architecture, challenges overcome, use of Gemma 3n/LeRobot, and more.**

project_title: SmartKitchen: An On-Device Multimodal Recipe Assistant with Gemma 3n
tagline: SmartKitchen is an on-device multimodal AI assistant that generates personalized recipes from available ingredients to combat food waste and
authors: Jkalwaysontop, Rishi Shah, Mannan Bajaj, Anant Singhal, NEHAL Thakur
summary:
SmartKitchen: A Multimodal Solution for a Sustainable Future

SmartKitchen is a proof-of-concept application designed to showcase the transformative power of the Gemma 3n model. Our project directly addresses the pressing global issue of food waste by providing users with an intuitive and intelligent tool for making the most of the ingredients they already have.

Key Features:

Multimodal Input: Our application can understand a user's intent through multiple modalities. It uses computer vision to identify ingredients from a photo and voice-to-text to transcribe a list of spoken ingredients.

Intelligent Recipe Generation: Powered by Gemma 3n, the app takes the identified ingredients and generates a custom, balanced, and nutritious recipe in real-time.

Privacy-Focused Vision: The project's architecture is a demonstration of how on-device AI can deliver powerful, personalized experiences without compromising user data. Our ultimate vision is a fully offline application that runs entirely on the user's phone, ensuring complete privacy.

Impact:

By seamlessly integrating multimodal AI into the cooking process, SmartKitchen offers a tangible solution to food waste and inspires healthier eating habits. This project provides a compelling vision for a future where on-device AI is a core part of sustainable, everyday life.

project_title: Scram: Offline Multilingual Scam Detection with Gemma 3n
tagline: An offline, multilingual scam detection system for SMS and emails, powered by rule-based prompting and Gemma 3n on mobile
authors: Erfan Mirhosseini, Rishabh, Chaitat Utintu, Parisa Jamadi, Alireza Salemi
summary:
Scram is a privacy-first mobile app that detects scams in SMS and email screenshots across multiple languages ‚Äî all without using the internet. It runs a lightweight Gemma 3n-2B model on-device using MediaPipe and LiteRT, guided by a custom rule-based prompt rubric for scam reasoning. Users simply take a screenshot, and Scram instantly analyzes the text for phishing, financial fraud, or impersonation attempts ‚Äî responding in the same language as the message.

Scram was benchmarked across 5 datasets, including Thai, Spanish, German, and French, and achieves real-time detection (under 5s) with no cloud calls or fine-tuning required. The final deployment uses Gemma-3n-E2B-it-litert-preview, optimized for mobile inference.

project_title: SINGLY: AI-POWERED SPOKEN TEXT TO SIGN LANGUAGE TRANSLATOR FOR THE DEAF
tagline: Singly bridges spoken and sign language by converting speech to simplified text, then to sign videos‚Äîhelping deaf children learn and engage.
summary: Many deaf and mute children continue to face real difficulties in receiving their right to education equally with their peers. These difficulties are often the result of their inability to hear or understand spoken language, while most students are unfamiliar with sign language. This communication gap can lead to feelings of isolation and hinder their ability to participate effectively in the learning process. To help bridge this gap and support better integration, Singly was developed as an assistive system aimed at creating a more inclusive environment for deaf and mute students‚Äîboth in daily life and within the classroom. The system captures spoken audio from users and converts it into text using the Whisper speech recognition engine. This text is then simplified linguistically through the Gemma 3N model to make it easier to comprehend. The final step involves converting the simplified text into sign language videos using pre-trained datasets such as WLASL. By combining speech recognition, language simplification, and sign language rendering, Singly provides a practical and effective solution that improves communication and promotes inclusion. Its goal is to support real-time interaction in educational and social contexts, ensuring that deaf and mute students can engage fully and confidently in their learning journey

It utilizes Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA), 4-bit quantization, and reasoning-enhanced training datasets. This experimental work is part of the broader SoberanIA initiative‚Äîan artificial intelligence (IA) project, that aims to devlop AI built on Portuguese-language data and developed in Brazil. SoberanIA seeks to foster national technological autonomy and digital inclusion, with the goal of optimizing administrative processes, improving government decision-making, and enhancing public services.

üß† AI Desktop Assistant ‚Äî Powered by Gemma 3n & Ollama
This project is an intelligent, locally-run desktop assistant built with PySide6 (Qt for Python) and powered by Gemma 3n via Ollama.

It features a sleek graphical interface where users can:

üí¨ Chat with an AI assistant (Gemma 3n)

üìÑ Ask questions using context from personal documents (via retrieval-augmented generation)

üéôÔ∏è Use voice input and receive spoken responses

üñ•Ô∏è Interact with the operating system, including toggling between dark and light themes

Designed to run entirely on your machine, this assistant emphasizes privacy, performance, and extensibility, making it ideal for productivity, hands-free interaction, or experimentation with local AI workflows. 

Technical Writeup:
This was my first pyside project so I may have missed best practices for some areas.

Top level folders and files:
assets/
this folder includes pngs,svg,fonts used in the project 
core/
this folder contains the main functionality and models for the project which includes the operating system functions it may call. 
logic/
this folder contains the logic for the main chat window. It contains the controllers for interactions between different widgets in the main chat window. it also contains functionality for widgets in the main chat window like the microphone, speaker, etc.
rag_window/ 
this is a completely seperate window with its own widgets, threads and controllers. this is the window that handles accepting files from the user to use in rag search. it also handles parses the files and creating vector embeddings of those files and storing them persistantly
style/
contains qss for the project
threads/ 
contains functions that are to be called on a seperate thread than the main one
user_data/
this folder stores user data like the vector embeddings
util/
this folder contains helpful classes and functions for the entire project like updating the style of the application
widgets/
here contains the main chat window and the widgets inside of it

app.py creates the QApplication object and attribute associated at the application level like styles and icons
main.py runs app.py and starts the main event loop for the program

tagline: Learn My Own Way is an Android app that generates personalized AI courses locally using custom analogies for any topic or uploaded image.
summary:
Learn My Own Way - Personalized AI Education Through Cultural Analogies

An innovative Android application that transforms complex concepts into familiar analogies, making quality STEM education accessible to every student, regardless of location, connectivity, or cultural background.

---

üåç The Global Education Crisis We're Solving

In our interconnected world, education inequality remains one of the most pressing challenges:

- 1.6 billion students** lack access to quality STEM education
- 40% STEM dropout rate** due to abstract concepts being too difficult to grasp
- Rural and remote communities** with limited internet connectivity
- Cultural disconnect** between teaching methods and students' lived experiences
- Learning differences** requiring personalized approaches
- Language barriers** preventing effective knowledge transfer

The Core Problem
Traditional education treats all students the same, using one-size-fits-all explanations that often rely on unfamiliar contexts. A student in rural Bangladesh learning about computer networks through Silicon Valley examples faces an unnecessary cognitive barrier.


üí° Our Revolutionary Solution

Learn My Own Way bridges the gap between complex technical concepts and students' familiar experiences through **AI-powered cultural analogies**. Every explanation adapts to what students already know and understand.

Core Innovation: Cultural Bridge Learning
Instead of forcing students to understand foreign concepts, we translate knowledge into their world:

- Rural farming community? ‚Üí Computer networks become irrigation systems
- Urban sports enthusiast? ‚Üí Database queries become football play strategies  
- Cooking-loving student? ‚Üí Programming functions become recipe instructions
- Music student? ‚Üí Neural networks become orchestra coordination

Key Features

1. üéØ Personalized Analogy Engine
- Cultural Context Detection: Automatically adapts to local knowledge and interests
- Learning Style Recognition: Visual, auditory, kinesthetic learning preferences

2. üì± Complete Offline Functionality
- Zero Internet Dependency: All AI processing happens on-device
- Privacy-First Design: No data ever leaves the student's device
- Works Anywhere: Remote villages, disaster zones, areas with unreliable connectivity
- Instant Response: No network latency or connectivity interruptions

3. üåê Multimodal Learning Experience
- Visual Recognition: Point camera at circuit diagrams ‚Üí instant familiar analogies
- Text-to-Speech: Audio explanations for visually impaired students


 üèóÔ∏è Technical Architecture

Core Technologies Stack
- Platform: Android (Kotlin) with Jetpack Compose UI
- AI Engine: Google Gemma 3n (3B parameter model)
- ML Framework: Google AI Edge SDK with MediaPipe integration
- Storage: Room database for offline content and cultural context profiles
- UI/UX: Material3 Design with accessibility compliance


üåü Conclusion: Democratizing Education Through Cultural Intelligence

Learn My Own Way represents a fundamental shift in how we approach education technology. Instead of forcing students to adapt to technology, we've created technology that adapts to students ‚Äì their culture, their interests, their way of understanding the world.

By combining Google's cutting-edge Gemma 3n AI with deep cultural intelligence and accessibility-first design, we're not just building an app ‚Äì we're building bridges. Bridges between complex technical concepts and familiar human experiences. Bridges between different cultures and universal knowledge. Bridges between educational privilege and educational equity.

Our vision is simple yet profound: Every student, regardless of where they're born or what they know, deserves to understand the technology that shapes our world.Wi th Learn My Own Way, that vision becomes reality.

The future of education isn't one-size-fits-all. It's personal, cultural, and deeply human. It's learning your own way.

project_title: NEURO DERM, a fine tuned Gemma 3n to improve skin cancer detection
tagline: An Unsloth-finetuned Gemma 3N model that analyzes skin lesion images with high accuracy.
summary:
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F27692788%2F356e0a3dab7ac63502e0d67ea2641040%2Fbanner.jpg?generation=1754517252942958&alt=media)


**NEURO DERM: Accelerating Skin Cancer Diagnosis with Unsloth Fine-Tuned Gemma 3N**

![https://youtu.be/9D0wau7fU-Y](https://youtu.be/9D0wau7fU-Y)
**[NEURO DERM video project](https://youtu.be/9D0wau7fU-Y)**

**[Submitted notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/code/punkada/gemma-3n-unsloth-finetune-ham10000)**

**Introduction**

Skin cancer is a significant global health concern, and early, accurate diagnosis is crucial for improving patient outcomes. While dermatologists are highly skilled, access to specialists can be a bottleneck, leading to diagnostic delays. Artificial intelligence, particularly advanced vision-language models, presents a powerful opportunity to augment dermatological analysis.

NEURO DERM is a project that leverages the cutting-edge Gemma 3N model, fine-tuned with the highly efficient Unsloth library, to create a powerful tool for analyzing dermatoscopic images. Our goal is to provide a fast, accurate, and accessible solution that can assist medical professionals and raise awareness about skin lesion characteristics. 


**Methods and Technical Deep Dive: The Power of Unsloth**

The core of NEURO DERM is a Gemma 3N model fine-tuned on the publicly available **HAM10000 ("Human Against Machine with 10000 training images") dataset**. This dataset contains over 10,000 dermatoscopic images of various pigmented skin lesions.

Our fine-tuning process was made possible by the **Unsloth library**. Unsloth's memory-efficient and speed-optimized training methods allowed us to fine-tune the Gemma 3N model on a Kaggle notebook environment, a task that would otherwise be computationally prohibitive. The key technical aspects of our approach are detailed in our training notebook:

*   **Efficient Fine-Tuning with LoRA:** We employed Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) to efficiently adapt the pre-trained Gemma 3N model to our specific task of dermatological image captioning. By using Unsloth, we were able to train the model with achieving a balance between accuracy and preventing overfitting.
*   **Optimized Training:** The entire training process, from data preprocessing to model training and evaluation, is documented in our comprehensive Kaggle notebook. The use of Unsloth resulted in a significant reduction in memory usage and training time, making the project feasible and reproducible.

The fine-tuned LoRA adapters for this model are publicly available on Hugging Face: **[aka-selvas/gemma3n-finetuned-skincancer](https://huggingface.co/aka-selvas/gemma3n-finetuned-skincancer)**


**Performance and Evaluation: High-Fidelity Analysis**

To validate the effectiveness of our fine-tuned model, we conducted a rigorous evaluation against a held-out test set from the HAM10000 dataset. The model was tasked with generating descriptive captions for the dermatoscopic images, which were then compared against ground-truth descriptions. The results demonstrate the model's high level of accuracy and its ability to capture the nuanced details of the skin lesions:

*   **BLEU Score:** 0.8251
*   **ROUGE-L Score:** 0.9080
*   **METEOR Score:** 0.9122
*   **BERTScore (F1):** 0.9770

These outstanding scores, particularly the high BERTScore, indicate that the model's generated descriptions are not only syntactically correct but also semantically very close to the expert-provided ground truth.

You can try the Performance and Evaluation yourself through our Kaggle notebook: **[Gemma-3N Unsloth Evaluation](https://www.kaggle.com/code/punkada/gemma-3n-unsloth-ham10000-evaluation)**


**NEURO DERM: The Application**

To make our powerful model accessible and user-friendly, we developed  **NEURO DERM**, a web-based application built with Gradio. Our initial goal was to deploy the model on-device using a framework like Google AI Edge, leveraging Gemma 3N's inherent design for mobile and edge computing. However, while the base Gemma 3N model is optimized for such deployments, a clear and established pipeline for deploying fine-tuned versions with LoRA adapters does not yet exist. In light of this current technical limitation, we opted for a Gradio web app as the most effective way to showcase the model's capabilities. We are actively monitoring developments and are fully committed to migrating NEURO DERM to a true on-device application as soon as the Google team provides a supported pathway for deploying fine-tuned models.

You can try the NEURO DERM application yourself through our Kaggle notebook: **[Gemma-3N Unsloth LoRA Adapter running at Gradio](https://www.kaggle.com/code/punkada/gemma-3n-unsloth-lora-adapeter-gradio)**

NEURO DERM application screenshot running with gradio
![NEURO DERM application screenshot running with gradio](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F27692788%2F7f858b5a31787ec9c9497ee7f91efcd7%2F2.jpg?generation=1754522375865118&alt=media)


**Broader Context and Future Work**

Our work is inspired by the growing body of research on the application of AI in dermatology, such as the work by Mahmoud & Soliman (2024) on automated skin cancer detection systems and the review by Brancaccio et al. (2024) on the reality of AI in skin cancer diagnosis. While NEURO DERM is not a medical device, it serves as a powerful proof-of-concept for how Unsloth-accelerated fine-tuning can create specialized AI tools for the medical field.

Currently, deploying the fine-tuned Gemma 3N model directly on mobile devices presents challenges. However, we are confident that as the technology evolves, on-device deployment will become feasible, further increasing the accessibility of tools like NEURO DERM.


**Conclusion**

The NEURO DERM project successfully demonstrates the creation of a high-performing, specialized vision-language model for dermatological image analysis, made possible through the efficiency of Unsloth. By fine-tuning Gemma 3N on a targeted dataset, we have developed a tool that is not only accurate but also accessible through a user-friendly web application. We believe this project exemplifies the power of Gemma 3n + Unsloth and public datasets to enable impactful and innovative AI solutions.

tagline: On-device AI camping & wildlife survival companion
summary:
About **88 million** U.S. households now identify as campers, and **~54 million** households took a trip last year

National parks run **thousands of search-and-rescue** operations every year (e.g., ~3,400 in 2022), and research shows **tens of thousands of people were lost** in parks over the 2004‚Äì2014 decade.

First aid, navigation, shelter, and water skills reduce risk and help you protect others. That‚Äôs why I built Gemma Scout: an **on-device, privacy-first AI assistant** built for wilderness survival and outdoor adventures. Powered by a finetuned version of Gemma 3N, it combines domain-specific survival knowledge with real-time multimodal reasoning to guide users through critical tasks like plant identification, mushroom safety, shelter building, and first aid.

The model was trained on over **30 million tokens** and **7,618 curated Q&A pairs**, sourced from expert handbooks and image datasets of edible plants and mushrooms. Leveraging Unsloth‚Äôs optimized finetuning framework with LoRA and quantization, Gemma Scout runs efficiently on mobile devices without internet access.

Using LLM evaluations, Gemma Scout outperformed its base model in survival QA by a win rate of **89%**, and achieved over **36% improvement** in mushroom classification and **47%** in plant identification. It supports multimodal chat via llama.cpp mtmd and Swift integration, enabling users to send images and receive grounded, expert-level responses‚Äîcompletely serverless.

Whether you're camping, hiking, or lost in the wild, Gemma Scout helps you make smart, safe decisions‚Äîeven when you're off the grid.
