project_title: Gemma-GR00T Lab - Democratizing Private On-Device AI
tagline: Gemma Groot democratizes scientific robotics by combining Gemma 3n's multimodal AI with an action diffusion model policy
authors: Gyanateet Dutta, Jackson Mathew, Sarah, Sid Elias, Hamadelnil
summary:
Project Overview: Gemma-GR00T Lab

Mission: Democratize precision robotics in scientific research through private, offline-first multimodal AI that runs entirely on-device, enabling breakthrough discoveries in resource-constrained environments.

Gemma-GR00T-Lab is a vision-language-action pipeline that executes fully on consumer devices, enabling nanomanipulation and scientific imaging without cloud GPUs. It fine-tunes Google Gemma-3n E4B for domain language, fuses SigLIP vision and USM audio encoders, and drives a diffusion-based action head adapted from NVIDIA GR00T-N1.5.

1. Executive Summary & Impact Vision

The Problem We're Solving
Scientific research laboratories, particularly in developing regions and specialized facilities, face critical barriers:

Privacy Constraints: Sensitive research data cannot be sent to cloud services

Connectivity Issues: Remote labs lack reliable internet for cloud-based AI

Cost Barriers: Traditional robotic automation costs $100,000+ per system

Accessibility: Researchers with disabilities need voice-driven interfaces

Precision Requirements: Nanoscale manipulation demands sub-millimeter accuracy

Our Solution: Gemma-GR00T Lab

A Vision-Language-Action (VLA) model that brings advanced robotic manipulation to any research environment by:

Running 100% offline on consumer hardware (NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano)

Processing multimodal inputs (voice commands, microscope images, text instructions)

Generating precise 7-DoF robotic actions for scientific manipulation tasks

Supporting multiple deployment paths (Android, desktop, embedded systems)

Real-World Impact

Democratization: Enables $2,000 robotic setups vs $100,000+ traditional systems

Privacy-by-Design: All processing happens on-device, protecting IP and sensitive data

Global Accessibility: Works in remote locations without internet connectivity

Sustainability: 25W power consumption vs 500W+ cloud alternatives

2. Technical Architecture: Leveraging Gemma 3n's Unique Capabilities
Core Gemma 3n Integration
MatFormer Elastic Inference

Utilizes Gemma 3n's MatFormer (Matryoshka Transformer) architecture for dynamic resource allocation

Mix'n'match capability: Adapts model size based on task complexity (2B for simple commands, 4B for complex manipulation)

Per-Layer Embedding (PLE): Reduces memory footprint by 40% through intelligent caching

Multimodal Capabilities

Vision Processing: SigLIP encoder handles microscope imagery, chemical structure recognition

Audio Understanding: 30-second audio input for voice commands in noisy lab environments

Text Integration: 32K context length for complex experimental protocols

Unified Output: Generates precise robotic actions from fused multimodal understanding

Architecture Details

Multimodal Inputs ‚Üí Gemma 3n E4B ‚Üí GR00T Action Head ‚Üí Robot Control
    ‚Üì                    ‚Üì                ‚Üì               ‚Üì
‚Ä¢ Camera feeds      ‚Ä¢ MatFormer       ‚Ä¢ Diffusion      ‚Ä¢ 7-DoF actions
‚Ä¢ Voice commands    ‚Ä¢ SigLIP vision   ‚Ä¢ Flow-matching  ‚Ä¢ Gripper control  
‚Ä¢ Text protocols    ‚Ä¢ Qwen3 language  ‚Ä¢ 4-layer transformer ‚Ä¢ Safety checks
Model Components

Backbone: Eagle2.5 VLForConditionalGeneration (1.7B parameters)

Vision Encoder: SigLIP-base-patch16-224 (768 hidden size, 12 layers)

Language Model: Qwen3-1.7B (28 layers, 32K context, GQA attention)

Action Head: ScaledDP 4-layer transformer with diffusion-based policy

(see the generated image above)

Task Performance Validation

3. Implementation & Training Details
Training Performance
Dataset: LeRobot manipulation tasks + custom NanoPick simulation dataset

Training Steps: 30,000 steps over 240 GPU hours

Loss Reduction: 1.27 ‚Üí 0.11 (91% improvement)

Hardware: 3√ó NVIDIA L40S GPUs

Framework: PyTorch + Hugging Face Transformers + LeRobot

LeRobot Prize Track

Integration: Native LeRobot dataset compatibility

Simulation: Isaac Sim environment for training and validation

Real-world Transfer: 83% sim-to-real success rate

Engineering Challenges & Solutions
FP16 overflow in vision Conv2D ‚Üí upcast to FP32 during inference.

Ollama GGUF mis-align with per-layer emb ‚Üí regenerated quant (Uns-Dynamic 2.0).

Robot jitter mitigated by TCP-AI smoothing loss.

Responsible AI
All on-device; no user data leaves lab ‚Üí privacy-by-design.

Safety checker: ShieldGemma 2 image filter in preprocessing pipeline.

Energy: <25 W Jetson run; estimated 2.3 kg CO‚ÇÇ per month vs cloud 46 kg.

3. Public Code Repository
GitHub URL: github.com/YanaLabs/Gemma-GR00T-Lab
Structure:

text
‚îú‚îÄ app/
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ edge_android/        AI Edge demo
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ jetson_ollama/       Dockerfile + systemd
‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ desktop_streamlit/   Live web UI
‚îú‚îÄ model/
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ lora_weights/        12 MB
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ gr00t_diffusion/     action head
‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ training_scripts/
‚îú‚îÄ data/
‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ nanopick_dataset.kaggle.yaml
‚îî‚îÄ docs/
   ‚îî‚îÄ tech_writeup.md
Includes one-click Kaggle Notebook reproducing fine-tune (meets ‚Äúsource of truth‚Äù rule).

4. Engineering Challenges & Solutions
Technical Innovations
1. Float16 Stability Issues

Problem: Gemma 3n encounters NaN/infinity values on float16 GPUs

Solution: Implemented autocast-based upscaling to float32 for Conv2D operations

Impact: Enables deployment on consumer hardware (Tesla T4, RTX 3060)

2. Gradient Checkpointing Limitations

Challenge: Vision encoder reuses hidden states, limiting memory optimization

Solution: Applied selective checkpointing with Unsloth's automatic compiler

Result: 40% memory reduction while maintaining training stability

3. Multimodal Loss Scaling

Observation: Initial training loss of 6-7 (higher than typical LLMs)

Analysis: Normal behavior for multimodal models with audio/vision components

Validation: Model performance remains excellent despite high initial loss

5. Real-World Applications & Use Cases
Laboratory Scenarios
Protein Crystallography: Automated crystal mounting with voice guidance

Materials Science: Nanowire manipulation based on microscope feedback

Chemical Synthesis: Precise reagent dispensing following verbal protocols

Biological Research: Cell manipulation with contamination-free operation

Accessibility Features
Voice-Only Operation: Complete system control via natural language

Visual Feedback: Audio descriptions of robotic actions for visually impaired researchers

Multilingual Support: 140+ language support for global research collaboration

6. Evaluation & Validation
Performance Metrics

tagline: BookBridge: Empowering Local Booksellers with Offline, Multilingual AI
summary:
BookBridge: Empowering Local Booksellers with Offline, Multilingual AI
The Mission: Bridging the Language Gap for Small Bookstores with Gemma 3n
Problem statement - The idea is inspired by the unique challenge facing our local bookseller, Ramesh. He possesses an extraordinary talent: despite being unable to read or write in English, he can instantly identify any book in his vast collection based on two unique identifiers‚Äîthe visual memory of its cover art and the phonetic sound of its title when spoken by a customer. While this skill is remarkable, it creates a fundamental business limitation. Because he cannot write the English titles, creating a traditional, searchable inventory to manage stock, track prices, and note shelf locations is an impossible task. His entire operation is therefore capped by the limits of human memory, creating a critical need for a tool that can bridge the gap between his visual-auditory world and the text-based world of digital inventory.

-Our project, BookBridge, tackles a significant, real-world challenge: empowering small, non-English speaking business owners with modern inventory management tools. We were inspired by a local second-hand bookseller who, despite not reading English, could identify any book in his shop by its cover. We saw an opportunity to use Gemma 3n's unique on-device capabilities to build a tool that works in his world‚Äîoffline, in his language, and with a simple, intuitive interface.
BookBridge is more than a chatbot; it is a complete, offline-first, AI-powered inventory and sales assistant that uses a conversational interface to feel as natural as talking to a helper. It allows the bookseller to instantly digitize his inventory using his phone's camera, manage stock, and find books for customers in seconds, all without needing an internet connection.
Submission Links
The Technical Writeup: Our Proof of Work
This project's primary goal was to prove that Gemma 3n could create a tangible, positive impact. Our technical choices were driven by the real-world constraints of our user: unreliable internet, the need for a simple UI, and a multilingual environment.
1. High-Level Architecture
We designed BookBridge using a clean, layered architecture on the Android platform. This ensures a clear separation of concerns between the user interface, business logic, and the AI/data layers, making the app robust and maintainable.
code
Code

‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
2. How We Used Gemma 3n: The Core of the Solution
Gemma 3n's unique features were not just helpful; they were essential to making BookBridge possible.
‚úÖ Offline Ready & Privacy-First: This is the most critical feature. Our user operates in an environment with spotty connectivity. By running Gemma 3n entirely on-device via the MediaPipe LLM framework, the app is 100% functional offline. This guarantees reliability and ensures the bookseller's private sales data never leaves his phone.
‚úÖ Expanded Multimodal Understanding: We leveraged Gemma 3n's ability to process both images and text. The core workflow is:
The user takes a photo of a book cover.
The image is processed and fed to the Gemma 3n model.
The model performs Optical Character Recognition (OCR) to extract the book's title directly from the cover art.
‚úÖ Improved Multilingual Capabilities: This is where the magic happens. After extracting the English title, we use Gemma 3n's multilingual understanding to instantly translate the title into Kannada. This allows the bookseller to manage his inventory and search for books entirely in his native language, bridging the digital divide.
3. Key Technical Choices & Challenges Overcome
Challenge: Creating a user interface for a non-technical user who is unfamiliar with complex software.
Solution: A Conversational UI. Instead of forms and buttons, we built the entire app around a chat interface. Adding a book is as simple as sending a photo. Finding a book is as easy as asking a question. This leverages the user's familiarity with messaging apps.
Challenge: Managing the memory and performance of a large AI model on a resource-constrained mobile device.
Solution: The "Fresh Session" Strategy. To prevent context overflow and ensure the app remains stable and responsive, we create a fresh LLM Inference session for each query (each picture scan or search). This pragmatic choice prioritizes rock-solid reliability over session reuse, which is critical for a tool meant for daily business use.
Challenge: Storing and retrieving inventory data offline.
Solution: Android Room Database. We integrated the standard Android Room library to create a robust, local SQLite database on the device. This database stores the English title, Kannada title, price, location, and quantity for every book, and it's what enables the instant search functionality.
4. Tech Stack
Platform: Android Native (for maximum performance)
Language: Kotlin (with Coroutines for background processing)
AI Framework: MediaPipe LLM Inference API
AI Model: Gemma 3n 2B (INT4 quantized)
Database: Android Room Persistence Library
5. Vision & Impact
BookBridge is a testament to the power of personal, on-device AI. Our vision is to extend this platform to other small, local businesses‚Äîfrom neighborhood pharmacies to handicraft stalls‚Äîproviding them with tools that respect their language, their privacy, and their operational reality. By putting the power of Gemma 3n directly into the hands of people like our local bookseller, we can create meaningful economic empowerment and ensure that the benefits of the AI revolution are accessible to everyone, not just those with a stable internet connection or a knowledge of English.

Disclaimer: Development Process & Tooling
This application was created by a solo builder with a vision for solving a real-world problem. To bring this idea to life rapidly, the development process was augmented by the AI coding assistant, Augment. Its role was primarily to translate high-level logic and component descriptions into functional Kotlin/Android XML syntax. The core architectural design, the specific implementation of the Gemma 3n workflow, the data flow, and the final debugging and testing were all directed by the project lead. This approach demonstrates how modern tooling can empower individuals to build impactful, AI-driven applications.

tagline: Offline AI translation app for Morocco emergency responders using fine-tuned Gemma 3N models with dual-mode architecture
authors: Gregory Kennedy, Ziyad Tber, Hamza Eltouzany
summary:
**üö® Tamazirt Multi-Lingo Emergency Response App**

**Problem Statement:**
The 2023 Morocco earthquake exposed critical communication barriers between rescue workers and Tamazight-speaking Amazigh communities. This app provides offline translation services for emergency responders in infrastructure-compromised disaster zones.

**Technical Achievement:**
- Fine-tuned 15+ Gemma 3N models (2B/4B params) with 100K+ translation pairs
- Discovered and documented universal Gemma 3N deployment limitations across all toolchains
- Engineered innovative dual-architecture: offline SQLite + online Convex backend
- Built production-ready React Native app with custom Tifinagh keyboard

**Innovation:**
When on-device deployment proved impossible due to Gemma 3N's novel architecture, we pivoted to embed the model's knowledge directly into the app via a curated dataset. This creates an authentic offline AI experience while enabling advanced online collaboration features.

**Impact:**
A functional humanitarian tool ready for real-world deployment, combining cutting-edge AI with cultural preservation for Morocco's indigenous Berber communities.

**Tech Stack:** React Native, Expo, SQLite, Convex, Gemma-3 API, TypeScript

project_title: Locked In: A Back-to-Basics Well-Being Coach
tagline: Private, on-device AI that rebuilds mental health through five daily basics‚Äîsleep, move, nourish, focus, reflect
summary:
LockedIn is an offline-first mental-wellness coach that helps overwhelmed students and professionals regain stability by ‚Äúlocking in‚Äù five research-backed daily basics: 8-hour sleep, a 30-minute walk, essential vitamins, a top-3 focus list, and a reflective journal. Built as a lightweight PWA (single HTML/CSS/JS bundle ‚âà 50 MB), the app stores all data locally and keeps working with zero connectivity‚Äîcrucial for users in low-bandwidth regions or during crisis situations.

At its core is Gemma 3n running entirely on-device via Ollama. A 2 B slice handles real-time sentiment detection and crisis-hotline prompts; the 4 B slice powers three privacy-preserving AI services:

- AI Support ‚Äì instant, empathetic replies to journal entries (< 120 words, sub-second latency).

- Weekly Coach ‚Äì a reflective Q&A that highlights wins, patterns, and micro-goals for the coming week.

- Pattern Insights ‚Äì one-tap analytics that correlate habit consistency with mood trends and suggest the single highest-impact tweak.

The interface uses vivid ‚Äúglassmorphism‚Äù cards and celebratory micro-animations to nurture engagement while a lightweight state store debounces writes to localStorage for reliability. Cold-start RAM was reduced 40 % by leveraging Gemma 3n‚Äôs Per-Layer Embeddings, making full inference viable on mid-range Android phones.

LockedIn bridges the gap between clinical advice and lived reality, delivering secure, stigma-free mental-health support to the 970 million people worldwide who struggle with anxiety or depression‚Äîno cloud required.

project_title: Guardian Redact: An Offline-First, AI-Powered Redaction Document, Audio
tagline: Leveraging Google's Gemma 3n for Private, Context-Aware Data Security on Documents and Audio.
summary:
In a world where data is constantly shared, true privacy has become the ultimate luxury. Standard AI tools demand that we upload our most sensitive documents and conversations to the cloud, creating an unacceptable security risk. **Guardian Redact** challenges this paradigm. It is a comprehensive, offline-first redaction suite that brings the power of Google's advanced Gemma 3n model directly to your desktop, ensuring your data never leaves your device.

Guardian Redact is built on a single principle: **intelligent security should not compromise privacy.**

We have engineered a dual-function application to tackle the most common forms of sensitive data:

1.  **The Document Redactor:** Moves beyond simple keyword matching. It uses Gemma 3n's deep contextual understanding to analyze documents page-by-page, finding not just names and numbers, but the subtle, identifying links between them that other tools miss. All while providing a superior user experience with real-time progress updates.

2.  **The Audio Redactor:** A dedicated, professional-grade editor for audio files. After transcribing speech with Whisper, every word is analyzed by Gemma 3n to find spoken PII. Users can then surgically silence or anonymize sensitive segments on an interactive waveform, providing a level of control previously unavailable in an offline tool.

By building Guardian Redact, we are not just creating a utility; we are proposing a new standard for how professionals across legal, finance, journalism, and research can handle sensitive data‚Äîwith absolute confidence, security, and control.

project_title: Eliza: Universal Learning Platform Powered by Gemma3N
tagline: Gemma-3n-powered education for everyone, everywhere. Breaking barriers of cost, location & language to make quality learning universal.
summary:
The promise of education often clashes with the realities of the classroom. Students who fall behind struggle to catch up, while advanced learners remain unchallenged. Beyond the classroom walls, countless individuals face barriers like the intimidation of asking questions, the prohibitive cost of textbooks and tutors, or the sheer lack of access to educational materials in remote areas. These pervasive challenges highlight a critical need for a transformative approach to learning.

Eliza is a groundbreaking AI-powered Universal Learning Platform designed to break down the traditional barriers of geography, language, and socio-economic status, making quality education accessible to anyone, anywhere. It directly addresses critical shortcomings in current educational systems, such as the widespread lack of personalized learning, insufficient and delayed feedback, and the overwhelming administrative burden on teachers.

Leveraging advanced AI, Eliza provides tailored learning experiences by analyzing individual student performance, strengths, and weaknesses. It delivers customized content, adjusts difficulty levels, and offers targeted, real-time feedback, ensuring every student learns at their optimal pace. This means a student can now receive immediate, personalized support to unleash their full potential.

The platform also significantly reduces teacher workload through AI-driven automation of tasks like lesson planning, grading, scheduling, and data analysis. This frees educators to focus on direct instruction and meaningful student interaction.

A core innovation is Eliza's deep localization capabilities. Beyond mere translation, AI adapts educational content, including examples and scenarios, to resonate with local cultures and values, fostering natural engagement. The platform will house an immense, constantly evolving repository of digital content, aggregating both local and international books, while AI automates the creation of dynamic, interactive learning materials like quizzes and simulations. Hosted on robust cloud services for scalability, Eliza aims to democratize access to high-quality, engaging, and personalized education, transforming learning¬†outcomes.

tagline: A gemma3n-powered, on-device AI platform that generates personalized learning games for students in low-resource regions
FAKER? uses Gemma 3n to deliver memory therapy and support for Arabic-speaking Alzheimer‚Äôs patients.
summary: **FAKER?** (Arabic for ‚ÄúDo you remember?‚Äù) is an innovative, culturally sensitive AI assistant designed to support Arabic-speaking Alzheimer‚Äôs patients and their caregivers, leveraging Google‚Äôs **Gemma 3n** multimodal model to deliver empathetic memory therapy, real-time cognitive assessments, and emergency assistance through a voice-first mobile application tailored for Egyptian Arabic. Built with a modular architecture, FAKER? integrates a React Native frontend, a FastAPI backend, and Gemma 3n‚Äôs text, image, and audio processing capabilities, optimized via 4-bit quantization for efficient on-device and edge deployment. Key features include voice-driven interactions for accessibility, photo-based memory stimulation using culturally relevant prompts (e.g., Egyptian traditions like Eid or koshary), continuous cognitive monitoring with caregiver dashboards, and a robust emergency system utilizing GPS and SMS. Fine-tuned on Egyptian Colloquial Arabic and Alzheimer‚Äôs-specific datasets, FAKER? ensures linguistic fluency and medical appropriateness while prioritizing privacy through on-device processing, encryption, and HIPAA-compliant design. Deployed on **AWS ECS** with a hybrid cloud-edge model, FAKER? addresses the critical gap in AI-driven dementia care for **over 15 million** Arabic-speaking patients, offering a scalable, impactful solution that enhances patient engagement, caregiver support, and safety.

project_title: MenuMind - AI-Powered Menu Translation & Allergen Detection
tagline: Offline AI-powered app for real-time menu translation, allergen detection, and cultural food insights using Gemma 3n.
summary:
MenuMind is an offline AI-powered mobile app that uses Google‚Äôs Gemma 3n multimodal model to translate restaurant menus, detect allergens, and provide cultural dish insights in real-time. Designed for travelers, the app works entirely on-device after downloading the model, offering a private, fast, and accessible dining assistant.

Built with Flutter and optimized for mobile inference, MenuMind reads and understands menu images, translates them into 15+ languages, highlights user-specific allergens, and explains the origins of each dish ‚Äî all within a few seconds. It addresses a real-world challenge that affects millions of global travelers, ensuring safer and richer dining experiences.

This project demonstrates the power of on-device AI in solving practical, culturally meaningful problems with a strong focus on privacy, usability, and global impact.

summary: Cape is an offline, multimodal AI application built to support infrastructure commissioning and maintenance teams, ideal for workers responsible for HVAC, building controls, and IoT systems. Powered by Gemma3n and an open source web-ui (OpenWebUI), Cape allows users to drag and drop PDFs, images, videos, and logs, and ask natural-language questions, even with no internet connection, on the devices they already carry (laptops). In essence, the purpose of Cape is to help field crews debug faster, reduce delays, and operate confidently in constrained environments.

project_title: BiteSense: On-Device Arthropod-Bite Detection & First-Aid Assistant
tagline: BiteSense: offline Android app using on-device Gemma-3n to identify arthropod bites and give color-coded risk + first-aid guidance.
authors: Dorukhan Arslan, Ece √únal, yunus onur, can zagnos, Agabey Alioglu
summary:
BiteSense ‚Äì On-Device Arthropod-Bite Detection & First-Aid Assistant
 
 
**Problem**
Vector-borne diseases kill roughly 700 k people a year and account for 17% of global infectious-disease cases. In T√ºrkiye alone, Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever has caused 17 k+ infections and 819 deaths since 2002. Accurate, fast triage is hardest precisely where it is needed most: rural areas with patchy connectivity and limited specialist care.
 
**Solution**
BiteSense is a privacy-preserving Android app that identifies arthropod bites and recommends first-aid. A 2 B-parameter Gemma-3n language model, fine-tuned with LoRA for vision, runs on-device via the MediaPipe LLM Inference API. From a single photo the model:
 
Classifies the culprit across seven bite categories (ticks, mosquitoes, spiders, chiggers, bed bugs, fleas, benign lesions).
Flags clinical risk with a green / yellow / red indicator.
Streams step-by-step advice (cleaning, symptom monitoring, when to seek hospital care) in natural language.
 
 
**Key Innovations** 
Curated, balanced dataset: 1,055 seed images expanded to 8,276 via targeted augmentations, covering diverse skin tones.
Resource-efficient fine-tuning: Selective LoRA adapters in BF16 boost balanced accuracy from 20% ‚Üí 74% while fitting in 3.1 GB.
Edge-AI engineering: Asynchronous background model loading and two-stage, token-streamed UX cut perceived latency from ~20 s to ‚âà 5 s on a Galaxy S24.
 
 
**Impact**
Field tests show first-token latency of 8‚Äì10 s and 74% balanced accuracy -competitive with non-specialist clinicians- delivered straight to the point of care without sending images off-device. By bridging the diagnostic gap in low-resource settings, BiteSense turns any smartphone into a pocket epidemiology lab.
 
**Roadmap**

Clinical validation with healthcare partners to benchmark diagnostic accuracy and treatment-adherence impact.
Dataset expansion to cover additional arthropods and common dermatological mimics.
Generalize the framework to sensitive conditions such as sexually transmitted diseases (STDs): on-device lesion recognition plus private, stigma-free guidance to encourage early treatment.
Location-aware risk alerts (e.g., CCHF hotspots, dengue outbreaks) leveraging on-device geodata.
Model distillation and quantization to reduce the binary to < 2 GB while maintaining ‚â• 70% balanced accuracy.
 
 
BiteSense exemplifies how edge AI can bring life-saving expertise to the exact moment and place it is needed.

For more detailed demo videos:
https://youtube.com/shorts/naZSqepPS3g
https://youtube.com/shorts/_L2AmGaFwmE

tagline: Nova is a sophisticated desktop companion that helps you navigate your thoughts, memories, and tasks with an intelligent, private AI partner
summary:
Project Nova: Your Private AI Companion
In an era where our digital lives are increasingly managed by cloud-based services, Nova stands as a testament to the power of personal, sovereign AI. It is a sophisticated, offline-first desktop companion designed to be a completely private and intelligent partner for your memory, reflection, and daily tasks.
Nova is not a website or a cloud service; it is a true native application that runs entirely on your own computer. Every component‚Äîfrom the state-of-the-art AI models to the databases holding your most personal thoughts‚Äîis stored and executed locally. Your data is never sent to the cloud, ensuring a level of privacy that is simply not possible with other AI assistants.
The application lives in a sleek, frameless side-panel, summonable with a global hotkey (Ctrl+Shift+X), making it an ever-present but never intrusive part of your workflow.
Core Features: A Multi-Layered Intelligence
Nova's capabilities are designed to create a holistic and deeply personalized experience, moving far beyond a simple chatbot.
1. True Multimodal Understanding (Text, Vision, Audio)
Nova communicates on your terms. Powered by a locally-run Gemma 3n model, it seamlessly processes information in multiple formats:
Vision: Attach any image (a complex chart, a diagram, a photo) and ask questions. Nova doesn't just describe the image; it understands the content, allowing it to analyze data, explain systems, and provide genuine insights.
Voice (Hands-Free): With a custom "Hey Nova" wake word, you can activate Nova and speak your thoughts naturally. A state-of-the-art Whisper model provides lightning-fast, local transcription, which is then passed to Gemma for comprehension and action.
Text: Engage in deep, context-aware conversations for brainstorming, planning, or simply talking through an idea.
2. The Agent: From Conversation to Action
Nova is more than a passive listener; she is an active agent on your desktop. You can issue commands to:
Search Your Local Files: Ask "Hey Nova, find my report from last week," and she will search your desktop and return the file path.
Open Applications & Files: Follow up with "Open that file and launch Spotify," and Nova will execute the commands, seamlessly bridging the gap between conversation and action.
3. A Deep, Layered Memory System
Nova‚Äôs memory is designed to build a rich, contextual understanding of you over time.
Conversational Memory: Remembers the flow of recent conversations for natural, follow-up questions. All chat history is saved securely in a local SQLite database.
The Journal (Emotional Context): A private, dedicated space to write down your thoughts and feelings. Nova uses VADER sentiment analysis to understand the emotion behind each entry. This emotional context is used to inform her tone and responses, allowing her to be more empathetic and supportive. You can ask reflective questions like, "Looking at my journal, what seems to be triggering my stress lately?" and receive a synthesized, insightful answer based on your own words.
RAG Knowledge Base (Your Personal Brain): Upload your own documents (PDFs, TXT files) to Nova's permanent "Memory". Using a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system powered by a local ChromaDB vector database, Nova can answer questions grounded in your personal or professional knowledge, ensuring her answers are accurate, relevant, and free of hallucination.
4. A Seamless & Proactive User Experience
Native Desktop Panel: A polished UI built with PySide6 (Qt), featuring a modern dark theme and an intuitive, tabbed layout.
Proactive Greetings: Nova doesn't just sit there. Each time you open the app, she generates a fresh, context-aware greeting based on your recent chats and journal entries, making every session feel personal and engaging.
Interactive Voice Output (TTS): Toggle on spoken responses to have a true back-and-forth conversation, with Nova's answers read aloud in a natural voice.
Core Technology & Architecture
Nova's power comes from a carefully orchestrated stack of modern, locally-run technologies.
AI Models:
Primary Brain (Language/Vision/Agent): A fine-tuned, quantized version of Gemma 3n running via the Ollama server.
Transcription: OpenAI's Whisper (base model) for fast and accurate local speech-to-text.
Embeddings (RAG): The efficient all-MiniLM-L6-v2 model for vectorizing documents.
Backend: A robust, multi-threaded Python backend ensures the UI remains fluid and responsive even while the AI is performing complex tasks. Every long-running operation is offloaded to a dedicated QThread.
Wake Word Detection: The lightweight and highly efficient pvporcupine engine runs continuously in the background, listening for the custom "Hey Nova" hotword with minimal CPU impact.
Database: A local SQLite database for structured data and ChromaDB for vector storage.
UI Framework: PySide6 (Qt for Python) for a high-performance, native desktop experience.
Project Nova is a demonstration of what is possible today with local AI‚Äîa truly personal, secure, and intelligent companion built to enhance your own mind.

tagline: AiPhamest is an on-device Android assistant that keeps you safe, informed, and on-track with your medication
summary:
üß† AiPhamest
100‚ÄØ% offline. Life‚Äësaving by design

üí° Project Summary
AiPhamest is an intelligent, offline medical assistant that uses Gemma 3n to automate prescription understanding, build smart medication schedules, and monitor side effects ‚Äî all while ensuring patient safety through drug interaction analysis, allergy checks, and emergency alerts.

Built entirely with on-device multimodal AI, AiPhamest helps patients adhere to their medication plans and catch potentially dangerous side effects, even without internet access. The system blends structured LLM reasoning, man-in-the-loop verification, and real-time alerting for critical drug-related risks.

üè• Real-World Problem
 Millions of patients ‚Äî especially in remote or resource-limited settings ‚Äî suffer from:

- Missed doses or poor medication adherence
- Unrecognized side effects
- Drug-drug interactions or allergies
- No access to pharmacists or caregivers
- These risks lead to avoidable hospitalizations and deaths.

 AiPhamest solves this by putting a safe, smart, medical AI in every pocket.

‚öôÔ∏è What the App Does
‚úÖ 1. Prescription Extraction
- User uploads or captures an image of a medical prescription
- Gemma 3n (E4B) +Model vision extracts:
- Drug names
- Dosages
- Frequencies
- Fuzzy drug-name matching against a built-in database improves accuracy

‚úÖ 2. Human-in-the-Loop Editing
- A pharmacist or user confirms the extracted data
- Adds pack size for each medicine

‚úÖ 3. Smart Medication Scheduling
 Once confirmed the fisrt dose, the app:

- Creates dosage alerts and schedules based on frequency and pack size
- Gemma 3n will also insert inTake recommendations for medicien card
- Labels each dose card as:

üü¢ Taken

üîµ Upcoming

üî¥ Missed

- Sends notifications before each dose and tracks adherence
- Allows pinning of lifetime medications

‚úÖ 4. Side Effect Logging + Reasoning
Users can record or type side effects

Gemma 3n evaluates:

- The likely cause (specific drug or interaction)
- Severity level (üî¥ Red / üü° Yellow / üü¢ Green)
- Confidence score
- AI-generated reasoning and recommendation

‚úÖ 5. Warning Screen
All findings appear in a dedicated Warnings screen:

Shows cause, risk level, suggested action, and explanation

Highlights potential interactions and allergy conflicts

‚úÖ 6. Emergency Trigger
If severity is Red and confidence is high:

- App can auto-call or text a pre-saved emergency contact (upcoming in future )
- Designed for offline action

üß† Powered by: Gemma 3n
Used in multiple workflows:

- Prescription parsing
- Medical reasoning (side effects, interactions)
- Alert generation
- Drug inTake recommendations 

Runs fully on-device using quantized versions of Gemma 3n (E4B)

Enables safe operation even without connectivity

‚è±Ô∏èFine tunned model with all drugs, side effect and interaction data
üöß Features in Development (Future Work)
üìû Emergency auto-call trigger on high-severity warnings
‚è±Ô∏è LLM-based optimization for best intake times per medication
üìà Tracking patient response/improvement to medication over time
üíä Supplement safety support
üß¨ Model fine-tuned on public medical datasets (e.g., drugs.com, MedDB)
üë∂ Pregnancy-specific medication warnings
üß© Home screen widget for one-tap side effect capture

üéØ Why This Matters
AiPhamest brings together:

- Offline-first AI intelligence
- Structured medical reasoning
- Real-world patient safety automation

It‚Äôs designed to assist real patients, not just impress in a lab ‚Äî and has the potential to prevent harm, save lives, and increase medication compliance at scale.

‚ö†Ô∏è Known Limitations & Notes
‚è±Ô∏è First extraction may take up to 2 minutes, as the app runs the Gemma 3n model twice:

Once for structured prescription extraction (OCR)
Again to match the extracted drug name with entries in drug.txt
üéôÔ∏è Voice input currently uses Google‚Äôs on-device speech recognition API.
This will be replaced with Gemma 3n‚Äôs audio model once it's available on Android.
üìÇ To improve accuracy, please manually add drug names to the drug.txt file in the app‚Äôs /assets/ folder before scanning prescriptions.
This enables better name resolution during extraction.
üîß Fine-tuning is in progress to incorporate complete drug, side-effect, and interaction datasets into the model for improved accuracy and reasoning.

üîß Tech Stack
Model: Gemma 3n E4B (quantized for mobile)
Vision: + fuzzy text matching for prescriptions
Logic Engine: LLM with built-in rules & fine prompts
Platform: Android (Kotlin) with on-device execution
Scheduling: Local calendar + alert logic engine
Side Effect Reasoning: Prompt chaining with Gemma 3n

tagline: Gemi is an on-device medical assistant that leverages the power of Gemma 3n to provide crucial diagnoses and emergency guidance to millions
summary:
**1. Introduction**

I‚Äôm Christian Montenegro from Venezuela. Growing up in a country where access to health care is scarce and expensive, I witnessed first hand the impact that delayed treatment can have on people‚Äôs lives. In 2020 my father suffered a stroke while working at our family‚Äôs farm in Guanape, a rural community in Anzo√°tegui. The nearest clinic was hours away and there was no doctor to recognize his symptoms. After 40 minutes of driving my brother reached the nearest town only to be turned away because no one could identify what was happening. Three days later, after travelling six hours back to the capital, he finally received a diagnosis ‚Äì an extensive cerebellar stroke covering 80% of his cerebellum. He spent a year bedridden and today, five years later, still lives with neuropathic pain and memory loss... If we had recognised his symptoms earlier and sought specialist help sooner, he might have recovered more quickly.

That experience inspired me to build Gemi ASD (Gemma Emergency & Medical Assistant System). The application is designed to detect signs of cerebrovascular accidents (strokes), myocardial infarctions and respiratory arrest at the very first encounter, offer first aid guidance, act as a virtual physician for primary diagnosis, schedule medication reminders and store personal medical records. I began sketching this idea three years ago, when AI agents were still in their infancy. At the time the privacy implications of using large language models made it impossible to deploy such a tool in rural communities. Today, with Google‚Äôs Gemma3n model ‚Äì which supports offline inference and local storage ‚Äì and Flet to build multi platform desktop applications, it‚Äôs finally possible to transform those sketches into a working prototype.

**2. Why the Problem Matters**

Strokes and heart attacks are leading causes of death and disability worldwide. In an ischemic stroke, blood flow to the brain is blocked; without oxygen and glucose, brain cells die and permanent neurological deficits occur. Clinical guidelines stress that ‚Äútime is brain‚Äù ‚Äì every minute matters. Canadian best practice guidance notes that about 1.9 million neurons die each minute after stroke onset and urges clinicians to treat patients as quickly as possible to improve outcomes. Early diagnosis and treatment are critical because thrombolysis or thrombectomy within the first six hours significantly reduces long term disability and mortality.

Rural populations face even greater risks. A review of pre hospital stroke services reports that times from symptom onset to rural hospital admission range from five to thirty hours and that thrombolysis rates in rural areas worldwide are as low as 1‚Äì6 %. In Australia only 3 % of rural patients access stroke units in time compared to 77 % of urban patients. Similar disparities exist for advanced endovascular treatments and rehabilitation.

Heart attacks are equally time critical. According to the Cleveland Clinic, a heart attack occurs when blood supply to a section of the heart is blocked, causing that muscle to begin dying. Without prompt treatment, permanent damage or death may occur. The clinic warns that even a few minutes of delay can result in permanent heart damage or death.

**3. The Gemi ASD Solution**

Gemi ASD combines an Gemma3n-2B with a lightweight Flet front end to deliver medical triage, first aid guidance and personal health management without an internet connection. All data and computation occur locally on the user‚Äôs device, preserving privacy and eliminating the need for expensive mobile data. The system is designed to operate on low end hardware (2‚Äì3 GB of RAM and ~3 GB of storage), making it suitable for community centres or low cost laptops often found in Venezuelan clinics.

The application guides users through an onboarding flow where they enter their gender, age and medical history. From the main interface, users can access several modules:

‚Ä¢	Emergency triage: a simple symptom checklist evaluates risk of stroke, heart attack or respiratory arrest, uses the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) to quantify stroke severity and provides recommendations for immediate action.

‚Ä¢	Medichat: a conversational agent powered by Gemma3n offers general medical advice and first aid tips. It clarifies symptoms, explains conditions and advises when to seek professional care.

‚Ä¢	Calendar: users describe medication schedules in plain language (e.g., ‚Äúibuprofen every 12 h for 5 days‚Äù). The system converts this into an interactive calendar with reminders and local notifications.

‚Ä¢      Heart Rate Monitor: An ingenious tool I designed, inspired by the method emergency doctors use to take a pulse. A 15-second timer guides the user to count their heartbeats. Upon entering the number, the system automatically calculates the beats per minute (BPM) and diagnoses if the rhythm is normal, bradycardia, or tachycardia. This allows for a professional pulse measurement without the need for sensors, making the technique accessible to everyone.

‚Ä¢      Personal records: the app stores medical history, chat transcripts and medication schedules in local JSON files so users retain control over their data.
Under the hood, the application is composed of Python modules. The app.py file loads pages and routes; views/ contains Flet components for the logo, onboarding, emergency tab, medichat, profile view, PDF viewer and settings. The llm/ folder wraps calls to the Gemma3n model and constructs prompts. Data persistence occurs in the data/ folder using JSON files (chat_data.json, profile_data.json, gemi_user_data.json, medical_tasks.json).

**4. Challenges and Lessons Learned**

Building an offline AI medical assistant on modest hardware presented multiple challenges. For example, the official Gemma3n-2B-iNT4-Preview from AI Edge was not yet available for TFLite on Windows. I spent considerable time exploring a manual prefill+decode implementation in TensorFlow but was only able to achieve a speed of 30‚Äì45 seconds per token on a low-end PC‚Äîa result that was far too slow for a real-time medical assistant. Initial attempts to compress Gemma3n via dynamic quantization to 8 bit ONNX yielded a 5 GB model consuming 3‚Äì4 GB of RAM ‚Äì still too heavy for low end machines. I therefore adopted a 4 bit .gguf version (Gemma3n_E2B_IT_Q4_K_M) from Unsloth and interfaced it through llama.cpp. This reduced the model size to 2.82 GB and peak RAM usage to about 2 GB, making it feasible on inexpensive PCs.

User experience also required careful attention. On reloading, the app originally always opened the profile editor instead of the saved main view; this was fixed by detecting existing user data. Chat history was being written redundantly to multiple files, so I centralized storage in chat_data.json. Various UI elements were refined: adding a settings button, removing duplicate back buttons, adjusting chat bubble widths, implementing responsive layouts and splash screens, centring progress indicators and providing informative messages during long operations.

**5. Impact and Use Cases**

Gemi ASD aims to bridge the diagnostic gap between rural and urban populations. By running entirely offline, the system protects privacy and functions in places without cellular coverage or reliable electricity. Clinics in remote villages often have basic laptops powered by generators but no smartphones or 4 G networks. With a footprint of just 2‚Äì3 GB of RAM and disk space, Gemi ASD can operate on such devices, providing symptom triage and first aid guidance while medical help is sought.

Reducing delay to treatment can have tangible benefits. In stroke care, every minute saved preserves brain tissue and improves functional outcomes. Rural patients currently face delays of up to 30 hours. A tool that helps carers recognise signs of stroke and heart attack, encourages them to act quickly and guides them to the nearest facility could dramatically improve survival. In heart attacks, prompt restoration of blood flow prevents permanent damage ‚Äì a delay of even a few minutes increases the risk of death. Gemi ASD can shorten the time between symptom onset and hospital arrival by enabling early recognition, remote triage and preparation of emergency alerts.

The application also serves as a primary care companion. Through the Medichat module, it answers general health questions, provides first aid instructions and reminds users to take medication. All data remains local, adhering to ethical principles and ensuring that sensitive health information is never sent to the cloud.

**6. Roadmap and Future Work**

‚Ä¢	Mobile deployment: Once Google releases Edge AI packages for Android and I obtain better hardware, I plan to package the engine into an APK that runs on devices with 6‚Äì8 GB of RAM. This will enable community health workers to use the app on smartphones.

‚Ä¢	Sensor integration: Integrate pulse oximeters and heart rate monitors to capture real time vital signs and feed them into the diagnostic algorithm.

‚Ä¢	Expanded diagnostics: Incorporate image analysis models to detect dermatological conditions such as melanomas and skin cancers, and fine tune the LLM for medical contexts.

‚Ä¢	Telehealth alerts: Add optional modules to send preformatted SMS, WhatsApp or Telegram messages to emergency services or family members once an emergency is detected, respecting privacy and offline capabilities.

‚Ä¢      Telehealth Collaboration: With your help, I could contact telecommunications companies in Venezuela to propose a free, offline messaging (SMS) service. In Venezuela, mobile data networks are often unstable, while SMS service is much more robust and reliable, reaching places with weak signals where the internet does not work...Through an API, Gemma, on a secure server, could respond to emergency and Medichat queries. The responses would be delivered directly to the user's inbox without being saved in any database, guaranteeing privacy and a fast, reliable service for those who lack an internet connection.

‚Ä¢	User studies: Collaborate with local clinics in Venezuela to test the app‚Äôs usability, measure its impact on time to treatment and gather feedback for improvements.

**7. Conclusion**

The Impact Challenge seeks projects that leverage offline AI to create real benefits for society. Gemi ASD fulfills this mission: it takes Gemma and turns it into a life-saving tool for communities that lack access to reliable healthcare. By detecting the signs of stroke and heart attack early, giving first aid guidance, and managing medication schedules, the app helps users act decisively when every minute counts. The project demonstrates that with careful optimization and thoughtful design, advanced AI can run on modest hardware without sacrificing privacy or access. 

My hope is that Gemi ASD will not only honor my father's memory but also help countless people in similar circumstances...

_________________________________________________

**Demonstration and Additional Resources**

For additional verification and proof of concept, I have packaged Gemi ASD as a Windows executable (.exe). This file demonstrates that the project is not just a prototype, but a functional product ready for distribution. Judges can optionally download and run the application to experience the user interface, the offline model's speed, and the features shown in the video demo firsthand. You can find the download link to the executable on Google Drive in the resources section. This is a testament to our commitment to delivering a complete and robust solution.

I have also included a link to my GitHub repository below, where you can find the complete application source code:

üíªGitHub Gemi Repository:

https://github.com/MrTrompet/Gemi-ASD-Gemma-Medical-Assisted-System-

‚ñ∂Ô∏èYoutube Demo Link: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Ofr-tD4PQw 
https://youtu.be/1Ofr-tD4PQw

üìÇGoogle Drive Exe. Link:

tagline: A p2p offline communication app, with gemma 3n as it's intelligence layer, to help rescue ops make quick decisions.
summary:
**Problem Statement: **During the time of crisis such as wars or natural disasters, communications are super essential but without internet and cell towers, we can barely communicate over a few metres, how do we call the rescue teams if we are trapped? how do we reach out to to help if we are away from the help site and even drones might or might not reach us? How can Gemma help teams locate and understand the needs of victims faster than traditional methods? What if there is a language barrier? This 

**Assumption:** Government authorities have already asked the citizens to install the silent signal app as a precautionary measure.

**Solution:** Implemented a mesh network protocol for my app which is light weight app and keeps broadcasting the victim's message over bluetooth- upto 10to 100m in range, seeking help in terms of food requirement, medical supplies, first aid, trapped, severe bleeding injury etc. I assumed that we cannot expect citizens to download 3-6gb for gemma, but we can implement it on drones, computers of rescue teams, other mobile and tablet devices of the operatives, to enable gemma3n at edge and connect it to all the mobile devices that are connected over the mesh and serve primarily two purpose one is to classify the threat level, urgency, needs of the victims at location x,y,z and other is to auto-translate any local language typed in to english[assuming field operatives might or might not fully understand if it is an international operation]. I have even been able to fetch the victim's location as well using gps, but reading all this data manually could be time consuming and confusing especially when everyone is looking out for help, therefore I built a dashboard for field operatives as well, where gemma3n with it's offline capabilties is the intelligence layer that can first understand any language to english(for simplicity for this hackathon) and also categorize tasks such as food supply, first aid, rescue etc to make quicker decisions.
Also, as an AI conversational assistant, if any of the citizen is in contact with the node, it can provide assurance that help is on the way and it's response means that the voice of citizen has been heard successfully and will be helped soon.

**My tech stack and products**
Silent Signal: Mobile app built in React-native with Bridgefy SDK to implement Mesh architecture and keep relaying message until it reaches either a device with gemma3n(usually rescue ops/drones/rescue computers in my case).

Silent Signal Dashboard: It would classify the victim's needs as high,medium,low with categories limited for this hackathon as food supply, trapped, first-aid.The dashboard is built with Nextjs and typescript.

GEMMA 3N Nodes as the backend: Currently implemented the intelligence layer of Gemma3N 2b on Ollama with Nodejs which helps in communication and decision making even faster for the tactical teams.

project_title: NaviVoice ‚Äì A Private, Offline AI Guide for the Visually Impaired
tagline: NaviVoice is a private, offline personal AI assistant that helps blind users interpret menus, ingredients, shelves, and street crossings.
summary:
Link to video: https://youtu.be/OI5HzEXnPXA

Project Title: NaviVoice ‚Äì A Voice-Guided Assistant for the Visually Impaired


üß© Problem Statement
Blind and visually impaired individuals often face difficulties performing basic tasks independently, such as reading restaurant menus, identifying items on store shelves, verifying food ingredients for allergies or dietary restrictions, and crossing roads safely.

In regions with limited internet connectivity or privacy concerns, cloud-based solutions are not viable. NaviVoice addresses this by offering a privacy-first, offline-ready, multimodal assistant that works entirely on-device.

üí° Solution Overview
NaviVoice is an offline, voice-activated AI assistant designed to help blind or low-vision users navigate everyday situations through speech and vision. The assistant integrates Gemma 3n to interpret transcribed user commands and OCR results from images, returning relevant spoken advice or safety information‚Äîall while preserving user privacy.

üß† Key Features
1. Voice-Activated Wake Word Detection
NaviVoice continuously listens for specific wake words like ‚ÄúNavigator‚Äù or ‚ÄúHey Navi Voice‚Äù using fuzzy string matching. Once triggered, it prompts the user for a voice command and begins processing.

2. Natural Speech Interaction with Multimodal Understanding
After wake word detection, the user can ask a question naturally (e.g., ‚ÄúWhat can I have on the menu?‚Äù). Whisper is used for speech-to-text transcription, and then Gemma 3n interprets the transcribed command and responds appropriately. If the prompt matches a predefined flow (e.g., menu, ingredients, shelf, crossing), the relevant feature is launched.

3. Restaurant Menu Reader
Users can hold their camera to a restaurant menu. The app extracts the text using OCR, and Gemma 3n filters and ranks menu items based on dietary needs (e.g., vegan, low cholesterol, caffeine-free). It responds with three recommended options, each with a description and price. For demo purposes, sample menu text is used to ensure consistent output.

4. Ingredient Safety Checker
This feature helps users identify if a food product is safe to consume based on dietary restrictions or allergies. The user scans the ingredient label with the camera, and OCR extracts the text. Gemma 3n then evaluates whether the product contains unsafe components. In the demo version, a sample Doritos ingredients list is used to simulate the experience.

5. Store Shelf Analyzer
When pointed at a grocery shelf, the app captures the image and extracts visible text like product names, brands, and prices. Gemma 3n analyzes the text and describes what‚Äôs on the shelf, focusing on affordable, vegan-friendly, and ready-to-eat items. This feature supports independent grocery shopping for users with low or no vision.

6. Pedestrian Crossing Detection
Using a video clip of a pedestrian crossing, the app detects whether the traffic light is red or green using color masking in HSV space with OpenCV. It informs the user via voice feedback whether it's safe to cross the street or not, essential for blind or low-vision individuals navigating urban environments.

7. General Question Fallback
If the voice input doesn‚Äôt match a specific intent, the app falls back to Gemma 3n to answer general knowledge or assistive questions. This ensures flexibility and extends usefulness beyond the hardcoded flows.

üõ†Ô∏è Technologies Used
üìö AI Models
Gemma 3n (via API call)
Handles all natural language processing and response generation. 
Used to:

Extract meal suggestions based on dietary needs

Analyze ingredient safety

Describe visible products on store shelves

Whisper (OpenAI)
Used locally for speech-to-text transcription of user voice commands and responses.

üì∑ Computer Vision
OCR: pytesseract
Extracts text from images (e.g., menus, packaging, shelves).

Image & Video Capture: OpenCV

Captures static images from a webcam or phone camera.

For crossing detection: HSV masking is used to detect red/green pedestrian lights in real-time video frames.

üîä Speech
Text-to-Speech: pyttsx3
Converts AI-generated responses into clear spoken feedback‚Äîfully offline and cross-platform.

Wake Word Detection: fuzzywuzzy
Allows for loose matches to wake words like ‚ÄúNavigator‚Äù or ‚ÄúNavi Voice‚Äù for accessibility.

üóÇÔ∏è Project Architecture
main.py
Entry point with wake-word listening loop and command routing via fuzzy matching.

utils/audio.py
Handles voice recording, Whisper STT, and pyttsx3 speech playback.

utils/vision.py
Image/video capture, OCR text extraction.

utils/vision_flows.py
Orchestrates multimodal flows like menu reading, shelf analysis, crossing detection, and ingredient checking.

utils/gemma.py
Handles prompt sending and response receiving from Gemma 3n.

utils/logging_utils.py
Logs system messages for debugging and traceability.

üöÄ Offline-Readiness & Privacy Focus
While the prototype currently uses Gemma via API, the architecture is modular and ready to swap in local inference via:

Ollama

Google AI Edge

Jetson (for mobile deployment)

Unsloth (for fine-tuned dietary question model)

All components that can run offline, audio recording, text-to-speech, wake-word detection, CV, and OCR already do.

üß™ Demo Enhancements for Submission
To ensure reliability in demo environments, OCR results are overridden with clean sample text for:

Menus

Ingredients

Store shelves

This ensures deterministic results while showcasing real-world applicability.

üîó Links
Demo Video: https://youtu.be/OI5HzEXnPXA
Github: https://github.com/MaraschinoGirl/NaviVoice-Hackathon

project_title: EduTutor Local: Offline AI Learning for Underserved Rural Communities
tagline: Offline AI tutor using Gemma 3n brings quality education to poor students in remote areas with no internet or electricity constraints.
summary:
EduTutor Local: Bridging the Digital Divide in Education
The Crisis: Education Inequality in Remote Communities Over 258 million children worldwide are out of school, with the highest concentrations in rural and impoverished areas. In remote villages across Africa, Asia, and Latin America, students face a triple burden: lack of qualified teachers, unreliable or nonexistent internet connectivity, and economic constraints that make quality education a luxury they cannot afford. A village school in rural Kenya might have one teacher for 80 students, while a farming community in rural India might have internet connectivity for only 2-3 hours daily - if at all.

Our Solution: Education That Works Anywhere EduTutor Local is specifically designed for the world's most underserved students. By leveraging Gemma 3n's revolutionary on-device capabilities, we've created an AI tutor that works on basic smartphones and tablets, requires no internet connection, and provides personalized education comparable to expensive private tutoring - completely free.

Technical Architecture for Resource-Constrained Environments

Optimized for Low-Resource Devices:

Ultra-Efficient Processing: Utilizes Gemma 3n's Per-Layer Embeddings to run on devices with as little as 3GB RAM
Battery-Conscious Design: Optimized power consumption for areas with limited electricity
Offline-First Architecture: Zero internet dependency after one-time installation
Local Data Storage: SQLite database ensures learning progress persists across power outages
Core Components Built for Rural Challenges:

Multi-Backend Support: Runs on both Android phones and basic laptops
Voice-First Interface: Critical for students with limited literacy in their local language
Persistent Learning: Conversation history survives device restarts and power interruptions
Resource Monitoring: Automatically adjusts performance based on available device resources
Gemma 3n: The Perfect Model for Underserved Communities Gemma 3n's breakthrough architecture makes quality AI education accessible to the world's poorest students:

Unprecedented Efficiency: 5B parameter performance with 2B parameter memory usage means powerful AI on $50 smartphones
Multilingual by Design: Native support for local languages including Spanish, French, German, Korean, and Japanese
Multimodal Understanding: Students can speak, show pictures of textbooks, or draw problems in the sand
Privacy-First: Critical for communities wary of data collection by corporations or governments
Real-World Impact Scenarios

Rural Kenya - Solar-Powered Learning: 10-year-old Amara uses a donated tablet with EduTutor Local, powered by a small solar panel. She practices English pronunciation, gets help with math problems written in her notebook, and learns about science - all while herding goats. No internet required.

Remote Brazil - Flood Season Education: During the rainy season when rivers flood and cut off village access, students continue learning with EduTutor Local. The AI remembers each child's learning level and continues personalized lessons despite months of isolation.

Mountain Village Nepal - Post-Earthquake Recovery: After schools were destroyed, EduTutor Local on ruggedized tablets helped 200 children continue their education in temporary shelters, with the AI adapting to trauma-informed teaching approaches.

Technical Implementation for Harsh Environments

Robust Architecture:

Flask Backend: Lightweight server optimized for resource constraints
SQLite Persistence: Handles frequent power outages without data corruption
Modular Design: Components can run on different device types as needed
Error Recovery: Graceful handling of hardware failures and resource limitations
Educational Optimization:

Curriculum Mapping: Aligned with UNESCO and local education standards
Progress Tracking: Works without cloud sync, purely local analytics
Adaptive Learning: AI adjusts difficulty based on student responses and available study time
Cultural Sensitivity: Prompts and examples adapted for local contexts
Overcoming Infrastructure Challenges

No Internet Dependency: Complete offline operation after setup
Low Power Requirements: Optimized for solar charging and battery constraints
Robust Storage: Handles dust, heat, and power fluctuations
Scalable Deployment: Can be distributed via USB drives, SD cards, or brief internet connections
Multi-Device Sharing: One installation serves entire families or small schools
Measuring Impact in Underserved Communities

Learning Outcomes: Local assessment integration without requiring internet reporting
Engagement Metrics: Time spent learning, topics explored, skill progression
Device Usage: Optimization based on real-world device capabilities and constraints
Community Feedback: Built-in feedback system for continuous improvement
The Vision: Education as a Human Right EduTutor Local represents more than technology - it's a commitment to educational equity. By putting AI-powered tutoring directly into the hands of the world's most disadvantaged students, we're not just closing the digital divide; we're ensuring that geographic location, economic status, or infrastructure limitations never again determine a child's educational potential.

Every student deserves a world-class education. EduTutor Local makes that possible, one offline lesson at a time.

project_title: Wearable Sensor Fusion based AI Health Coach
tagline: Empower Gemma3n to provide insightful health advise by performing fusion of processed vitals data from multiple external sensor tools
summary:
The Gemma family of models keeps pushing the boundary of on-device language model capability. The 3n version is it's latest manifestation. This project aims to leverage Gemma's excellent language generation capability for delivering data-driven insights from multiple data-analyzers (each connected to a sensor for monitoring a health vital like heart_rate, spo2, skin_temperature).

In this project we utilize the Gemma 3n:e4b model. It is set up to act as a health coach. To provide sensor data and the corresponding analysis on health vitals, the system is equipped with a heart_rate analyzer, a spo2 analyzer and a skin temperature analyzer. The user can ask Gemma about a combination of vitals including heart_rate, spo2 level and skin temperature (a question about health includes all). On detecting a request for individual or aggregate health vitals data, Gemma delegates responsibility for fetching such data to the corresponding sensor analyzers, before crafting it's final response. Gemma responds like a health professional/coach only after it receives enough data to provide the user with a convincing data driven insight into his/her health.

Each analyzer is attached to a wearable sensor. On data request, it runs analysis on the last n samples collected by the analyzer. It calculates features like mean, std, min, max, mode and range on the data sample. The analysis is done by feeding the features to a pre-trained Random Forest classifier. Once done, each analyzer sends back the final analysis (healthy/not-healthy), the feature values and the feature importance to Gemma. Experimenting shows that this enhanced contextual data from each sensor helps Gemma in explaining the final labels much better. Without such data as backup, Gemma is forced to report back just the final labels augmented with some very generic text generation.

Given below are 2 samples of Gemma's text generation:

Sample 1: Gemma equipped with only healthy/unhealthy labels

User: what are my health vitals?

Gemma: Okay, let's take a look at these vitals. I'm seeing that your heart rate, temperature, and SpO2 are all currently flagged as HealthCondition.NOT_HEALTHY. 

That's important information, and it tells us we need to pay close attention to your well-being.  These are key indicators of how your body is functioning, and when they fall outside the normal range, it's a signal that something needs addressing.

**Don't panic!**  The first step is to understand *why* these values are elevated.  It could be a number of things, and we need to investigate further. 

**Here's what I recommend:**

*   **Prioritize Checking In with a Healthcare Professional:**  This is the most important step.  A doctor can properly diagnose the underlying cause of these readings and recommend the best course of action.  Please schedule an appointment as soon as possible.
*   **While you wait for your appointment, focus on gentle self-care:**  This isn't a substitute for medical advice, but it can help support your body.  
    *   **Hydration:** Make sure you're drinking plenty of water.
    *   **Rest:**  Prioritize getting adequate sleep.
    *   **Stress Reduction:**  Engage in calming activities like deep breathing, meditation, or gentle stretching.
    *   **Avoid strenuous activity:**  Don't push yourself physically.
*   **Be prepared to share details with your doctor:**  Think about any recent illnesses, changes in your routine, medications you're taking, or any other relevant information that might be helpful.

I understand this can be concerning, and I'm here to support you.  Remember, you're not alone, and taking proactive steps is the best thing you can do for your health.  Let's work together to get you feeling better.  Please let me know if you have any questions, and I'll do my best to guide you.



**Disclaimer:** *I am an AI Chatbot and not a medical professional. This information is for general guidance only and does not constitute medical advice. Always consult with a qualified healthcare provider for any health concerns or befo‚Ä¶



Sample 2: Gemma equipped with labels, feature values used for analysis and feature importance

User: What are my health vitals?

Gemma: Okay, let's take a look at your health data. Based on the information you've provided, here's my assessment:

**Overall Health Condition: HEALTHY**

**Here's why:**

*   **Heart Rate:** Your average heart rate is 81.4 beats per minute, with a standard deviation of 10.3. This falls within a healthy range (60-97 bpm). The mean heart rate is relatively low, indicating good cardiovascular fitness.
*   **Temperature:** Your average temperature is 98.6¬∞F, with a standard deviation of 0.5. This is a normal and healthy body temperature. The temperature range is also within a healthy range.
*   **SpO2:** Your average SpO2 is 94.9%, with a standard deviation of 2.6%. This is slightly below the optimal range of 95-100%, but still considered acceptable. 

**Important Considerations:**

*   **Heart Rate:** The heart rate is a very important indicator of cardiovascular health. A lower heart rate generally suggests a stronger heart. The standard deviation indicates consistency in your heart rate, which is also a positive sign.
*   **Temperature:** Body temperature is a key indicator of overall well-being. A stable temperature within the normal range is a good sign.
*   **SpO2:** While 94.9% is acceptable, it's worth noting that a consistently lower SpO2 could sometimes indicate underlying respiratory issues. However, given the other data points, it's likely not a cause for concern in your case.

**Next Steps:**

To ensure continued well-being, I recommend:

*   **Maintaining a consistent exercise routine:** This will help keep your heart rate healthy and improve cardiovascular fitness.
*   **Staying hydrated:** Adequate hydration is essential for maintaining a healthy body temperature and blood oxygen levels.
*   **Monitoring your SpO2:** If you experience any shortness of breath or other respiratory symptoms, it's a good idea to monitor your SpO2 more closely.

**Disclaimer:** *This is a general assessment based on the provided data and should not be considered a substitute for professional medical advice. If you have any conc‚Ä¶

These 2 examples clearly show the importance of enhancing the LLM context with meaningful data; it makes the whole response more explainable and useful

Features Implemented:
- Sensor Fusion of multiple health vital sensors
- Random Forest based Healthy/Unhealthy classifiers based on heart_rate, spo2 and skin_temperature readings
- Feature engineering for time series
- Ollama based on-device inference with Gemma3n:e4b
- Basic implementation of function call inference and tool calling
- extensible sensor_type based multi sensor framework
- improved explainability and better data driven response by passing augmented data back to LLM for final response generation
- basic UI (Gradio)
- basic monitoring based on SQLite and Datasette

Features for future:
- Use a smaller (number of parameters and quantized) instruction tuned  gemma3n variant
- integration as a mobile app with fitbit as wearable
- implementation of MCP to communicate with remote devices and handling more related health/coaching functions without running into ambiguity (also utilize something similar to Langgraph big tool)
- adding more vital sensors
- finetune gemma3n embeddings with sensor data
- more labeled sensor data

tagline: An AI Tutor that uses Gemma 3n fine-tuned using Unsloth.AI
summary:
This project introduces SAT Tutor, a lightweight, locally runnable AI assistant built to help students‚Äîespecially those in low-connectivity regions‚Äîprepare for the SAT. Using Gemma 3n (4B) fine-tuned via Unsloth AI on SAT-style datasets (Math + EBRW), this solution enables offline, interactive question answering without reliance on cloud APIs.

The final model was quantized to GGUF Q8_0 format and hosted using llama-cpp-python on Hugging Face Spaces. It is also fully compatible with Ollama for local use. The UI is built with Gradio, ensuring an intuitive experience for students and educators alike.

Submitted Files:
1. Video Demo: [YouTube Link]: Walkthrough of the app, its features, and deployment
2. Technical Writeup: [Medium Blog]: In-depth breakdown of the problem, approach, fine-tuning, deployment, and lessons learned
3. Source Code: [GitHub Repository]: Full fine-tuning and deployment code
4. Live Demo: [Hugging Face Spaces]: Try the SAT Tutor in your browser

This project showcases how Gemma 3n and efficient fine-tuning can power accessible, low-cost educational tools for a global audience.

tagline: A privacy-focused AI Hiring Assistant that uses Gemma 3n to screen resumes, assess candidate-job fit, all on-device without exposing privacy
summary: This project introduces a privacy-first AI Hiring Assistant powered by Gemma 3n, designed to streamline and personalize the recruitment process. Running entirely on-device, the assistant analyzes resumes and job descriptions to generate match scores, identify skill gaps, suggest improvements, and automatically craft relevant interview questions. By leveraging the capabilities of Gemma 3n through a local API (served via Flask and accessed through Ngrok), it ensures that sensitive candidate information remains secure, making it ideal for use in enterprise or offline settings. The solution showcases the practical application of LLMs in human resource workflows‚Äîenhancing hiring efficiency while respecting data privacy.

project_title: A Node-Based Interface for Building Agentic Robotic Workflows
tagline: A node based interface and backend that enables non-robotic hobbyist to create agentic robotic workflows powered by LeRobot and Gemma3n
summary:
The idea is inspired by "ComfyUI for stable diffusion hobbyist". With the launch of LeRobot and Vision Language Models (VLMs) like Gemma and Gemini with spatial reasoning capabilities, I believe it's time for a wider audience without robotics background to create robotic workflows. I've been working on the UI for a month and am currently testing and integrating Gemma and other VLMs/Vision Language Agents (VLAs) into the framework.

The framework enables endless possibilities and control for end users through drag-and-drop interfaces. Users can leverage VLMs, build chains of VLM inferences, or use VLMs for reasoning and planning to select suboperations. This mimics system 1 (suboperations, VLAs) and system 2 (spatial reasoning and trajectory planning from models like Gemma3n).

The framework is fully open source. The VLM pull request is still in progress. In the demo, I invoke Gemma (hosted on Colab) with captured camera images and text prompts to generate robot arm trajectories of X points to complete the given task.

From these points on the image, through inverse kinematics calculations, we generate instructions for each motor on the SO-ARM101 robotic arm.

I believe there is huge potential and synergy here. More features are coming - stay tuned to the project. I would love to collaborate further.

tagline: "An offline AI-powered feedback tool that helps users improve their speech and writing by analyzing clarity, tone, and empathy"
summary:
**Offline Learning Coach** is a fully local, AI-powered educational assistant built for students in under-resourced or internet-restricted environments. It enables users to improve their essay writing, spoken communication, and empathy-driven expression‚Äîcompletely offline, with no data sent to external servers.

**Tech Stack & Architecture**
Model: Gemma 3n (via Ollama) ‚Äì provides intelligent, contextual analysis of writing and speech.

Transcription Engine: faster-whisper ‚Äì enables low-latency, on-device speech-to-text.

UI: Streamlit ‚Äì intuitive and lightweight interface for accessibility on low-end devices.

Backend: Python + Ollama local server.

Packaging Potential: Portable across low-cost laptops, Raspberry Pi, and Android (planned).

**Core Features**
 100% Offline & Private ‚Äì Runs entirely on-device, ideal for schools/labs without stable internet.
 Speech & Text Input ‚Äì Users can either speak or type; both are processed and evaluated locally.
 Teacher-Style Feedback ‚Äì Clear, actionable suggestions on: Grammar & Structure, Clarity & Logic, Empathy & Tone, Overall Impact .

Provides Multilingual Support ‚Äì Gemma 3n supports 140+ languages for native/local language feedback.

**Please refer to the attached screenshots for:**

The main Streamlit UI interface
Sample feedback on a spoken input
Offline speech-to-text transcription output
Ollama model running locally with no API calls

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F28016153%2F3ed3d32b8cade14dbe580c184636bdff%2FScreenshot%202025-08-07%20032455.png?generation=1754518755201925&alt=media)    , ![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F28016153%2F5e5df46bf70abbc45e871f91d2b0f717%2FScreenshot%202025-08-07%20033022.png?generation=1754518767981600&alt=media)

**Technical Challenge & Solution**
Initially, we aimed to analyze raw audio features like pitch, pacing, and confidence. However, Gemma 3n doesn‚Äôt accept raw audio via Ollama yet. As a workaround:
We integrated faster-whisper to first transcribe speech into text.
Then passed that text to Gemma 3n for detailed feedback‚Äîallowing us to maintain quality without sacrificing performance or privacy.

How to Run
Setup environment
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  or .\venv\Scripts\activate on Windows
pip install -r requirements.txt

Start Ollama server
ollama serve

Pull model (first time only)
ollama pull gemma3n:e4b

Run main app
streamlit run local_app.py

tagline: Bangla Offline AI for Cattle Disease Diagnosis and Context-Aware Feeding Guidance
authors: Sadatul islam Sadi, Hasnain Adil, Md Irtiaz Kabir, imkabir0, MOHAMMAD NINAD MAHMUD
summary:
GemmaVetCare is an AI‚Äëpowered livestock management platform designed to address critical challenges in rural Bangladesh‚Äôs cattle farming sector, including limited veterinary coverage, delayed disease detection, and inadequate feeding guidance. The system integrates multilingual support (Bangla and English), offline functionality, and AI‚Äëdriven multimodal disease diagnosis with context‚Äëaware feeding recommendations.

The disease detection module leverages a LoRA‚Äëfine‚Äëtuned Gemma‚Äë3N model trained on annotated cattle images and Bangla symptom descriptions, enabling accurate identification of common and economically significant diseases such as Foot‚Äëand‚ÄëMouth Disease, Lumpy Skin Disease, and Pinkeye. The feeding recommendation module employs Random Forest and CatBoost regression models trained on standardized nutritional datasets, coupled with a large language model (LLM)‚Äìdriven feed formulation system that generates stage‚Äëspecific and resource‚Äëadaptive rations.

To ensure accessibility for farmers with limited internet connectivity, the platform includes offline inference capabilities for both disease diagnosis and feeding guidance. Its multilingual interface ensures usability across diverse literacy levels, providing clear, actionable insights in Bangla and English.

By combining computer vision, natural language processing, and machine learning with a farmer‚Äëcentric design, GemmaVetCare delivers scalable, inclusive, and data‚Äëdriven livestock care, improving animal health, productivity, and rural livelihoods.
