project_title: ADA One which stands for AI on Device Asset (A.D.A)
tagline: A prototype that solves not one, but several real-world problems using resource-constrained computing with Google Gemma 3n.
summary:
**1. Problem Definition and Context**
Project idea/Solution, Context and Motivation: Living in my country, I discovered that I always had to surmount diverse, complex interconnect challenges that constantly tried to box me in despite being knowledgeable, and with IT, AI, programming skills, now imagine for those who are not. I tried several times to solve these recurring bull-dog challenges, yet even with money to spend on solving challenges like power and electricity, data outages (around Q2-Q4 2024 they said the inter-continental data deep sea cable was damaged etc.), these challenges barked with ferocious tenacity.

This is where I went on this adventure to architect, develop, package, make available for myself and others like me, a unique solution to solve insistent challenges that keeps us from enjoying the services of advanced computing and AI, which can turn our lives, businesses, careers around, and make us live a life of wellness and productivity. This was when I stumble upon Gemma 3n on the Deep Mind X (formerly Twitter) Account.

**1.2. Constraints and Challenges**
We encountered challenges like outages of power supply which we had to acquire backups like Tabs which use low power and can be charged with portable power banks, relocation our development office to where power was currently available because we do not think our caretaker will allows us pin solar panels to the roof of his building. 
We encountered challenges like data, AI compute, and connectivity challenges. We subscribed to two telecom data providers, so we can switch provided when one fails, which happened a lot.

**1.3. Design Approach and Alternatives Considered**
In addressing the challenge, I adopted for a design-first mindset rooted in solving real-world problems within the African context, where computing power, internet access, and power resources can be highly constrained. Early in the planning phase, I evaluated various architectural models and development paths, particularly those relying on commercial large language model (LLM) providers or always-online cloud services.
However, the cost implications, the steep learning curve, and the infrastructure demands of cloud-based AI solutions made such options less viable for long-term, sustainable impact‚Äîespecially when targeting offline or low-power use cases across regions with limited connectivity or expensive mobile data.
As a result, I shifted toward a mobile-first and offline-capable architecture. My goal became to build a lightweight, resource-efficient AI system that could run directly on-device, with minimal reliance on cloud-based computation. This decision aligned with a broader principle of deploying edge AI solutions that are energy-efficient, responsive, and scalable in environments with limited infrastructure.
After researching available models, I stumbled upon, and eventually selected Google's Gemma 3n as the core of my AI implementation. It offered an excellent balance of size, speed, and performance, optimized for local execution without the need for high-end hardware or external GPU servers. This small-scale LLM proved especially well-suited to mobile and edge contexts, enabling AI functionality while keeping power and data usage minimal.
Overall, the final design emerged as a smart adaptation to the realities of building AI-driven tools in developing or resource-limited environments‚Äîdelivering meaningful functionality without compromising on accessibility or efficiency.

** 2 Project idea/Solution, Context:**
I present to you ADA One an AI on Device Asset (A.D.A) that runs on your mobile devices without the need to connect online. It is an AI LM for edge devices, designed for offline-first systems, decentralized compute, that solves the constraints like:
2.1. Inconsistent Power Supply: Our solution is an energy-efficient tech, because it has low power consumption.
2.2. Little Availability or no Internet Connectivity: Our ADA One solution does not need depend on internet connectivity for it operate or function.
2.3. LLM API Credits: It does not need to connect to AI LLM providers like OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, Cohere, Mistral, Meta etc. The main point here is that it saves you money.
2.4. Data and Information Privacy: ADA One is an on-device or mobile-first solution, which means it resides solely on your device without the need to send/share your private data with eternal serves anywhere.
2.5. Lack of Advance AI Compute: AI can infuse, kick-start, empower, drive, Sustain, professionalize your skills, work, business, career, education, wellness, productivity etc. This is what ADA does. We handout a unique, powerful solution/platform into your hands, which loos so small, however it is a world of power, possibilities, productivity, wellness etc. Please use it responsibly.
2.6. Who is for/Wide Areas of Application: Whether you have been waiting for a unique, powerful, rugged, sophisticated AI compute solution to enhance your skills, work, business, career, education, wellness, productivity etc. then know that ADA One is packed, stuffed with prebuilt Experiences tailored for several aspects of ‚ÄúDaily Life‚Äù which include but not limited to areas of healthcare (including mental health), education (ADA One is a personal tutor/coach which can even teach you how to code, smart cities (tutorials and appreciation), fintech (tutorials and appreciation), climate (tutorials and appreciation), entertainment (interactive entertainment sessions), agriculture (tutorials and appreciation), gaming (tutorials and appreciation), business and finance (tutorials and appreciation), and beyond

---
**What we Built (Deeper Report):**
A. Enhance Accessibility: Build tools for real-time translation or transcription for the hearing-impaired, or visual description apps for the blind.
B. Revolutionize Education: Create interactive, offline-ready learning experiences for students in low-connectivity regions.
C. Improve Health & Wellness: Develop on-device apps that can provide mental health support through voice analysis or act as a personal wellness coach.
D. Promote Environmental Sustainability: Design an app that uses image and audio recognition to identify local plant diseases, track biodiversity, or promote recycling.
E. Aid in Crisis Response: Build tools that can operate offline to provide critical information or facilitate communication during natural disasters.

---
**2.7 Enhanced Accessibility:** ADA is bundled with built-in tools I call ‚ÄúExperienceAI‚Äù (Camera Mode) which lets you use your camera to get real-time interactive AI assistance with visual content experience with visual descriptions and audio feedback, all you need to do is to point your camera at text, objects, or scenes for instant 

---
**2.8	Revolutionize Education:** ADA is bundled with built-in tools for education which I call ‚ÄúTeacher-Student Tools‚Äù perfect for educational settings, it is for offline-ready learning experiences for students in low-connectivity regions.
**For Teachers:**
- Create virtual classrooms with access codes
- Distribute assignments and materials
- Monitor student progress
- Share ExperienceAI analyses with the class
- Manage multiple students simultaneously

**For Students:**
- Join classrooms with access codes
- Receive assignments and resources
- Submit work and get feedback
- Collaborate with classmates
- Access shared learning materials

**Collaboration Tips**
- Check your privacy settings before sharing
- Use classroom mode for educational activities
- Share ExperienceAI results for group learning
- Monitor active sessions in the Sessions tab

---
**2.9	Improve Health & Wellness:** ADA is bundled with built-in tools for Health & Wellness, and Productivity which I call ‚ÄúADA‚Äù the AI Persona that is vast in several areas of Health & Wellness, and Productivity.
AI Personas

**What are Personas?**
Personas are different AI personalities you can interact with, each with unique traits and expertise areas.

**Ada - Your Default Persona**
- *Personality: Confident, friendly, nurturing
- Expertise: Healthcare, education, programming, business, science
- Best For: General assistance, learning, problem-solving

**Creating Custom Personas**
1. Tap the Personas section in the menu
2. Select "Create New Persona"
3. Customize:
   - Name and Description
   - Personality Traits (confidence, friendliness, formality, etc.)
   - Expertise Areas and specializations
   - Communication Style

**Switching Personas**
- Use the persona selector in the top menu
- Your conversation context is preserved when switching
- Each persona adapts to your selected topic area

---

**2.10 Chat Mode**

**Basic Chat**
1. Type your message in the input field
2. Tap Send or press Enter
3. Ada responds based on her personality and expertise

**Niche Selection**
Choose from specialized chat areas:
- Healthcare - Medical guidance and wellness support
- Education - Tutoring, learning assistance, creative writing
- Programming - Code help, debugging, best practices
- Business - Analysis, strategy, professional guidance
- Science - Research assistance, explanations
- Entertainment - Creative projects, fun interactions

**Chat Tips**
- Be specific about what you need help with
- Ask follow-up questions for deeper understanding
- Use natural language - Ada understands context
- Switch niches anytime to get specialized help

---
**2.11	Promote Environmental Sustainability:** ADA is bundled with built-in tools for real-time camera interaction for Science - Research assistance, explanations that uses image and audio recognition. SO, it is to be used identify local plant diseases, track biodiversity, or promote recycling.

**Getting Started with Camera Mode for Science - Research assistance, explanations**
1. Tap "ExperienceAI" in the main menu
2. Select your niche (Education, Programming, Science, etc.)
3. Allow camera permissions when prompted
4. Point your camera at what you want to analyze

**Analysis Types**
- OCR (Text Recognition) - Read and understand text from images
- Object Detection - Identify objects, people, and items
- Scene Understanding - Analyze environments and contexts
- Tutorial Mode - Step-by-step guidance for learning

**Visual Overlays**
- Green boxes around detected text
- Blue highlights for important objects
- Labels and annotations with confidence scores
- Interactive elements you can tap for more info

**Audio Feedback**
- Ada speaks her analysis results
- Toggle audio on/off with the speaker button
- Adjust volume and speech settings
- Works great for accessibility

**Camera Tips**
- Ensure good lighting for best results
- Hold steady for a moment during analysis
- Try different angles if results aren't clear
- Use tutorial mode when learning new topics

---

**2.12 Content Sharing Hub**
Access sharing features through the ‚ÄúCollaboration‚Äù tab:
- Share - Send content to others
- Sessions - Manage active collaborations
- Devices - See connected devices
- Stats - View sharing statistics

**Sharing Methods**
- QR Codes - Generate codes for easy sharing
- Direct Links - Share via messaging apps
- File Export - Save content to device
- Peer-to-Peer - Direct device-to-device sharing
- WiFi Direct - Local network sharing
- Bluetooth - Close-range sharing

---
**2.13 Aid in Crisis Response:** ADA One is has built-in tools that can operate offline to provide critical information or facilitate communication during natural disasters. The same way the ExperienceAI and Improve Health & Wellness modules are applied, is the same way to apply it to get Aid in Crisis Response.

Ada One has a lot more please check our uploaded files for a USER_GUIDE.MD which contains the full details of what ADA One can do.

---
**3. Technologies and Tools Used**
The solution was developed using a carefully selected stack of technologies optimized for mobile-first, offline-capable AI applications in low-resource environments. Each tool and framework was chosen based on its ability to support efficiency, scalability, and adaptability across Android and iOS platforms.

**AI Model: Google Gemma 3n**
‚Ä¢	Reason for Selection:
Gemma 3n is a compact, efficient large language model specifically optimized for low-power devices and edge inference. Its small footprint and strong vision-language capabilities make it ideal for on-device intelligence without relying on constant internet access.
‚Ä¢	Usage:
Powers OCR, object detection, scene understanding, contextual prompts, and persona-aware feedback across all core modules, especially the ExperienceAI and Tutorial systems.

React Native + Expo
‚Ä¢	React Native:
Chosen for its cross-platform capabilities and strong community support, React Native enabled rapid mobile development for both Android and iOS using a single codebase.
‚Ä¢	Expo SDK (~53.0.20):
Used to streamline the development workflow with powerful tools for camera access, file management, haptics, sensors, and deployment. Expo also provided built-in testing and packaging utilities that accelerated iteration and reduced complexity.

TypeScript
‚Ä¢	Reason for Selection:
Adopted for type safety, better code organization, and predictable state management across a growing and modular codebase.
‚Ä¢	Usage:
Enforced interface contracts for personas, camera analysis, classroom data, and transfer operations, leading to more robust integration between components.

React Native Camera & Image Picker
‚Ä¢	Camera Module:
Enabled real-time vision processing for object detection, OCR, and environmental analysis.
‚Ä¢	Image/Document Picker:
Provided intuitive access to files from the gallery, camera roll, and local storage, used in PeerMediaSharing and Resource Upload tools.

Text-to-Speech (TTS) and Haptics
‚Ä¢	Text-to-Speech:
Used to deliver persona-aware, natural-sounding audio feedback based on analysis results. The TTS system adjusts voice parameters like pitch and speed based on the persona's traits (e.g., nurturing or confident).
‚Ä¢	Haptics:
Implemented via platform APIs for vibration feedback tied to confidence levels and interaction types, enhancing accessibility and real-time user engagement.

Peer-to-Peer Technologies
‚Ä¢	Wi-Fi Direct & Bluetooth APIs:
Powered the PeerMediaSharing component to allow offline media exchange between users without needing internet connectivity. Designed with native permissions and error handling for reliability in real-world usage.

Persona System Engine
‚Ä¢	Custom Engine:
Designed to inject personality, domain expertise, and communication style into the AI feedback loop. This system drives both analysis interpretation and tutorial interaction, enriching user experience.

Role-Based Education Framework
‚Ä¢	Built on React + Hooks Architecture:
The TeacherStudentTools module uses advanced React patterns, including role-based state management, modal workflows, and conditional rendering, to deliver a responsive and scalable learning management interface.

Testing Tools
‚Ä¢	Unit Testing & Mocking:
Comprehensive test coverage was applied using built-in test runners and mocking frameworks to validate component behavior, especially in permission-sensitive, UI-dynamic, and asynchronous workflows.

Security and Privacy
‚Ä¢	Encrypted Storage:
Used for storing sensitive healthcare and wellness data offline, ensuring privacy even in disconnected environments.
‚Ä¢	Role-Based Access Control (RBAC):
Ensured that teachers, students, and collaborators have distinct permissions and access boundaries.

Performance Monitoring
‚Ä¢	Custom Metrics Hooks:
Built-in hooks track analysis duration, confidence scores, and persona effectiveness, enabling insights into how different configurations perform under real-world conditions.

Together, this stack enables the delivery of a robust, privacy-conscious, and intelligent mobile platform that operates efficiently in environments with limited data, connectivity, or compute power. Every tool was chosen not just for its capability, but for how well it aligns with the principles of accessibility, adaptability, and real-world usability across the African tech landscape.

---
**4. Performance Evaluation and Benchmarks**
Although final performance validation is in progress, a comprehensive testing and benchmarking plan has been outlined to ensure reliability, responsiveness, and quality across the entire platform. The goal is to deliver a seamless experience on low-power devices, especially in environments with limited connectivity and computing resources.

Testing Strategy
The performance evaluation is divided into three major phases:

**4.1. Unit Testing for Enhanced Features**
A full suite of unit tests is being implemented for all new services and components, including:
‚Ä¢	PersonaManager & ExperienceAIService ‚Äî verifying persona state logic, camera analysis behaviors, and data handling.
‚Ä¢	Collaboration Services ‚Äî ensuring consistent peer-to-peer transfer flow and session state management.
‚Ä¢	Camera Processing Engines ‚Äî testing core vision capabilities including object recognition, scene understanding, and error handling.
‚Ä¢	Edge Case & Error Tests ‚Äî validating responses under unusual or failure conditions.
Target: >90% code coverage across all enhanced modules.

**4.2. Integration & End-to-End Workflow Testing**
Multi-module workflows will be tested to confirm seamless interactions and proper system behavior, including:
‚Ä¢	Persona-Camera-Collaboration Pipeline ‚Äî validating context-aware analysis across user roles and interaction types.
‚Ä¢	Teacher-Student Assignments ‚Äî testing full classroom lifecycle from creation to submission and feedback.
‚Ä¢	PeerMediaSharing & Cross-Device Workflows ‚Äî ensuring media exchange reliability and permission compliance.
‚Ä¢	Accessibility & Usability Audits ‚Äî evaluating voice, visual, and haptic feedback effectiveness across devices and use cases.
Target: Full workflow validation across supported platforms (Android/iOS), with consistent behavior in both online and offline states.

---
**5.3. Final Integration & Deployment Validation**
A final polish phase will integrate all enhanced features with the core application foundation:
‚Ä¢	System-Wide Workflow Testing ‚Äî validating user journeys from navigation to feature completion.
‚Ä¢	Production Build Performance Testing ‚Äî confirming app startup time, memory usage, and frame rates on low- to mid-tier mobile hardware.
‚Ä¢	Quality Assurance & Monitoring Setup ‚Äî analytics tools will monitor feature usage, error rates, and real-world performance across sessions.
‚Ä¢	Deployment Readiness ‚Äî preparing documentation, walkthroughs, and internal guides for future contributors and scaling.
Target: Stable deployment with verified requirements integration, performance baselines, and maintainability documentation.

**Initial Observations (Preliminary Benchmarks)**
‚Ä¢	Persona-Aware Camera Response: Prototype testing shows sub-1 second response times for OCR and object detection on mid-tier Android devices.
‚Ä¢	TTS and Haptics Feedback Latency: Audio and haptic feedback modules respond within ~200‚Äì300ms following analysis events.
‚Ä¢	Peer Transfer Speeds: Preliminary Wi-Fi Direct tests achieved 3‚Äì5MB/s throughput, sufficient for rapid document and image sharing offline.
Full benchmarking reports and optimization insights will be included in the post-deployment analysis.

tagline: PolicyBot lets you chat with policy documents offline ‚Äî with cited answers, powered by Gemma 3n and advanced retrieval.
summary:
Introduction

Modern policy documents are essential to how societies function‚Äîbut they are often dense, technical, and inaccessible to the very people they affect. Legal jargon, bureaucratic phrasing, and sheer length make it difficult for individuals, journalists, advocacy groups, and even professionals to extract meaningful insights or specific answers from these texts. While policies aim to be inclusive, their language unintentionally excludes.

To bridge this gap, we built a chatbot application that allows users to upload any policy document in PDF format and interact with it using natural language questions. Under the hood, the chatbot leverages a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline powered by Google‚Äôs Gemma 3n model (via Ollama) to extract contextually accurate answers‚Äîgrounded strictly in the content of the document. No hallucinations, no filler‚Äîjust precise, verifiable information.

What sets this application apart is its focus on factual accuracy and traceability. Answers are constructed using techniques like semantic chunking, Rag Fusion and HyDE (Hypothetical Document Embeddings) to improve retrieval relevance. Whenever possible, the chatbot uses direct quotes from the document to preserve legal precision and reduce ambiguity. The result is a tool that doesn‚Äôt just summarize‚Äîit empowers users to get to the core of complex policies quickly and confidently.

This solution was created for the Gemma 3n Hackathon to demonstrate how open, on-device generative models can drive real-world impact‚Äîspecifically, by improving public access to government and legal information. In an age where information is abundant but clarity is rare, this chatbot ensures that policy knowledge is no longer locked behind expert interpretation.

Motivation and Impact

Understanding government policies shouldn‚Äôt require a law degree. Yet, citizens around the world are routinely excluded from meaningful participation in public life because policy documents‚Äîoften hundreds of pages long‚Äîare written in dense legal language that‚Äôs difficult to parse. This project began with a simple frustration: wanting to know what rights, responsibilities, or benefits a given policy grants, but having to rely on second-hand summaries or legal experts to make sense of it.

Policy literacy is a foundation of democracy. When people understand the laws and regulations that govern their lives, they are better equipped to hold institutions accountable, advocate for themselves, and participate in civic processes. However, the complexity of these documents creates a real barrier. Even for professionals‚Äîsuch as journalists, researchers, and local administrators‚Äîfinding relevant sections, comparing clauses, or checking specific legal wording can be time-consuming and error-prone.

This chatbot directly addresses that challenge. It enables:

- **Students** to ask questions about education or labor policies without having to wade through legal jargon.
- **Journalists** to fact-check claims by understanding and quoting exact clauses.
- **NGOs** and **citizens** to understand rights, entitlements, and obligations under various public schemes.
- **Public sector professionals** to review or clarify operational rules with high precision.

By providing a fast, accurate, and interactive way to access dense documents, the tool drastically reduces the time and expertise required to interpret policy content. Instead of skimming 100+ pages or relying on unreliable third-party summaries, users can ask a question and get a context-accurate, directly quoted response‚Äîon demand.

One of the core advantages of this solution lies in its alignment with the technical and philosophical goals of **Gemma 3n**. This model is specifically designed to be:

- **Lightweight**, making it ideal for resource-constrained environments.
- **Open-source**, encouraging transparency and adaptability.
- **Hardware-efficient**, capable of running on consumer-grade laptops or even mobile-class devices.

That makes this chatbot deployable in low-bandwidth or offline environments‚Äîsuch as rural classrooms, NGO field offices, or legal aid clinics‚Äîwithout the need for cloud inference or expensive GPUs. The architecture is optimized to run locally using **Ollama**, ensuring privacy, low latency, and reduced costs. This makes the application not only impactful but also inclusive.

The real-world value of the chatbot extends beyond convenience: it fosters a more informed public, empowers under-resourced communities, and promotes transparency in governance. These are exactly the kinds of outcomes the **Gemma 3n Hackathon** was designed to encourage: small models solving big problems, with tangible benefits for everyday people.

Architecture Overview

The chatbot is built on a carefully engineered Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline that prioritizes factual accuracy, efficient document retrieval, and low-latency local inference. At its core, the system leverages the gemma3n:e4b model, hosted locally via Ollama, enabling fast and private inference on consumer-grade hardware without reliance on cloud APIs.

tagline: Offline AI Technical Assistant for Colombian Coffee Farmers
summary: Caficulbot is a fully offline, multimodal AI assistant built to empower Colombian coffee farmers with expert knowledge on cultivation, pests, diseases, and farm management. It provides real-time answers to questions, processes images of plant diseases, and performs administrative tasks, all without needing an internet connection.

tagline: Providing emergency medical guidance without internet using local AI and voice recognition.
summary:
In emergencies like accidents or disasters, internet access is often lost ‚Äî and with it, access to vital first-aid information. AidLens is a web-based, voice-activated assistant that provides step-by-step first-aid instructions entirely offline, using an AI model running locally.

Users simply speak their issue (e.g., ‚ÄúMy friend is bleeding from the leg‚Äù), and AidLens transcribes the speech, sends it to a local AI model (Gemma 2B via Ollama), and displays first-aid guidance instantly. The web app runs in the browser and communicates with the AI server running on the same network.

 Progress Note:
Due to hardware limitations on my current laptop, I was unable to fully run the AI model in real-time for full integration. However, the core interface, voice input setup, and Ollama API logic have been implemented and tested in parts. The full vision and system design are in place, and with compatible hardware, the project is ready to be completed quickly.

Core Features:
- Voice input using Web Speech API
- Local AI inference using Ollama + Gemma 2B
- Works fully offline (local server)
- First-aid-specific prompt engineering

This project aims to democratize emergency care for offline, rural, or disaster-affected areas by combining privacy-preserving on-device AI with a simple voice interface.

Built With:
JavaScript / HTML / CSS
Google Chrome (for voice)
Ollama (local AI engine)
Gemma 2B model

Future improvements include multilingual support, image-based injury detection, and text-to-speech for better accessibility.

project_title: Gemma AI Data Assistant: Autonomous & Private Data Science Agent
tagline: A private, offline AI agent using Gemma to autonomously turn natural language requests into complete data science notebooks.
GOME is an offline AI system using Gemma 3n to fight illegal mining. It empowers indigenous communities with alerts in native languages.
summary:
Guardians of the Mother Earth (GOME) is a real-time, offline AI system designed to combat illegal mining in remote regions that lack internet and power infrastructure. Developed by Luis and Kevin Guaman, GOME empowers local and indigenous communities to monitor and protect their ancestral lands using advanced, accessible technology.

At its core, the system uses Google‚Äôs powerful and efficient Gemma 3n-it vision-language model to analyze live video feeds from drones or surveillance cameras. Running entirely on-premise on modest hardware, GOME detects visual signs of illicit activities‚Äîsuch as deforestation, heavy machinery, or river pollution‚Äîwithout needing an internet connection.

What makes GOME truly impactful is its ‚Äúout-of-the-box‚Äù intelligence and its commitment to inclusivity. The instruction-tuned Gemma model understands complex, natural language prompts, allowing users to ask nuanced questions about the visual data. Crucially, the system operates in over 140 languages, with a special focus on Quechua, the native language of many communities in the Amazon. This enables users to interact with the AI, receive alerts, and understand threats in their own language‚Äîremoving technological barriers and placing the power of AI directly into the hands of the land‚Äôs true guardians.

Alerts and data are transmitted across vast, remote areas using a low-power LoRaWAN network, ensuring that critical information reaches community members, leaders, and international advocates swiftly and efficiently. GOME is more than a detection tool; it is a platform for environmental justice, built to be used by the very people on the front lines of the fight against environmental destruction.

tagline: AI-powered tool using Gemma3n to detect crop diseases & weeds, giving farmers real-time advice with images, text & weather updates.
summary:
This project uses Gemma 3n, a powerful multimodal vision-language model with voice support and regional language understanding, to build an intelligent assistant for real-time crop disease and weed detection. By analyzing plant images and communicating through natural language (text and speech), the system provides easy-to-understand diagnosis and treatment suggestions to farmers. It also delivers real-time weather updates via an integrated AI agent. Unlike traditional tools, Gemma 3n can interact in local languages, improving accessibility for rural farmers.

The main challenge lies in handling real-time processing, ensuring accurate results with limited connectivity and hardware on the field. However, Gemma 3n's lightweight design and multi-input flexibility make it ideal for deployment in low-resource agricultural settings, helping farmers make informed decisions quickly and easily.

project_title: KalviMate - an offline-capable, fine-tuned AI tutor
tagline: An offline-first, syllabus-aligned educational AI, fine-tuned on Gemma 3n to provide equitable access to high-quality learning.
summary:
KalviMate is an offline-capable, fine-tuned AI tutor designed to help students in Tamil Nadu learn directly from their state board textbooks, even without internet access. It transforms the open-source Gemma 3n model into a fully on-device, curriculum-aligned personal tutor that explains concepts, solves textbook problems, and engages students in natural conversation.

Targeted at rural and under-resourced areas where access to quality teachers and internet connectivity is limited, KalviMate addresses three critical gaps in existing educational technology: 
- lack of offline support
- absence of Tamil language understanding, and 
- no alignment with the Tamil Nadu state syllabus.

We solve this by fine-tuning Gemma 3n on a custom dataset curated directly from the state board curriculum. 
This enables KalviMate to act as:
- A subject expert delivering accurate, syllabus-bound responses
- A concept explainer using simple analogies for better understanding
- A problem solver guiding students through exercises
- A study companion offering quizzes and conversational learning

**Key Features**:
- Fully offline: Runs entirely on-device for accessibility in low-connectivity regions
- Tamil Nadu curriculum aligned: Answers are rooted in official textbooks
- Natural language interaction: Supports simple, conversational English
- Privacy-preserving: No data ever leaves the student‚Äôs device

Tutor-like behavior: Friendly, patient, and motivating by design
KalviMate is more than a chatbot. It is an equitable, AI-powered learning companion for every student, anywhere.

summary:
**MedPal ‚Äì Your Offline AI Medical Assistant**

##**Overview**
In many rural and low-connectivity regions, access to reliable medical guidance is delayed or unavailable. Online health tools often fail without internet, and in emergencies like burns, choking, or severe bleeding, even a few minutes‚Äô delay can cost lives.

MedPal addresses this gap by delivering instant, offline, privacy-first medical assistance, powered by Google Gemma 3n. By running entirely on-device, MedPal ensures that sensitive health data never leaves the user‚Äôs system, offering both speed and privacy when it matters most.


##**Key Features**
- Offline AI Inference ‚Äì Runs Gemma 3B locally via Ollama, no internet needed.

- Symptom Checking ‚Äì Enter symptoms and get immediate, step-by-step guidance.

- Voice & Text Input ‚Äì Accepts queries through typing or offline speech-to-text.

- Privacy-First Design ‚Äì All processing happens locally on the user‚Äôs device.

tagline: On-Device Visual Intelligence for the Visually Impaired
summary:
================================================================================
ABSTRACT
================================================================================

Lumina is an Android application engineered to serve as a real-time, on-device AI assistant for visually impaired users. By leveraging the power and efficiency of Google's Gemma 3n model, Lumina transforms a standard smartphone into an intelligent "seeing-eye" companion that provides environmental descriptions, object identification, and navigational assistance without ever compromising user privacy. All processing, from image analysis to language generation, occurs 100% on-device, ensuring that Lumina is always available, regardless of internet connectivity, and that sensitive user data remains completely private. This document provides an exhaustive technical breakdown of the architecture, data flows, core algorithms, and the specific engineering solutions implemented to overcome the challenges of running a state-of-the-art Large Language Model on a resource-constrained mobile device.

================================================================================
1. INTRODUCTION: THE MISSION AND THE MODEL
================================================================================

1.1. The Problem Space

Navigating the world without sight presents profound daily challenges. From simple tasks like finding a misplaced object to complex situations like crossing a busy street, visually impaired individuals rely on a combination of memory, tactile feedback, and auditory cues. While existing assistive technologies exist, they often depend on cloud connectivity, privacy concerns, and a point of failure in offline environments.

1.2. The Solution: Lumina

Lumina was conceived to address these gaps. It is a mobile-first application that acts as an extension of the user's senses, providing rich, context-aware audio feedback about their surroundings. Lumina is not just a tool, it's a constant companion designed for reliability, privacy, and empowerment.

1.3. Why Gemma 3n? The Cornerstone of On-Device AI

The feasibility of Lumina hinges on the ability to run a powerful generative AI model directly on a mobile device. Gemma 3n was the unequivocal choice for this mission for several key reasons:

- On-Device Supremacy: Gemma 3n is specifically designed for high-performance, on-device execution. This aligns perfectly with Lumina's core principles of privacy and offline functionality.

- Efficiency and Performance: I utilize the gemma-3n-e2b-it-int4.task model‚Äîa 4-bit quantized version of the 2-billion-parameter instruction-tuned model. This specific variant provides an exceptional balance of low memory footprint, fast inference times on mobile GPUs, and high-quality, coherent language generation.

- Multimodal Capabilities: Gemma's inherent ability to process both text and image inputs is the technical foundation for Lumina's core feature: visual question answering. This allows the user to not just get a description, but to have a genuine dialogue about their visual environment.

================================================================================
2. SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE AND DATA FLOW
================================================================================

Lumina is built upon a robust and scalable Clean Architecture, strictly separating concerns into three primary layers. This was critical for managing complexity, enabling testability, and ensuring long-term maintainability.

- DOMAIN Layer (The Core): The heart of the application, containing pure Kotlin business logic with no Android dependencies.
    - Use Cases: Single-responsibility classes representing every user action (e.g., `DescribeSceneUseCase`, `FindObjectUseCase`, `StopGenerationUseCase`). They orchestrate the flow of data from the repository to the presentation layer.
    - Repository Interface (`LuminaRepository`): Defines the contract for data operations, abstracting the data sources from the business logic.

- DATA Layer (The Implementation): Provides concrete implementations of the domain interfaces.
    - `LuminaRepositoryImpl`: Implements the `LuminaRepository` interface, acting as the single source of truth for data. It delegates tasks to the appropriate data source.
    - Data Sources:
        - `GemmaAiDataSource`: Manages the entire lifecycle and all interactions with the Gemma 3n model via the MediaPipe `LlmInference` API.
        - `TextToSpeechServiceImpl`: Encapsulates the Android Text-to-Speech (TTS) engine, managing its lifecycle, speech queue, and providing a clean interface for the app.

- APP Layer (The Presentation): The user-facing layer, responsible for UI and state management.
    - UI (Jetpack Compose): A fully declarative UI built with Jetpack Compose. `SceneExplorerScreen.kt` is the primary component, reacting to state changes from the ViewModel.
    - ViewModel (`SceneExplorerViewModel`): The bridge between the UI and the domain layer. It executes use cases based on user input, manages the UI state via Kotlin `StateFlow`, and ensures the UI is a simple, reactive reflection of the application's state. It is injected with use cases via Hilt.

- Dependency Injection (Hilt): I use Hilt to manage dependencies. This decouples the classes, simplifies testing by allowing for easy injection of mock implementations, and manages the lifecycle of the singletons (like repositories and data sources) automatically.

---
**Data Flow Example: "Describe Scene"**
1.  **UI Event:** User double-taps the `SceneExplorerScreen`.
2.  **ViewModel:** The `investigateScene()` function in `SceneExplorerViewModel` is called. It updates its `StateFlow` to show a loading state (`isLoading = true`).
3.  **Use Case:** The ViewModel invokes the `DescribeSceneUseCase`.
4.  **Repository:** The use case calls `luminaRepository.describeScene()`.
5.  **Data Source:** The repository implementation calls `gemmaAiDataSource.generateResponse()` with the appropriate prompt and the best-quality frame from the `FrameBufferManager`.
6.  **Streaming Response:** `GemmaAiDataSource` returns a `Flow<String>` of text chunks from the model.
7.  **Collection & State Update:** The ViewModel collects this flow. Each emitted chunk is appended to a `generatedText` state variable. Simultaneously, the text is streamed to the `TextToSpeechServiceImpl`.
8.  **TTS & UI:** The `TextToSpeechServiceImpl` buffers the text and speaks it in complete sentences. The UI displays the accumulating text.
9.  **Completion:** When the flow completes, `isLoading` is set to `false`. The `stopAllOperationsAndGeneration()` function ensures all streams (Gemma, TTS) are terminated if the user interrupts.
---

================================================================================
3. PROMPT ENGINEERING: GUIDING THE AI
================================================================================

The quality of Gemma's output is directly proportional to the quality of the prompts. I have developed a system of specialized, context-aware prompts for each feature.

- **System Prompt (The Foundation):** Every session with Gemma begins with a master system prompt that establishes its persona and core instructions. It is instructed to act as a helpful assistant for a visually impaired user, to be descriptive, concise, and to focus on objects and potential obstacles.

- **Task-Specific Prompts:**
    - **Describe Scene:** "Describe the scene in detail. Mention objects, their spatial relationships, and any text you can see." This is an open-ended but focused prompt to elicit a rich description.
    - **Find Object:** "Is there a [object name] in the image? If so, where is it located?" This is a direct question designed for a precise, location-based answer.
    - **Read Text:** "Read all the text in the image, from top to bottom." This constrains the model to an OCR-like task.
    - **Identify Currency:** "Identify the currency and its denomination. Be as certain as possible." This prompt is tailored for classification and confidence scoring.

This multi-prompt strategy ensures that the model's powerful generative capabilities are precisely channeled to the user's immediate need.

================================================================================
4. STATE MANAGEMENT & UI ARCHITECTURE (MVI)
================================================================================

I implemented a Model-View-Intent (MVI) architecture for the presentation layer to ensure a predictable, unidirectional data flow and a highly reactive UI.

- **Model:** The state of the UI is represented by an immutable data class, `SceneExplorerUiState`. This class holds all the information the UI needs to render itself at any given moment (e.g., `isLoading`, `generatedText`, `isSpeaking`).

- **View:** The `SceneExplorerScreen` (a Jetpack Compose function) acts as the View. It is stateless and dumb. Its only job is to observe the `StateFlow<SceneExplorerUiState>` from the ViewModel and render the UI based on the current state. It sends user actions (intents) to the ViewModel.

- **Intent:** User actions, such as a double-tap or a long-press, are treated as "intents." These intents are passed to the `SceneExplorerViewModel`.

- **ViewModel (`SceneExplorerViewModel`):** The ViewModel processes these intents, executes the relevant business logic (by calling Use Cases), and then creates a *new* `SceneExplorerUiState` object. This new state is then emitted to the `StateFlow`, causing the UI to re-render automatically.

This unidirectional flow (`View -> Intent -> ViewModel -> Model -> View`) makes the application state highly predictable and easy to debug. By using immutable state objects and `StateFlow`, I guarantee that the UI is always a direct reflection of the application's internal state.

================================================================================
5. CORE COMPONENT DEEP DIVE: ENGINEERING CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS
================================================================================

**5.1. The AI Core: `GemmaAiDataSource`**

- **Challenge: Session Token Limits & Infinite Loops**
  - Problem: The MediaPipe `LlmInferenceSession` has a finite token limit. Furthermore, I observed a bug where the model occasionally fails to send a `done = true` signal, instead entering an infinite loop, repeatedly sending the final token.
  - **Code-Level Solution:**
    1.  **Proactive Session Rotation:** The data source tracks the token count. When it approaches a safe threshold, it automatically closes the session and starts a new one, preserving the context. This prevents crashes from token exhaustion.
    2.  **Robust Cancellation:** The `stopGeneration()` function is a hard reset mechanism. It cancels the underlying `coroutineScope` in which the `callbackFlow` for Gemma's responses is running, and then immediately reinstantiates it with a new `SupervisorJob`. This is the crucial step that forcefully terminates any in-flight generation, effectively breaking out of the infinite token loop and ensuring the app never freezes. The use of `callbackFlow` is key here, as it allows me to bridge the listener-based MediaPipe API with Kotlin's structured concurrency.

- **Challenge: Concurrency and Stability**
  - Problem: Rapid user inputs could trigger simultaneous requests to the AI, leading to race conditions.
  - **Code-Level Solution:** I use a Kotlin `Mutex` as a gatekeeper for the `generateResponse` function. The function is structured with a `mutex.withLock { ... }` block. This ensures that only one coroutine can execute the AI generation logic at a time. Any subsequent request suspends until the mutex is released, guaranteeing a stable, sequential processing pipeline.

**5.2. The Vision System: `FrameBufferManager`**

- **Challenge: Optimizing for Clarity vs. Motion**
  - Problem: Different tasks require different visual input. Describing a static scene needs the clearest image, while navigation requires understanding motion.
  - **Code-Level Solution:** I implemented a `FrameBufferManager` that maintains a `ConcurrentLinkedQueue<TimestampedFrame>` to safely handle frames coming from the camera thread.
    - `getBestQualityFrame()`: This method iterates through the buffer and is intended to analyze frames for sharpness (e.g., using a variance of Laplacian algorithm, though currently using the latest frame as a proxy) to find the one with the most detail. This is used for OCR and scene description.
    - `getMotionAnalysisFrames()`: This method is designed for future navigation features. It provides a sequence of recent frames, allowing Gemma to infer temporal context like the direction and speed of moving objects.

**5.3. The Audio System: `TextToSpeechServiceImpl`**

- **Challenge: Bridging the AI-to-TTS Speed Mismatch**
  - Problem: Gemma streams responses token-by-token, far faster than a TTS engine can speak. Naively feeding these chunks results in choppy, unnatural speech.
  - **Code-Level Solution:** I developed an intelligent sentence-boundary buffering system using a `StringBuilder` as the internal buffer.
    1.  **`addToBufferAndSpeak(text: String)`:** This method appends new text chunks to the `StringBuilder`.
    2.  **`speakBufferedText()`:** This private method is then called. It searches the buffer for the last index of ". ", "? ", or "! ".
    3.  If a sentence break is found, it extracts the substring up to that point, passes it to the `textToSpeech.speak()` method with `QUEUE_ADD`, and then *removes* only the spoken portion from the `StringBuilder`.
    4.  This leaves any partial sentence (e.g., "And on your left...") in the buffer, ready to be completed by the next chunk from the AI. This transforms a rapid stream of tokens into a continuous, natural-sounding flow of speech.

**5.4. The User Experience: `SceneExplorerViewModel` and UI**

- **Challenge: Providing Control and Feedback**
  - Problem: The user needs to know what the app is doing and be able to stop it at any time.
  - **Code-Level Solution:**
    - **State-Driven UI:** The `SceneExplorerViewModel` exposes its state via `MutableStateFlow<SceneExplorerUiState>`. The Compose UI collects this flow as state (`val uiState by viewModel.uiState.collectAsState()`) and automatically updates to show loading indicators or other feedback.
    - **Global Stop:** A long-press gesture on the screen triggers `viewModel.stopAllOperationsAndGeneration()`. This function is a critical safety feature that calls the `StopGenerationUseCase`, which in turn calls `gemmaAiDataSource.stopGeneration()` and `textToSpeechService.stopSpeaking()`, providing an immediate and reliable way to silence the app.
    - **Interaction Delays:** I introduced a `delay(1500)` in the `investigateScene()` coroutine. This was a crucial UX discovery, giving the user time to steady their hand and allowing the `FrameBufferManager` to populate with high-quality frames before one is selected for analysis.

**5.5. System Efficiency: Mitigating Battery Drain**

- **Challenge:** Balancing Responsiveness with Power Consumption
 - Problem: The camera sensor and the AI inference engine are the two most power-hungry components of the application. Leaving them running continuously is not a viable option for an all-day assistive tool.
 - **Code-Level Solution:** Aggressive, State-Driven Resource Management.
On-Demand Camera Lifecycle: The camera is not always active. It is only turned on when a vision-based use case (like DescribeScene or FindObject) is initiated. Crucially, as soon as the AI generation is complete or the user cancels the operation, the camera is immediately released and turned off. This ensures the sensor is only drawing power for the absolute minimum time required.
Minimal AI Interaction: We architected the system to call the powerful Gemma 3n model as infrequently as possible. Instead of continuous analysis, the full model is only invoked in response to a direct user command. For proactive features, we use simpler, less power-intensive logic.
 - **Configurable Frame Throttling:** For modes that do require a continuous camera stream, such as Proactive Navigation, the ManageFrameThrottlingUseCase is implemented to control the frame rate. By default, it operates at a reduced rate (e.g., 2-5fps) for ambient updates, dramatically lowering the processing load compared to the full 60fps stream. This rate can be intelligently increased when more detail is required.

================================================================================
7. FUTURE WORK AND EXTENSIONS
================================================================================

- **Proactive Navigation:** The ultimate vision is a proactive mode where the app periodically scans the environment with a lightweight object detection model. If a hazard (e.g., a curb) is detected, it would then trigger Gemma for a full description and warning, conserving battery while providing timely alerts.
- **Model Fine-Tuning:** Fine-tuning a Gemma variant on specialized datasets for currency, receipts, or common household objects to further improve recognition accuracy. This would involve creating a dataset of labeled images and using transfer learning to adapt the base model.
- **Personalized Context:** Allowing users to "teach" Lumina about personal items (e.g., "These are my keys") to enable highly specific search queries. This would involve storing image embeddings and corresponding labels in a local database.

================================================================================
8. CONCLUSION
================================================================================

Lumina is a testament to the power of modern on-device AI to solve meaningful, real-world problems. By combining the efficiency of the Gemma 3n model with a robust, well-engineered application architecture, it delivers a powerful, private, and reliable assistive experience. The technical solutions‚Äîfrom the meticulous AI session management and prompt engineering to the intelligent frame and text buffering‚Äîwere all developed in service of creating a seamless and empowering tool for the visually impaired user. Lumina demonstrates that the future of truly personal AI is not in the cloud, but right here, in the user's hand.

tagline: when you want a quick analytics report of any given topic my product will help you with that by doing research on that topic.
summary:
This project demonstrates the development of an intelligent, automated research and report generation system using the CrewAI framework. The system simulates the collaborative efforts of a research team by orchestrating two specialized agents: a Researcher and an Analyst. Each agent is powered by Google‚Äôs gemma-3n-e4b-it LLM and performs distinct roles in a coordinated workflow to produce high-quality, structured research reports on any given topic.

The Researcher Agent is designed to gather comprehensive, accurate, and up-to-date information on a specified topic using search tools such as SerperDevTool. It focuses on key concepts, historical context, current trends, challenges, case studies, and future outlooks.

The Analyst Agent takes the research findings and generates a polished, professional report. This includes an executive summary, trend analysis, key insights, and actionable recommendations‚Äîall presented in a reader-friendly format.

The entire process is defined declaratively using YAML files (agents.yaml and tasks.yaml), which clearly specify the behavior, goals, backstories, and tools used by each agent. The output is a structured markdown file, suitable for publication or presentation.

project_title: myBnB: An efficient AI Agent to Find the Perfect Rental
tagline: We propose myBnB, an agent to efficiently find rentals for any requirements all available information, 100x faster than OpenAI Agent
summary:
We propose myBnB, a parallel, efficient agent that finds the perfect rental. In
order to do so, we show how parallel processing with small models and
structured, domain-specific data can help to build effective agents. Further, it
becomes apparent that prompting is not the solution to everything, and
sometimes it might be preferred to train an actual classifier. Additionally, we
present a dynamic scoring system that seamlessly integrates into our agent to
obtain a fitting ranking of apartments.

A live demo with sample data for the cities Berlin, Augsburg, and Vienna is available.
[myBnB Live Demo](https://mybnb-web.netlify.app/)


While we present our solutions applied to myBnB, it presents a framework on
how to build specialized agents. Similar techniques could be applied to any sort
of specialized search. Future work will deal with generalizing those concepts
towards agents that can structure problems themselves, and can detect when
to use and train a classifier over simple prompting.

project_title: Helping those non-verbal/aphasia with Autism communicate with others using AI
tagline: We use Gemma 3N to provide individuals with communication disabilities an innovative tool for properly expressing themselves
summary:
Here we present a next-generation Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) mobile application designed to give a powerful, private, and natural voice to individuals with communication disabilities. Traditional AAC systems are often limited by static, pre-programmed phrases and require an internet connection, compromising both spontaneity and privacy. Most importantly, they often do not allow the users to express themselves in the way they tend to think (in visual abstract concepts rather than using natural language). They often require intense training and are often a stop gap to only communicate the most basic sentences, after months of intense training. The current market of leading apps have not innovated within the last decade, and there are constant complaints and unhappiness about it from the community at large. Our project overcomes these barriers by running a fine-tuned Gemma 3N model directly on the user's device, allowing what essentially amounts to one of the most advanced concept-to-language translator in the world to act as a bridge of communication between those who are non-verbal, minimally verbal, or selectively verbal, to those who are fully verbal. This is especially useful for those who are within the Autism spectrum, but also critical for those with some sort of aphasia, such as stroke patients. Imagine if you had a family member, friend, or other loved one with whom you could not communicate with anymore. The current communication methods are incredibly lossy and hard for the user. We built this so that we can meet those with communication disabilities where they are, especially since they have to meet us where we are in so many other ways in this world.

The core of our innovation lies in a custom Swift native module that uses Google's MediaPipe to perform on-device inference, ensuring the app is fully functional offline and that all user data remains completely private. To tailor the model to the unique needs of AAC users, we developed a sophisticated MLOps pipeline to fine-tune Gemma using advanced techniques like QLoRA. We use Unsloth to be able to fine tune the model on a modest home PC without running into any cloud costs. The training data was sourced from a custom-built gamified web portal where volunteers helped create a rich, domain-specific dataset, teaching the model to generate context-aware and nuanced phrases from a series of visual prompts.

By combining a high-performance native AI core with a user-friendly React Native interface, Mosaic Voice delivers a seamless and responsive experience. It empowers users to move beyond rigid, pre-made sentences and communicate their thoughts with the fluency and personality they deserve. This project demonstrates the profound potential of on-device generative AI to create truly transformative and accessible technology.

tagline: Care More, Document Less
summary:
Introduction
Therapists are the heart of our mental health care system, yet many are drowning in administrative work. In Malaysia, 1 in 3 people face mental health challenges, while therapists lose up to 40 hours a month to case notes, reports, and documentation, a hidden burden contributing to a burnout rate exceeding 45%. The very people we rely on to heal us are stretched thin by paperwork, not people work.

MindNote AI is built to change that. Powered by a **fine-tuned Gemma 3n** model trained on therapist case note templates, therapists are empowered to transform short notes and transcripts into accurate, professional-grade case notes swiftly and securely. With on-device privacy, therapists get context-aware, customizable notes in formats like SOAP or DAP, tailored to their workflow.

tagline: A voice-based mental health assistant that supports Bangla and conducts empathetic PHQ-9 screenings
summary:
Project Report for Google - The Gemma 3n Impact Challenge 

**Project Description:**
In a world that increasingly demands emotional resilience and mental strength, mental health remains one of the most overlooked yet fundamental aspects of human well being. According to WHO 2022 reports, mental health disorders affect over 970 million people worldwide, yet nearly 75% of those in low and middle income countries receive no treatment. Mental health care remains deeply underserved in Bangladesh and many parts of the world, where stigma, lack of access, and cultural misunderstandings prevent people from seeking help. Conversations about depression often do not happen, especially not in native languages or in trusted, stigma free environments. This project aims to bridge that gap.
We introduce a voice-based mental health screening bot, powered by Gemma 3N, that helps users evaluate symptoms of depression using the standardized PHQ-9 questionnaire. The goal is to make mental health assessment more accessible, empathetic, and culturally sensitive, particularly for underrepresented communities in regions like Bangladesh.
The application allows users to speak or type responses to PHQ-9 prompts. Using speech-to-text (Faster-Whisper) and Gemma for classification, it evaluates each response and offers empathetic, human-like feedback. At the end, it provides a score along with suggestions aligned with clinical guidance. The system supports English and Bangla audio, leveraging Coqui TTS and other multilingual tools for dynamic voice generation.
While the system currently accepts English voice/text and Bangla text input, it supports Bangla and English voice output. This lays the foundation for future full Bangla-language support. This balance helps address the language and cultural barriers that typically hinder mental health support in low-resource regions like Bangladesh.

**Impact & Vision:**
Mental health care in underserved regions, particularly in Bangladesh, is severely hindered by a combination of poverty, cultural stigma, limited mental health literacy, and inadequate access to services. Many individuals in tight-knit, self-reliant communities, especially in small towns and rural areas, face significant challenges in seeking help. Cultural barriers often frame mental health struggles as personal failings, and economic constraints further limit access to care. Mental health support often exists more in theory than in reality. Between socioeconomic barriers, overstretched systems, and deep-rooted cultural silence, countless people are left to navigate emotional struggles alone. This project seeks to break down these barriers by providing an accessible mental health screening tool that empowers individuals in underserved communities to access support without fear of judgment, paving the way for improved mental health outcomes and reducing stigma. The vision is one of hope and change, enabling individuals to access the care they need, when they need it, while dismantling the socio-cultural and economic obstacles that have traditionally kept them from seeking help.

**PHQ-9 Logic and Free Text Understanding:**
Instead of relying on fixed choice questionnaires, the bot conducts a natural and empathetic conversation by asking open ended PHQ-9 questions and accepting free form voice responses from users. These responses are transcribed using Faster-Whisper and then processed through a Gemma powered LangChain model.
The model classifies each answer into one of the four standard PHQ-9 categories:

‚ÄúNot at all‚Äù (0)
‚ÄúSeveral days‚Äù (1)
‚ÄúMore than half the days‚Äù (2)
‚ÄúNearly every day‚Äù (3)

The system assigns numeric scores accordingly, tracks them across all nine questions, and concludes with a tailored severity assessment and a supportive message. This design improves accessibility for users who may be non-literate or emotionally distressed, fostering a more human centered and compassionate mental health evaluation experience.

**Project Overview:**
This project presents a web-integrated, voice-enabled mental health assistant that conducts PHQ-9 depression assessments in both English and Bangla. The system provides empathetic, conversational feedback using the Gemma language model hosted locally via Ollama. It leverages Faster-Whisper for real-time voice input, along with Coqui TTS and browser-native speech synthesis for dynamic voice output in Bangla and English.

**Video Pitch & Storytelling :**
The video pitch tells a compelling story of how the technology works, focusing on the user experience and emotional connection it fosters. The narrative highlights the seamless integration of speech-to-text technology, multilingual capabilities, and empathetic feedback from the conversational bot. The pitch emphasizes the cultural sensitivity of the solution, showcasing its relevance to the target audience. It powerfully communicates the importance of overcoming mental health barriers, making the technology both globally relevant and locally impactful. This engaging and emotional pitch captures the project's potential to drive viral engagement by addressing a universally significant issue in a contextually sensitive way.

**Core Architecture:**
The architecture is divided into Frontend, Backend, Machine Learning, and Data Storage components to ensure efficient interaction, security, and scalability. It integrates FastAPI and Django frameworks, allowing for an intuitive and responsive user interface, with secure user session management and real-time backend processing.

Core Components:
Natural Language Understanding
LLM: Gemma 3n:e2b via Ollama for local, privacy preserving inference.

LLM Agent Logic: LangChain prompt orchestration classifies user answers into the PHQ-9 scale (0‚Äì3), tracks the total score, and generates kind, supportive replies.

Speech-to-Text (Input)
Model: Faster-Whisper provides real-time transcription of user voice input.

Pipeline: Audio is captured through the web interface, converted to .wav, transcribed by Faster-Whisper, and routed into the PHQ-9 classifier.

Text-to-Speech (Output)
English: Browser native speechSynthesis API delivers instant voice output.

Bangla: Coqui TTS is integrated via the FastAPI backend for server side Bangla voice generation.

Auto Language Switching: Unicode detection enables dynamic toggling between English and Bangla voices based on the bot's response.


**PHQ-9 Logic Details:**
The bot conducts a full 9-question PHQ-9 assessment. User responses are classified into four categories:
0 ‚Äì Not at all
1 ‚Äì Several days
2 ‚Äì More than half the days
3 ‚Äì Nearly every day

The total score is computed to determine depression severity as follows:
0‚Äì4: Minimal
5‚Äì9: Mild
10‚Äì14: Moderate
15‚Äì19: Moderately severe
20‚Äì27: Severe


**Full-Stack Web Architecture:**
Frontend (Django + HTML/JS)
The Django frontend hosts a secure web UI, enabling user-friendly interactions for voice and text input. Key pages such as upload.html and start_assessment.html manage voice interaction, session control (restart/resume), and display real-time responses.
Backend (FastAPI)
The backend handles core logic, including:

Audio upload and transcription (Faster-Whisper).

PHQ-9 question management.

Coqui Bangla TTS audio generation.

LLM query routing.

Main API endpoints:
/transcribe: Handles audio uploads and returns transcriptions.

/phq: Manages PHQ-9 session responses and bot replies.

/tts: Serves Coqui TTS audio for Bangla.

/phq/reset: Resets the PHQ-9 session.

**Integration and Security:**
Django runs on localhost:8000 while FastAPI runs on localhost:8001. The frontend makes cross-origin requests to the FastAPI backend. CORS middleware is securely implemented to allow these requests without compromising security.
Environment isolation and management of API keys are handled via .env files.

**Database Integration with PostgreSQL:**
PostgreSQL is used as the production-grade relational database to securely store user session data, assessment results, and user profiles. Compared to SQLite used in development, PostgreSQL provides scalability and reliability.
Django ORM is configured to connect to PostgreSQL, ensuring robust data management and enabling future features like user authentication, historical data tracking, and personalized mental health insights.

**Voice Interaction Flow:**
The voice interaction follows this sequence:
The user speaks; the browser records and sends audio.

Faster-Whisper transcribes the audio.

Transcribed text is routed to the PHQ-9 session.

Gemma LLM classifies the response and generates the next question plus a supportive reply.

The response is rendered and spoken aloud:

English responses use browser TTS.

Bangla responses use Coqui-generated audio served from the backend.

The cycle repeats until all nine questions are completed.

A final summary is given, using kind and supportive language.

**Multilingual Capability:**
Input (STT): Faster-Whisper supports both English

LLM: Gemma model processes input and output in both English and Bangla.

Output (TTS):

English output uses browser-native speechSynthesis API.

Bangla output uses Coqui TTS via the FastAPI backend.

UI Interaction: Web interface built with Django supports both languages.

Switching Logic: Unicode detection dynamically toggles between English and Bangla voices.

**How Gemma 3N Was Used:**
Gemma 3N played a central role in two key areas of the application, making the interaction both intelligent and compassionate:
Classification of User Responses:
The system leveraged ChatOllama, a variant of Gemma 3N, to interpret and classify user responses based on the PHQ-9 questions. Rather than relying on rigid answer choices, Gemma 3N helped map each free form user response into one of four categories: ‚ÄúNot at all,‚Äù ‚ÄúSeveral days,‚Äù ‚ÄúMore than half the days,‚Äù or ‚ÄúNearly every day.‚Äù This was achieved by using a carefully crafted ChatPromptTemplate to guide the classification process, with StrOutputParser extracting the precise classification from the model‚Äôs output. This enabled nuanced understanding even when answers were vague or complex.
Empathetic Responses:
Beyond classification, Gemma 3N generated warm, empathetic replies after each user response. Using a distinct ChatPromptTemplate, the model crafted short, supportive, and validating messages that acknowledged the user‚Äôs feelings and provided reassurance. This created a safe, compassionate environment where users felt heard and understood, fostering trust and openness throughout the conversation.
Technical Depth & Execution
Technically, the project leverages the powerful Gemma 3N model to classify open-ended free-text user responses into PHQ-9 categories, enabling nuanced, human-like understanding rather than relying on fixed choices. The system integrates Faster-Whisper for English speech-to-text transcription, and accepts Bangla text input, supporting multilingual interaction. For voice output, Coqui TTS is used to generate natural, expressive Bangla speech, while English output uses browser-native TTS. This hybrid approach balances privacy, performance, and linguistic accessibility without relying on full Bangla speech recognition, which remains a future enhancement. Our modular backend using FastAPI and Django provides robust session management, real-time processing, and scalability, demonstrating a well-engineered, practical, and innovative solution that fulfills the judging criteria for technical depth and execution

**Challenges Faced and Solutions:**
Building a voice-based mental health assistant came with its share of challenges, each requiring thoughtful solutions:
Real-time Speech-to-Text Conversion:
One major hurdle was accurately converting user voice input into text in real-time. This was solved by incorporating Whisper for speech transcription, known for high accuracy and robustness. FFmpeg was used to seamlessly convert audio formats, ensuring compatibility with Whisper and smooth processing.
Classification of Ambiguous Responses:
Users sometimes gave responses that didn‚Äôt fit neatly into the four PHQ-9 categories. To handle this, a clarification mechanism was implemented. When ambiguity was detected, the bot gently prompted users to select from predefined options, maintaining accuracy without disrupting conversational flow.
Trigger Detection for Crisis Intervention:
Detecting sensitive language such as suicidal thoughts was critical. A trigger detection system was integrated to actively monitor responses for crisis indicators. If detected, the system halted the assessment and provided urgent, compassionate crisis intervention advice, prioritizing user safety.
Session Management:
Managing the state of the user‚Äôs session tracking responses, scores, and progress required careful design. A dedicated Python class (PHQ9Session) was created to handle session logic, ensuring smooth and consistent behavior during assessments.

**Why the Technical Choices Were Right:**
All technical choices were made to balance performance, user experience, and project requirements:

FastAPI and Django Together:
Django was used for its robust, secure frontend capabilities templating, session management, and database ORM making it ideal for building a user friendly interface. FastAPI powered the backend API with asynchronous capabilities critical for real-time transcription, PHQ-9 question management, and machine learning inference. Combining them provided clean separation of concerns and scalability.

Gemma 3n:e2b Model:
The Gemma 3n:e2b  model achieves a remarkable balance between powerful NLP capabilities and efficient performance through several key architectural and training innovations. While the model has a total parameter count of 5 billion, it is designed to operate with an effective memory footprint of just 2 billion parameters. This is made possible by techniques such as Per-Layer Embedding (PLE) caching, which offloads non-essential parameters to local storage to reduce run-time memory costs, and a Matryoshka Transformer (MatFormer) architecture that allows for selective activation of parameters. This means the model can deliver high-quality NLP results, including accurate text classification and nuanced response generation, while still being able to run efficiently on low-resource devices like phones and laptops, a feat that traditional large language models often cannot accomplish. This clever engineering allows it to punch well above its weight, making it a powerful yet practical choice for on-device applications.

Faster-Whisper for Speech-to-Text:
Faster-Whisper efficiently and accurately transcribes user voice input in English. Running locally ensures low latency and preserves privacy, critical for sensitive health applications. Its robustness and compatibility with multiple audio formats enabled seamless voice interaction.
Coqui TTS for Bangla Text-to-Speech:
Coqui TTS was integrated on the backend to generate natural-sounding Bangla speech. Browser-native TTS engines currently do not support expressive Bangla well, so Coqui‚Äôs open-source, locally runnable models were essential to deliver culturally and linguistically appropriate voice responses without relying on cloud services.

CORS Middleware:
To enable smooth, secure communication between Django frontend and FastAPI backend running on different origins, CORS middleware was implemented. This ensured properly authorized API requests without compromising security, vital for modern web applications using distributed components.

**Conclusion:**
This project demonstrates how cutting-edge AI and machine learning technologies can be thoughtfully integrated to address critical gaps in mental health care, particularly in underserved regions like Bangladesh. By combining the privacy-preserving Gemma 3N model, the efficient Faster-Whisper transcription system, and the expressive Coqui TTS engine, the voice-based PHQ-9 mental health assistant provides an accessible, empathetic, and culturally sensitive tool for depression screening.
The thoughtful use of Django and FastAPI frameworks ensures a scalable, secure, and user friendly platform that supports both English and Bangla languages. The system‚Äôs design prioritizes human-like empathy and privacy, offering users a safe environment to engage with mental health resources without fear or stigma.
Ultimately, this project sets a strong foundation for expanding voice-driven, AI-powered mental health solutions in low resource settings, breaking down barriers to care and fostering greater awareness and support for mental wellness.

project_title: V3-Gemma: A Depression Screener Based on Visual, Vocal, and Verbal Signals
tagline: Trained on How You Look, Speak, and What You Say - Powered by Gemma3n
authors: tarot383, Min jhon, Insu Jeon, SeoJeon Park, KKimMGH
summary: Depression is a serious condition with significant societal impact, yet current screening methods remain limited. To address this, we developed V3-Gemma, a mobile application that securely performs on-device depression screening using visual, vocal, and verbal signals with the Gemma 3n model. Designed to reach the many individuals who remain undiagnosed, it runs efficiently on smartphones via the Streamlit platform. The system builds on expert-defined screening criteria and a multimodal dataset of 3,500 participants, collected since 2021 by the psychiatrists. Without additional fine-tuning, V3-Gemma enhances accuracy through tailored strategies. V3-Gemma integrates clinical knowledge with LLM-based reasoning in a structured multimodal framework to provide simple, privacy-preserving depression screening.

project_title: Ajay‚Äôs Family AI: One Offline Model Tackling Six Rural Challenges
tagline: Education, health, mental care, farming, accessibility & disaster safety‚Äîone offline AI model for rural India‚Äôs key needs.
summary:
Ajay‚Äôs Family AI: One Offline Model Tackling Six Rural Challenges

üìå Problem

Millions of rural Indian families face multiple daily challenges:
	‚Ä¢	Education ‚Äì 32.5% of Class VIII students cannot read a Class II text, private tuition is costly.
	‚Ä¢	Healthcare ‚Äì Up to 70% rely on unverified home remedies, risking harm.
	‚Ä¢	Mental Health ‚Äì Depression prevalence is double that of urban India, with treatment for only 20%.
	‚Ä¢	Agriculture ‚Äì Diseases like bacterial blight can destroy 60% of rice yields.
	‚Ä¢	Accessibility ‚Äì 33.8% of Indians aged 45+ suffer vision impairment.
	‚Ä¢	Disaster Preparedness ‚Äì Floods cause ‚Çπ25,000+ crore in annual losses and thousands of deaths.

Poor internet access, high service costs, and lack of localized resources keep life‚Äësaving knowledge out of reach.

‚∏ª

üí° Solution

We built Ajay‚Äôs Family AI ‚Äî a single fine‚Äëtuned Gemma 3N model running fully offline, supporting local languages, and covering six critical domains:
	1.	üìö Education ‚Äì Personalized NCERT‚Äëaligned tutoring
	2.	ü©∫ Healthcare ‚Äì Verified Ayurvedic remedies
	3.	üí¨ Mental Health ‚Äì Depression support & guidance
	4.	üåæ Agriculture ‚Äì Rice disease diagnosis & treatment advice
	5.	üëÅ Accessibility ‚Äì Image description for visually impaired
	6.	üö® Disaster Management ‚Äì Offline survival instructions

Powered by Ollama, Unsloth LoRA fine‚Äëtuning, and RAG with FAISS, it ensures:
	‚Ä¢	Privacy ‚Äì Local processing, no cloud dependency
	‚Ä¢	Zero recurring cost ‚Äì Works without internet

üèóÔ∏è Approach

datasets/ayurveda/ayurveda_home_remedies.pdf

3Ô∏è‚É£ PDF Parsing & Structuring

4Ô∏è‚É£ Base Model Setup
	‚Ä¢	Installed Ollama locally.
	‚Ä¢	Pulled gemma3n:e4b (7.5 GB) for primary use, gemma3:latest (3.3 GB) for multimodal features.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Domain-Specific Q&A Generation

6Ô∏è‚É£ Fine-Tuning on Kaggle

7Ô∏è‚É£ Custom Model Registration in Ollama

8Ô∏è‚É£ Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
	‚Ä¢	Built FAISS vector indexes for each domain under rag_index/.
	‚Ä¢	Domain‚Äëspecific retrieval boosts factual accuracy by 20‚Äë40%.

9Ô∏è‚É£ Streamlit Family Assistant Interface
	‚Ä¢	8+ tabs for each family member/domain.
	‚Ä¢	Multimodal (text + image) support where needed.
	‚Ä¢	Fully offline, responsive, and mobile‚Äëfriendly.

‚∏ª

‚úÖ End Result
