tagline: A LeKiwi robot that uses Gemma 3n to make real-time decisions in a Mars-like environment
summary:
Project Overview
Gemma Rover uses a Gemma 3n model to control a LeKiwi robot in a Mars-like environment. The project showcases Gemma 3n‚Äôs ability to make real-time decisions locally in a robotics context. This is crucial in scenarios where cloud services are not available and human support is 30 minutes away. This setup highlights the potential of running large language models on-device for autonomous, context-aware behavior in remote or constrained environments.

For the demo, we prepared a scenario that takes us through a day in the life of Gemma Rover. The rover has a long running task of collecting dirt samples. At some point, a dust storm starts and the rover needs to stop the current task to seek shelter. After the storm passes, it needs to get back to the long running task, but since the solar panel is covered with dust, it needs to clean it first. After that, it can continue with the long running task of collecting dirt samples.

Hardware Setup and Communication
The project uses a LeKiwi robot, a Macbook with an M2 chip and a travel router to connect the two devices. The Macbook is used to run the Gemma 3n E4B model and the [ACT](https://tonyzhaozh.github.io/aloha/) models used for arm manipulation. Communication between the Macbook and the robot is done over a local network using ZeroMQ. 

In the future, we could use a Jetson AGX Orin(or maybe even a Jetson Orin Nano) to remove the need for a Macbook, but we didn't have one available at the time of the project.

Control Loop
We were planning on using an agentic framework like ADK or smolagents for making decisions but we couldn't make them fit our use case and decided to implement our own setup that calls the LLM directly. Since this is a rover on Mars, it should think continuously, not just try to do a task and wait for further instructions. It should also be able to stop doing the task if there are threats to it's safety or it's longterm operational integrity.
The way we think about it is that the rover should get the information it needs (about the environment, about itself and it's homebase, about it's long running task) every few seconds and decide what to do next.

So we implemented what we call an Agentic Control Loop. On the main thread, we have a loop that prompts the LLM every few seconds with the current state of the robot and the environment. The LLM then decides what action to do next and spawns a thread to execute that action. In most cases, the action will take longer that it takes to go through the loop, so if the LLM decides to do the same action, nothing will happen. However, if it decides to do a different action, it will cancel the previous action and spawn a new thread to execute that action. This way, the LLM can make decisions in close to real-time. 

In our current setup, Gemma 3n:4eb is used on a Macbook(M2) and the loop runs at about 30 instructions per minute. For our tests, we capped this at 3 instructions per minute(run the loop every 20 seconds) to avoid having too many logs, but depending on the task, it can be increased.

Here is a log from a simulation run using "start_mars_simulation.py": https://gist.github.com/vladfatu/232492b4325303631e0f3a55dec81442
The scenario is the one from the demo video.

##

project_title: Resona, an offline AI-powered assistant for emotional communication.
tagline: Using on-device LLMs to help people better understand each other‚Äôs emotional needs.
summary:
Resona: An Offline AI-Powered Assistant for Emotional Communication

This project was conceived and developed within the final week leading up to the competition deadline. Despite the limited timeframe, Resona introduces a significant breakthrough in the field of emotional communication: the integration of a locally-deployed large language model (LLM) using MediaPipe + Gemma 3B.

Unlike conventional emotion or dialogue apps that rely heavily on cloud-based APIs, Resona runs entirely offline, allowing for real-time, private, and secure conversation analysis ‚Äî without compromising on intelligence. Powered by MediaPipe Tasks and optimized to run efficiently on-device, this prototype demonstrates how future emotional assistants can operate independently of the internet.

While the current version is incomplete ‚Äî missing planned multimodal inputs (voice, image, etc.) and deeper conversational modeling ‚Äî the groundwork laid here opens the door for more nuanced and human-aligned AI systems. The app parses natural dialogue, identifies emotional needs, stances, and self-worth signals, and organizes conversations into meaningful categories such as Critique, Plea, Reflect, and Perform.

I believe this design represents just 20% of the potential. With further development, Resona could evolve into a full-featured offline companion capable of resolving emotional misunderstandings, mediating conflict, and revealing the implicit dynamics behind human communication.

This is not just a tool ‚Äî it‚Äôs a vision for rethinking how we process, understand, and communicate emotional experience.

tagline: Multi-lingual Gemma3n models for on-device first aid assistance
summary:
**Problem statement**
In most parts of the world, especially in homes and remote communities, critical first aid isn‚Äôt administered until help arrives‚Äîby which time survival odds have dropped dramatically. Annually, **only about 10%** of out‚Äëof‚Äëhospital cardiac arrests result in survival‚Äîyet over half of victims receive no immediate CPR from bystanders, despite **over 70% of arrests occurring at home** [https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC8174211]. 

Globally, bystander‚ÄØCPR rates range **from 1% in some regions up to 44%**, with **only roughly 45%** receiving it overall [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cardiopulmonary_resuscitation].

Training and confidence are critical barriers. Less than one in five people have received certified first aid training, and **only around 33‚Äì35%**feel prepared to act in emergencies [https://wifitalents.com/first-aid-statistics , https://gitnux.org/first-aid-statistics). In rural or underserved areas‚Äîwhere EMS can take an hour or more to arrive‚Äîthis training gap means delays prove fatal. A study in Southern India found nearly half of first responders took over an hour to reach a hospital during their last emergency, and **fewer than 45%** reported any formal training [https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC3876499].

That‚Äôs where an **AI first‚Äëaid app** on your local device could be a game‚Äëchanger‚Äîespecially if it works **entirely offline**. A private AI-based guidance system on your device can give clear instructions immediately, **bridging the gap between witnessing a crisis and skilled support**‚Äîwhen every second counts.

The name PrathamOps is derived from the word Prathamopachar (‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡•ã‡§™‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞) which means first aid in Sanskrit 

**Technical approach**

##1. Corpus collection
In order to generate a good quality dataset for fine tuning the model, I collated corpus from various sources as the knowledge base from which the model will learn. It includes official guidelines, medical texts, and practical first-aid procedures. The corpus is structured to be easily accessible for data generation, potentially categorized by the type of injury or emergency.

##2. Data cleaning and processing
Before I started generating the synthetic data, I wanted to categorize the data corpus into various categories of injuries and age to **maintain class balance** and **equal representation**. Hence I categorized them into following categories and age groups

###Types of Injuries
- Assessing patient situation [General care]
- Unresponsive non-breathing casualty [CPR,AED]
- Response problem [Seizure, Stroke, Head injuries,Diabetes]
- Breathing and airway problems [Asthma, Allergy, Choking]
- Circulation problems [Bleeding, Faining,Chest pain]
- Muscle, Joint and Bone injuries [Fractures, Dislocation, Strain, Sprain]
- Burns
- Poison
- Meningitis, Sepsis, Bites, Stings


###Age categories
- Adults > 18 years
- Teens and children  5 years to 18 years
- Babies < 5 years

##3. Synthetic data generation
Using the prepared corpus, **Gemini 2.5 Flash** is employed to generate synthetic data. This model is chosen for its **speed** and **advanced reasoning** capabilities. The generation process is **guided by the injury type**. For each injury category (e.g., burns, cuts, fractures), the model is prompted to create **detailed first-aid instructions**, questions, and conversational turns in many **different languages**. This approach ensures a vast and diverse dataset without the need for manual translation and content creation.


| Category | Topics | Categorical Split | Adults (Home, workplace, outside) | Teens and Children (Home, school, outside) | Babies (Home, outside) |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :---- | :--- | :--- |
| Assessing patient situation | Pre-requisites | 10% | 5% | 3% | 2% |
| Unresponsive non-breathing casualty | CPR, AED | 9% | 4.5% | 2.7% | 1.8% |
| Response problem | Seizure, Stroke, Head injuries, Diabetes | 9% | 6.3% | 1.8% | 0.9% |
| Breathing and airway problems | Asthma, Allergy, Choking | 9% | 4.5% | 2.7% | 1.8% |
| Circulation problems | Bleeding, Fainting, Chest pain | 9% | 4.5% | 3.6% | 0.9% |
| Muscle, Joint and Bone injuries | Fractures, Dislocation, Strain, Sprain | 9% | 6.3% | 2.7% | 0% |
| Burns, Poison |  | 9% | 4.5% | 2.7% | 1.8% |
|Meningitis, Sepsis, Bites, Stings |  | 9% | 4.5% | 2.7% | 1.8% |
|Generic | All | 27% | 12.42% | 9% | 5.58%|
|Total | |100% | 52.52% | 30.9% | 16.48% |


The data split of categories are equal, however I took weighted splits for age categories considering the amount of risk (statistically) associated with the age group

The dataset was also generated in various languages like **English, Hindi, France** as well as low-resource languages like **Marathi** and **Kannada**.

The data was also updated with the emergency contacts and other details associated to the region in which the people speak the particular language the most
For examples: 
The emergency contact for India is 102/108, and since Hindi, Marathi and Kannada are native to India, the emergency contact is set to 102/108 and 999/112 in the case of English and French


##4. Finetuning using Unsloth
The synthetic, multilingual dataset is then used to fine-tune a Gemma 3n model. Unsloth is the chosen framework for this process due to its efficiency in fine-tuning LLMs, which allows for faster training and reduced hardware requirements. 
The fine-tuning process adapts the general-purpose Gemma 3n model to the specific domain of first aid, making it an expert in providing concise and accurate emergency guidance.
I trained the Gemma 3n models with 1k samples for each language, for 3 epochs on T4 GPUs
**Base model**: `unsloth/gemma-3n-E2B-it, unsloth/gemma-3n-E4B-it`
**Lora config**: `r=8, lora_alpha = 8, lora_dropout = 0`
**SFT config**: `epochs = 3, per_device_train_batch_size = 1, gradient_accumulation_steps = 4, learning_rate = 2e-4, optim = "adamw_8bit", weight_decay = 0.01, lr_scheduler_type = "linear"`

**Model checkpoints and dataset** : https://huggingface.co/collections/viveksil/prathamops-68926bbee736c07ba081993d


##5. Deploy with Ollama
The final, fine-tuned Gemma 3n models are deployed locally using Ollama. This platform enables the models to run directly on the user's device, ensuring that the application remains functional even without an internet connection. This is a critical requirement for a first-aid assistant, as emergencies can occur in areas with poor or no connectivity. Ollama's local serving also guarantees user privacy, as no personal information or query data is sent to a remote server.

GGUF models: https://ollama.com/viveksil/prathamops-E2B
Local **React + FastAPI + Ollama** app : https://github.com/VivekSil/prathamops/tree/main/app/prathamops-react-app
Local **Gradio + Ollama** app : https://github.com/VivekSil/prathamops/blob/main/app/prathamops-gradio-ollama.py

##6. Use with Google's AI at Edge Gallery app
You can use the finetuned gemma3 models using the Gallery app
Model (.task) file: https://huggingface.co/viveksil/prathamops-en-1B/blob/main/prathamops-1b-q4.task

##7. Experiments and Challenges
Since the .tflite/.task support for custom gemma3n models is not available yet and gemma3-1B was found to be running faster than gemma3n on low-end devices hence I decided to develop the models using gemma3-1B as a base for on-device Gallery app. All the finetuned models are based on gemma3n-E2B except this one.

tagline: Fine-tuned Gemma 3n  virtual tutor offers personalized feedback to boost learning & critical thinking in marginalized areas.
summary:
üöÄ Project Name: Open Tutor AI
‚ú® Project Description
This project is an artificial intelligence app that seeks to revolutionize educational feedback in basic education. Using the power of Google's Gemma 3n multimodal model, the model offers students a personalized tutor that works directly on their mobile devices, currently using **Google AI Edge Gallery**. üì±

Our solution aligns with and deepens the principles of expected learning outcomes for basic education, providing a tool that promotes autonomous learning and addresses the educational gap in low-resource areas. üè´

üßê The Problem
In schools in marginalized and low-resource areas, teachers often lack the time and resources to offer personalized and timely feedback to each of their students. This lack of individualized support can hinder learning and understanding, which exacerbates educational inequality. üíî

üí° Our Solution
We have developed a mobile application with the following features:

Multimodal Feedback: Students can submit their work via text ‚úçÔ∏è or images üì∏ (photos of their notebooks, drawings, diagrams) and the AI provides them with constructive feedback.

Offline Operation: The app is designed to work without an internet connection, making it ideal for areas with limited connectivity. üì∂

Learning Aligned with NEM and LTG: The AI model has been trained on the pedagogical principles of NEM and the content of the LTG, ensuring that the feedback is relevant and accurate. üìö

Personalized Tutor in Your Pocket: The AI not only corrects, but also guides the student to understand their mistakes and to improve, acting as an accessible personal tutor at all times. ü§ñ

‚öôÔ∏è How It Works
Our project is built on a robust architecture that combines the best of modern artificial intelligence:

Base Model: We use Gemma 3n, a multimodal AI model from Google, optimized to run on mobile devices.

Efficient Fine-tuning: Through the Unsloth framework, we have managed to fine-tune Gemma 3n quickly and with minimal memory usage. ‚ö°

Training Dataset:

Content: The model was trained with a data corpus that includes the official documents of the Nueva Escuela Mexicana and the complete content of the Libros de Texto Gratuitos.

Synthetic Data Generation: To overcome the scarcity of real assignments and ensure privacy, we have used Meta Llama's Synthetic Data Kit (SDK) to generate thousands of synthetic examples of student work and their ideal feedback. ü§ñ

User Flow:

The student uploads an image or writes their question.

The on-device model analyzes the input.

It generates a text response, which is then converted to speech using the phone's native Text-to-Speech (TTS) engine. üó£Ô∏è

The app can also analyze the chat history to identify knowledge gaps and generate a personalized study plan. üß†

**Usage instructions:**

Download the fine-tuned model to the mobile device

Download the Google AI Edge Gallery APK

Load the fine-tuned model

Load the system prompts as the first instruction in the chat section

Ask the questions

üõ†Ô∏è Technologies Used
AI Model: Gemma 3n (Google)

Optimization and Fine-tuning: Unsloth

Synthetic Data Generation: Synthetic Data Kit (Meta Llama)

On-Device Inference Frameworks: TensorFlow Lite / ONNX Runtime

Development Platforms: Android / iOS

UI/UX Prototype: Figma

üé• Demo and Presentation
We invite you to watch the video of our demo to see the project in action. Don't miss it! üòâ

[Link to the demo video on YouTube/Vimeo]

üöÄ Future and Scalability
This project is a proof of concept with enormous growth potential to address even greater educational challenges. Our future ideas include:

UI Development: An APK will be created based on Google AI Edge Gallery to provide a more user-friendly interface.

Integration into Educational Platforms: Expand the application beyond the student's device, integrating it into learning management systems (LMS) and platforms used by schools. üåê

Tool for the Teacher: Develop a control panel for teachers that allows them to visualize common knowledge gaps, analyze progress, and get suggestions for activities based on the NEM. üë©‚Äçüè´

Interdisciplinary Content: Expand the fine-tuning to cover all the formative fields of the NEM, promoting interdisciplinary thinking and the connection between different subjects. üß©

Community and Collaboration: Create a platform for teachers to share their own examples of feedback and materials, enriching the training corpus and adapting the AI to various pedagogical methodologies. ü§ù

Our ultimate goal is to offer a tool that serves as a true driver of educational equity, adapting to the needs of each student and empowering teachers nationwide. üí™

ü§ù Contributions
This project was developed by Emiliano Dorantes for the Google Gemma 3n Hackathon on Kaggle. Thank you for the support!

project_title: Bidya AI: Education for the Unreachable
tagline: Bridging Nepal's Educational Gaps with Offline-Capable, Edge-Optimized AI
summary:
**Bidya AI
**Education for Unreachable****
Team Name: Bindu
Jeshan Pokharel (<jeshanpokharel123@gmail.com>)
Nischal Acharya ([nischalacharya642@gmail.com](mailto:nischalacharya642@gmail.com))

**Abstract**
In response to Nepal's profound educational challenges, this document introduces Bidya AI: Education for the Unreachable. Nepal's primary education system is severely hampered by a widespread shortage of teachers, with Karnali province alone facing a critical shortfall of 644 primary teacher positions. Poor and inconsistent internet quality, along with affordability issues in rural areas, further limit digital learning opportunities. Students in remote regions face arduous daily commutes, including trekking for hours across dangerous terrain and crossing perilous rivers on unsafe "tuins," which has been linked to tragic fatalities. Additionally, frequent teacher strikes disrupt the stability of primary education, undermining consistent instruction and affecting millions of children. Bidya AI addresses these problems with an easy-to-use, offline-capable AI assistant for primary school students in classes 1 through 10. The application provides personalized, supplementary content directly to mobile devices without requiring continuous internet access, leveraging the increasing smartphone ownership in remote communities. This on-hand tool ensures continuous learning despite teacher shortages, geographical barriers, and school disruptions. The project is built on the Flutter framework for its cross-platform efficiency and utilizes the edge-optimized Gemma 3n E2B model. The model was finetuned on open-source educational content from the Government of Nepal for subjects like Mathematics, Science, and Nepali. Testing revealed that while model initialization was faster on the CPU, inference time was quicker on the GPU. Despite challenges such as dependency conflicts, data preparation difficulties, and the lack of direct support for converting the model to an edge-ready format, the results prove the solution's effective performance. Bidya AI is a valuable educational aid for Nepal that can be adapted for students in other remote areas worldwide.

project_title: Cherokee to English Translation using Gemma3n
tagline: Fine-tuning the Gemma-3N model for efficient and accurate Cherokee-to-English translation.
summary:
This project demonstrates a comprehensive workflow for creating a specialized machine translation model for a low-resource language pair: Cherokee and English. The core objective is to enhance the translation capabilities of a large language model by fine-tuning it on a domain-specific dataset.

We selected Google's powerful multimodal model, gemma-3n-E2B-it, as our foundation. Using the humm/chren-dataset from Kaggle, which contains parallel Cherokee and English text, we employed a state-of-the-art technique called Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) with Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA). This approach allows us to adapt the massive base model to our specific task with significantly lower computational and memory costs compared to full fine-tuning.

The entire process was accelerated using the Unsloth library, which provides major speedups and memory optimizations. Key steps included preprocessing the data with explicit translation instructions, configuring the model with LoRA adapters, and running a supervised fine-tuning job. The result is a lightweight, fine-tuned model that is more accurate and reliable for Cherokee-to-English translation than the original general-purpose model, serving as a practical blueprint for developing AI tools for other under-resourced languages.

project_title: FreshScan.AI - Empowering Health Through On-Device Gemma 3n AI
tagline: An Android app that uses multimodal AI to analyze raw fish, fruit, and vegetable photos, giving users a quality score for healthier choices.
summary:
FreshScan.AI ‚Äì A Multimodal, Offline Edible Quality Coach Powered by Gemma 3n

Empowering Healthier Food Choices Through On-Device AI

We present a wellness-focused Android application that leverages Google‚Äôs Gemma 3n model to assess the visual quality of edibles (fish, fruits, and vegetables). The app provides a score (0‚Äì5) and a brief analysis of freshness, operating fully offline and respecting user privacy. Multilingual support (English + Hindi) ensures accessibility across India. By empowering users with real-time, AI-powered food quality scoring, we promote better health, reduce waste, and enhance food confidence.

FreshScan.AI is an offline, privacy-preserving wellness application designed to help users assess the visual quality of edible items in real-time. By analyzing images of fish, vegetables, and fruits directly on-device, it generates a discrete quality score (0‚Äì5) along with a concise, localized natural language explanation. This empowers users to make informed food decisions ‚Äî even in resource-constrained or internet-deprived environments.

tagline: An AI-powered mental health platform leveraging Gemma 3n to deliver empathetic support, gamified engagement, and professional care for India
summary:
Project Description
Chikitsa Lite is a groundbreaking mental health platform designed to address the escalating mental health crisis in India, where issues have doubled from 2011 to 2014, impacting 52% of the nation‚Äôs youth and contributing to an estimated ~87 trillion INR productivity loss between 2012-2030 (WHO). With 1 billion people globally affected by mental health challenges, Chikitsa Lite harnesses the power of Google‚Äôs Gemma 3n model to provide accessible, scalable, and empathetic mental health support. Built as a Flask-based web application, it integrates AI-driven cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) techniques, gamified engagement, emotion detection, and secular teachings from the Shreemad Bhagavad Gita to foster mindfulness and resilience.
Problem Statement

Global Crisis: 1 in 8 people worldwide suffer from mental health issues, with India facing a significant rise in cases among its youth.
Economic Impact: Mental health challenges contribute to substantial productivity losses, particularly in India, where young people are a critical economic driver.
Accessibility Gaps: Traditional solutions like in-person psychiatry (‚Çπ1500-‚Çπ3000 per session) are costly and inaccessible, while existing apps like Headspace and Wysa lack comprehensive features such as video/audio analysis or professional integration.

Our Solution: Chikitsa Lite
Chikitsa Lite offers a holistic mental health ecosystem with the following unique selling points (USPs):

AI-Driven Support: Powered by Gemma 3n via the Ollama API, Chikitsa provides empathetic, human-like responses tailored to users‚Äô emotional needs, minimizing hallucination through a carefully crafted system prompt.
Gamified Engagement: Features a cognitive game (Tap Impulse) to assess mental agility, encouraging user retention through interactive challenges.
Emotion Detection: Utilizes Gemma 3n‚Äôs multimodal capabilities for video/audio and medical image analysis to detect emotional states and provide personalized insights.
Secular Bhagavad Gita Teachings: Integrates lessons like mindfulness and detachment from outcomes, presented in an inclusive, non-religious manner.
Professional Integration: Facilitates live 1-1 video calls with doctors, with seamless appointment booking and management.
Privacy and Anonymity: Ensures user data security with encrypted storage and anonymized interactions.
Affordable Pricing: Starting at ‚Çπ299/month, Chikitsa Lite is significantly more cost-effective than traditional psychiatry.

Key Features

User Authentication: Secure login/registration with role-based access (user, doctor, admin) using bcrypt for password hashing.
Mood Tracker: Logs and visualizes emotional states, stored in JSON for easy analysis.
Meditation Logger: Tracks meditation sessions to promote consistent mindfulness practices.
Questionnaires: Randomized close-ended and open-ended questions processed by Gemma 3n to generate wellness reports.
Real-Time Chat: Interactive AI chat with empathetic responses, logged for continuous improvement.
Image/Video Analysis: Uploads analyzed by Gemma 3n for emotional and environmental insights.
Appointment System: Book and manage appointments with doctors, with email confirmations via Flask-Mail.
Gamified Cognitive Assessment: Tap Impulse game to measure cognitive control and mental fatigue.
Admin Dashboard: Manage users and roles securely.

Technical Implementation

Backend: Flask with JSON-based storage for user data, appointments, moods, and game results. Pandas handles CSV processing for questionnaires.
AI Integration: Gemma 3n (via Ollama API at http://localhost:11434) provides empathetic responses, wellness reports, and multimodal analysis. The system prompt ensures concise, gender-sensitive, and markdown-formatted outputs.
Frontend: Responsive HTML templates with Bootstrap, enhanced by JavaScript for dynamic interactions (e.g., mood logging, chat streaming).
Security: Secure file uploads with werkzeug.utils.secure_filename, bcrypt password hashing, and Flask session management.
Email Notifications: Flask-Mail with Gmail SMTP for professional appointment confirmations.
Logging: Python‚Äôs logging module for robust error tracking and debugging.

Process Flow

Login/Signup: Users register or log in securely.
Home Dashboard: Access mood tracker, meditation logger, and questionnaires.
Voice Assistant: Real-time chat with Gemma 3n for emotional support.
Book Appointment: Schedule live 1-1 video calls with doctors via Google Meet links.
My Appointments: Manage bookings and view statuses.
Emotion Detection: Upload video/audio or images for AI-driven analysis.
Gamified Interaction: Play Tap Impulse to assess cognitive performance.

Traction & Milestones

User Base: 50+ beta users actively engaging with the platform.
Achievements:
Won the Google GenAI Exchange Hackathon 2024.
Recognized by MeitY for innovative AI-driven mental health solutions.


Testimonial: "Chikitsa's innovative AI tackles a billion-dollar mental health crisis with scalable, cutting-edge technology."

Our Team

Vinayak Shinde : Trainee Engineer at Bixware Technologies Pvt Ltd, Ex-Intern at Engaggely.AI (AI expertise).
Vishal Mishra: Trainee Engineer at Bixware Technologies Pvt Ltd, Ex-Intern at Engaggely.AI (AI expertise).
Nikhil Bhoir: Engineering Trainee at Bixware Technologies Pvt Ltd, Ex-Intern at Engaggely.AI (AI expertise).

Our Mentors

Dr. Tushar Ghorpade: Assistant Professor at DY Patil RAIT, providing product and research guidance.
Dr. Sneha Bagle: Assistant Professor at DY Patil SOP, providing product and research guidance.

Impact
Chikitsa Lite addresses India‚Äôs mental health crisis by offering an affordable, accessible, and stigma-free platform for youth. By combining Gemma 3n‚Äôs advanced AI with gamified engagement and professional integration, it empowers users to manage their mental well-being proactively. The platform‚Äôs low cost (‚Çπ299/month) compared to traditional psychiatry (‚Çπ1500-‚Çπ3000/session) makes it accessible to a broader population, while features like emotion detection and Bhagavad Gita-inspired mindfulness promote long-term resilience. Chikitsa Lite aligns with the Gemma 3n Impact Challenge‚Äôs mission to build products for a better world by fostering mental health equity.
Challenges and Solutions

Challenge: Ensuring empathetic and accurate AI responses with minimal hallucination.
Solution: Optimized Gemma 3n‚Äôs system prompt for empathy, inclusivity, and evidence-based CBT techniques.


Challenge: Scalable data storage for growing user base.
Solution: Used JSON-based storage with plans to migrate to PostgreSQL for production.


Challenge: Seamless integration of multimodal features (video/audio analysis).
Solution: Leveraged Gemma 3n‚Äôs multimodal capabilities with base64-encoded uploads and robust error handling.



Future Enhancements

Transition to a relational database for improved scalability.
Implement WebRTC for real-time video recording in the Tap Impulse game.
Enhance emotion detection with advanced Gemma 3n fine-tuning for video/audio inputs.
Add multi-language support to reach non-English-speaking users.
Integrate push notifications for appointment reminders and daily mood check-ins.

Call to Action
Join us in making mental health support accessible to everyone, everywhere. Contact us at:

Email: team.surya.prabha@gmail.com
Phone: +91 7000107054 / +91 8879785320

project_title: BrailleBridge - Science Diagram and Braille Comprehension Assistant
tagline: A web+mobile app thats helps teachers export accessible lesson packs to visually impaired kids and helps them understand their homework
summary:
1. Introduction
Only 600 specialised schools in Pakistan serve the 3 million visually-impaired children in Pakistan; mainstream teachers are not Braille-literate [1].   Like many other blind or visually impaired children in Pakistan ‚Äî including those with treatable conditions ‚Äî 10-year-old Kaneez Fatima is not enrolled in school . ‚ÄúShe struggles to see the blackboard, and we‚Äôre not sure why,‚Äù her mother, Bushra Bibi, explained. ‚ÄúThe teacher said she wouldn‚Äôt be able to learn.‚Äù [2]

In Pakistan, the education of visually impaired students faces a fundamental challenge: a disconnect between the students who learn and write in Braille and the sighted teachers who cannot. This means that not only are students unable to understand lessons at school, but when they submit their homework, they often receive no meaningful correction, hindering their comprehension and isolating them in the classroom. No Urdu Braille screen-reader is available in most rural classrooms (which have no Internet and no $1000 displays).

****BrailleBridge**** was engineered to solve this problem. It is a private, offline-first, multimodal learning ecosystem that leverages the power of on-device AI to create a two-device kit that bridges the communication gap. The system empowers teachers to create and grade Braille-based assignments on a laptop, and equips students with an AI-powered Android app that not only reads lessons aloud but can **see** for them. Using the phone's camera, the app can identify what a student is touching on a physical tactile diagram, providing real-time spatial context and turning a static page into an interactive learning experience.
2. Main Components
BrailleBridge consists of two core components that work in tandem:
* ****The Teacher's Hub:****¬†A web-based application, hosted locally, that allows teachers to create assignments, view student submissions, provide tailored feedback, and see insights into student strengths and weaknesses.
* ****The Student's Companion:****¬†A voice-first Android application designed for visually impaired students, providing offline access to lessons, assignments, and AI-powered assistance with understanding spatial layouts.

The entire system is designed to be offline-first, ensuring accessibility in environments with limited or no internet connectivity, a common scenario in many schools.

project_title: Pathology Report Generation for Gigapixel-Scale WSIs using Gemma-3n (e2b)
tagline: This project aims at generating concise medical reports for pathology WSI images using Gemma-3n.
summary:
The following project aims at developing a system to produce concise medical diagnostic reports for WSI (Whole Slide Images) in pathology and healthcare. Raw data spanning 730 Gb is subjected to careful data processing for preparing a suitable dataset for all training methods and workflows covered in this project. Custom vision models involving ViTs and CNNs are made from the ground up along with fine-tuned versions of state-of-the art vision models on pathology data for improved adaptability. These models are used to fine tune Gemma-3n using new methods which train the LLM on both language modelling as well as contrastive learning at the same time. These new approaches introduced in this project outperform well known methods like CLIP or SigLIP for training vision-language models. The methods listed in the technical report attached in the write-up,  as well as in the GitHub repository cover the key aspects needed to train a pure NLP/language only LLM for vision tasks with much improved benchmarks, performance and accuracy on highly domain specific data which is not used conventionally to train the base LLMs or VLMs like Gemma-3n. This project does not use the "video"/vision modality of Gemma-3n. Yet the introduced methods adapt the LLM to process image inputs in an auto regressive manner similar to how language modelling is done by solely using it's NLP/language weights. 

I highly recommend giving the detailed report I have written out and the code repository a thorough read for a comprehensive understanding of my project 

The deployed application can be accessed via a Gradio interface hosted on HuggingFace spaces:
https://huggingface.co/spaces/aneeshm44/Gemma3nSolution

To access data for using this application, refer the Kaggle/HuggingFace datasets links mentioned in the repository's README.md file. 
Along with this a small .tiff file is also present in the "gradio_app" directory of the repository which can also be used to perform inference using the application.

tagline: Fine-tuned multimodal Gemma 3n to protect youth and the disabled from deepfake porn, sexual abuse, drugs, harassment, and domestic violence
summary:
Youth-Safe: AI-Powered Protection for the Next Generation

‚Ä¢ Tackling Critical Youth Threats: Youth-Safe addresses urgent global issues like deepfake pornography, drug abuse, domestic violence, and harassment using a mobile-first, privacy-conscious AI built on Google Gemma 3N.

‚Ä¢ Deepfake Detection at Scale: Our AI-powered Deepfake Scanner empowers users to detect if their likeness is being exploited in face-swapped or non-consensual porn circulating online‚Äîan industry growing 464% YoY.

‚Ä¢ Geo-Aware Emergency Guidance: Combines real-time geolocation with Google Maps to guide victims to the nearest safe space‚Äîshelters, police, hospitals, or crisis centers‚Äîwithin seconds, potentially saving lives.

‚Ä¢ Accessibility for All: Designed for the disabled, mute, elderly, and neurodiverse, with features like one-tap ‚ÄúDanger Mode,‚Äù AI comic/video instructions, TTS, STT, color-blind UI, and offline-first support.

‚Ä¢ AI with Ethics & Guardrails: Implements face/liveness authentication, multi-factor security, negative keyword filtering, and respectful tone generation‚Äîno judgment, no triggering responses.

‚Ä¢ Multi-Modal, Multi-Platform Intelligence: Leverages Gemma 3N to process text, voice, video, and image inputs for real-time chat, help guidance, and detection‚Äîall optimized for mobile deployment.

‚Ä¢ Government & Privacy Compliance: Built with GDPR, AIA, DPIA, and Google Responsible AI in mind; uses encrypted data, RBAC, and secure infrastructure for government and NGO readiness.

‚Ä¢ AI Architecture with Purpose: Features fine-tuned Gemma on a multi-tone corpus, deepfake detection, shelter routing, and secure app architecture‚Äîall integrated with stakeholder feedback and youth needs.

‚Ä¢ Eco-Friendly AI Deployment: Minimizes carbon impact through quantization, LoRA (NF-4), and model pruning, enabling responsible AI deployment even in resource-constrained environments.

‚Ä¢ Global Vision, Scalable Flow: Designed with a scalable MVP ‚Üí human-in-the-loop validation ‚Üí compliance & deployment ‚Üí post-launch drift monitoring‚Äîready for global rollout, real-world impact, and long-term trust.

The above is a summary of my project for the Google Gemma 3N Hackathon.

project_title: EduBuddyAi: An Offline AI Tutor for Textbook-Based Learning
tagline: Instantly explains handwritten or textbook questions using on-device multimodal AI, without needing internet access.
summary:
EduBuddyAi is an offline-first AI tutor powered by Gemma 3n. It is designed to help students get instant answers to textbook or handwritten questions without needing an internet connection. By leveraging on-device inference using Ollama and the Gemma3n model, students can either type questions or upload an image, and the app extracts the question using OCR and generates an answer using the local LLM.

The app features a simple React + Next.js frontend, Tesseract.js for OCR, and a lightweight backend API that communicates with Ollama running locally. It offers complete privacy, zero latency, and accessibility for rural, disconnected, or low-resource learning environments.

Key benefits:
- Works entirely offline and privately on personal devices
- Supports both typed and handwritten textbook question input
- Built for real-world impact in education with no internet dependency
- Easy to use, clean UI, deployable via local server

This project reimagines personalized tutoring by making powerful AI accessible to every learner, anywhere even without the cloud.

project_title: AgriLens AI - Revolutionizing Plant Disease Diagnosis Tool
tagline: AI app using Gemma 3n to help farmers in areas without any internet access to well  manage their crops regarding  plants pathologies
summary:
üèÜ Executive Summary

AgriLens AI is a transformative innovation in African agricultural technology, delivering state-of-the-art artificial intelligence directly to farmers in even the most underserved and remote areas. Powered by Google's revolutionary Gemma 3n multimodal model, AgriLens AI is the first truly offline-capable plant disease diagnosis system ‚Äî providing reliable, real-time analysis anywhere, anytime, without requiring an internet connection. This breakthrough bridges the digital divide in agriculture, empowering rural farmers with tools previously only accessible to well-connected regions.

üåæ The context of Benin, our country
*Persistent Food Insecurity & Nutritional Risks : In March 2024, more than 363,700 Beninese people (‚âà‚ÄØ6.4% of the assessed population) were classified as facing Integrated Food Security Phase 3 (Crisis)‚ÄØ World Food Programme
*A 2021‚Äì2022 survey showed 36.5% of children under five suffer from chronic malnutrition‚ÄØ
World Food Programme
*While agriculture advisory services in Benin are decentralized through local centers (CeRPAs), farm-level outreach remains very weak‚ÄØ
* In sampled villages, less than 25% received farm management advice; 42% received livestock services (often focused on cotton)‚ÄØ
* Connectivity Gaps Exclude Many Farmers from Digital Innovations: As of 2022, only 33.8% of Beninese individuals had internet access, with rural areas lagging significantly behind‚ÄØ

##üí° Why a Local, Offline AI Diagnosis System Is Essential
Core Challenge	Real Impact Locally	How AgriLens AI Helps
Slow expert reach	Farmers wait days‚Äîor go without advice‚Äîas crop infections spread rapidly.	Instant, photo-based diagnostics with actionable steps.
Language mismatch	Most farmers speak Fon, Yoruba, Bariba, or Dendi‚Äînot French or English.	Supports local dialects for greater comprehension.
No internet access	Farmers can‚Äôt use cloud-based apps or platforms.	Runs fully offline on a basic smartphone in-field.
Health & nutrition crises	Labor and education drop when crops fail, especially during hunger seasons.	Helps reduce yield losses so families can eat and children stay in school
**ü§ñ Advanced AI Technology**
- **Google Gemma 3n Multimodal Model**: State-of-the-art AI that understands both images and context
- **Offline-First Architecture**: Complete functionality without internet after initial setup
- **4-Bit Quantization**: Optimized for low-resource environments
- **Adaptive Loading**: Works on devices with as little as 4GB RAM

**üåê Universal Accessibility**
- **Bilingual Support**: French and English with easy expansion to other languages
- **Mobile-Optimized**: Seamless experience on any smartphone
- **Intuitive Interface**: Designed for users with no technical background
- **Context-Aware Analysis**: Integrates soil, climate, location, and agronomic factors

**üí° The "Farm Laptop" Revolution**
Our unique deployment strategy transforms any laptop into a mobile agricultural clinic:
1. **Initial Setup**: Download once where internet is available
2. **Field Deployment**: Transport to remote farms
3. **Daily Operation**: Instant diagnosis without any connectivity
4. **Community Impact**: One setup serves entire villages

tagline: A fully local AI assistant combining empathy, spirituality, and productivity, fine-tuned using Unsloth
authors: AYUSH ADARSH, Rajat Dugar, Tusshar Krishna, VAKATI VENKATA AKSHIT
summary:
**Cognito AI: A Local Empathetic Personal Assistant**
 Google Gemma 3n Impact Challenge Submission

**Model fine-tuned and inference using Unsloth**

 **Product Name**: Cognito AI  
** Team Members**:  
  - AYUSH ADARSH  
 -  Akshit Vakati Venkata  
-   Tusshar Krishna  
-   Rajat Dugar  

GitHub Repository: [link](https://github.com/demondeployer7/Cognito_AI)
Demo Video: [link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jq3TO41t05I)


Submission Categories:
1. Overall Track
2. Special Technology Prizes
2. Abstract & Product Overview

Cognito AI is a local-first, emotionally aware personal assistant built using Google's Gemma-3n 2B model. Designed as part of the Google Gemma-3n Impact Challenge, the assistant uniquely blends empathetic conversation, spiritual wisdom, and productivity tools ‚Äî all while prioritizing user privacy and offline performance.

Unlike traditional AI assistants, Cognito AI is trained on specialized datasets like Empathetic Dialogues, MentalChat16K, and scriptural texts from the Bhagavad Gita and The Bible, enabling it to offer deeply contextual, comforting, and insightful support to users in distress, seeking guidance, or simply managing their digital life.

Today‚Äôs AI assistants often require continuous internet access and upload sensitive user data to remote servers ‚Äî raising serious concerns about data privacy, surveillance, and loss of control over personal content. Mental health conversations, calendar events, and personal chats are deeply private and deserve on-device processing to maintain user trust and emotional safety.

Moreover, existing assistants fail to engage in emotionally intelligent dialogue. They either provide generic, scripted responses or rely on large online APIs that can't deeply understand empathy, suffering, or spiritual needs. Users deserve an assistant that feels like a compassionate friend, not just a tool.

Our model was fine-tuned on two powerful, domain-specific datasets:

1. Empathetic Dialogues[ [Rashkin et al., 2019](https://arxiv.org/abs/1811.00207)
2. MentalChat16K [Xu et al., 2025](https://arxiv.org/abs/2503.13509)

**Why These Datasets?**

 üîπ Empathetic Dialogues

Key Traits:
1.  Contains ~20,000 dialogues grounded in emotionally charged personal situations
2. Covers 32 emotion labels (e.g., Afraid, Proud, Lonely, Anxious)
3. Structured as 1on1 chats between a speaker (sharing emotional events) and a listener (responding empathetically)
4. Demonstrated in Rashkin et al. (2019) to improve perceived empathy in LLMs by human evaluators

Why We Chose It:
 1. Offers balanced emotion diversity
 2. Enables the model to learn emotional nuance in everyday language
 3. Closer to realistic one-on-one human conversations (vs. social media data)

 Citation:
 Rashkin, H., Smith, E. M., Li, M., & Boureau, Y. L. (2019). Towards Empathetic Open-domain Conversation Models: a New Benchmark and Dataset. arXiv:1811.00207


 üîπ MentalChat16K

Key Traits:
 1. Combines synthetic therapeutic conversations (from GPT3.5) and real transcripts from hospice care behavioral sessions
 2. Covers a wide range of conditions: depression, grief, anxiety, family conflict, etc.
 3. Prioritizes privacy, empathy, safety, and ethical guidance
 4. Enables simulation of counselor-client therapeutic style interactions

Why We Chose It:
 1. Provides high-quality, task-specific mental health interactions
 2. Includes longer, more realistic QA dialogues
 3. Balances depth (real interview data) and breadth (synthetic counseling data)

 Citation:
 Xu, J., Wei, T., Hou, B., et al. (2025). MentalChat16K: A Benchmark Dataset for Conversational Mental Health Assistance. arXiv:2503.13509

**Why This Matters?**

These datasets work synergistically:
1.  EmpatheticDialogues teaches the assistant how to feel with users
2. MentalChat16K teaches it how to respond therapeutically and ethically


**Building the Spiritual Reasoning Engine**

To equip Cognito AI with the ability to offer contextaware spiritual guidance, we developed a custom dualdataset Q&A corpus based on two sacred texts:

 The Bhagavad Gita (Hindu philosophy)
 The Holy Bible (Christian teachings)

This spiritual engine is designed to provide users with interpreted verses and contextual advice for emotional, moral, and existential queries.


**Step-by-Step Construction**

 1. Curating RealLife Emotional Questions
We manually compiled a list of 1,000+ realworld emotional and lifedistress questions, including themes like:
 Grief and loss
 Selfdoubt and failure
 Purpose and meaning
 Betrayal, forgiveness, anger
 Detachment, dharma, and afterlife

These questions were designed to reflect authentic human suffering and curiosity.



 2. Generating Scriptural Answers

 From Bhagavad Gita:
 We used [GitaGPT](https://bhagavadgita.io/gitagpt) ‚Äî a semantic search-based assistant trained on the Gita.
 Each of the 1,000 questions was entered into Gita-GPT to extract verse citations + interpretations
 Responses were manually verified and copy-pasted into a dataset structure

  From The Bible:
 Similarly, we used [BibleReader.ai](https://biblereader.ai) to extract Biblical answers to the same or similar questions
 Focus was on ensuring spiritual relevance, compassion, and scripture alignment



**Finalizing the Dataset**

 Created two datasets:
   Geeta spiritual QA pairs
   Bible spiritual QA pairs

To help the model distinguish context, we appended the keywords:
 - "geeta" or "gita" in Gita questions

 - "bible" in Bible questions

**MultiDataset Training Strategy**

To make Cognito AI truly empathetic, spiritually grounded, and context aware, we fine-tuned the Gemma-3n 2B model using two merged datasets:



 Stage 1: Emotional Intelligence Training

We merged:

 Empathetic Dialogues ([Rashkin et al., 2019](https://arxiv.org/abs/1811.00207))
 MentalChat16K ([Xu et al., 2025](https://arxiv.org/abs/2503.13509))
1. The training was conducted using the Unsloth LoRA + PEFT pipeline with FastModel, allowing us to:
2. Efficiently fine-tuned on the AWS g4dn.xlarge ( GPU with 16GB RAM) instance
3. Use low-rank adaptation for faster convergence
4. Preserve base model knowledge



 Stage 2: Spiritual Fine-Tuning

We merged our:

 1. Bhagavad Gita Q&A dataset

 2. Bible Q&A dataset


To preserve emotional intelligence while fine-tuning on scripture:

1.  We reduced the learning rate to 1e5

2.  Applied early stopping to prevent overfitting to spiritual data

3.  Dataset had "geeta" and "bible" keywords to assist contextual routing


**Future Work**

Here are key directions we plan to explore in the next version of Cognito AI:

1. Text-to-Speech Integration  
   Add on-device TTS for voice-based emotional conversations.

2. Edge AI Deployment  
   Optimize the model for Android using quantized Gemma-3n via MediaPipe LLM Inference API.


** References**

 Rashkin, H., Smith, E. M., Li, M., & Boureau, Y. L. (2019). [Towards Empathetic Opendomain Conversation Models: a New Benchmark and Dataset](https://arxiv.org/abs/1811.00207). arXiv preprint arXiv:1811.00207.

 Xu, J., Wei, T., Hou, B., Orzechowski, P., Yang, S., Jin, R., Paulbeck, R., Wagenaar, J., Demiris, G., & Shen, L. (2025). [MentalChat16K: A Benchmark Dataset for Conversational Mental Health Assistance](https://arxiv.org/abs/2503.13509). arXiv pre-print arXiv:2503.13509.

 Gemma Team et al. (2025). [Gemma 3 Technical Report](https://arxiv.org/abs/2503.19786). arXiv pre-print arXiv:2503.19786.

project_title: ANEETA ‚Äì Agents for National Eligibility cum Entrance Test Assistance
tagline: A Multi-Agent AI Tutor for Democratizing Medical Education In India For The Underserved & Underprivileged
summary:
Abstract

For countless aspiring doctors from India‚Äôs underserved and underprivileged communities, achieving a high percentile in the NEET medical exam remains a distant dream due to infrastructural and economic disparities. To address this, we developed **ANEETA**, a personal, AI-powered multi-agent tutor that delivers high-quality NEET preparation entirely offline, free of cost, and optimized for low-cost, government-distributed laptops without relying on network connectivity. Built on Google‚Äôs **Gemma-3n** model and the **Ollama** framework, ANEETA‚Äôs core innovation lies in its multi-agent orchestration and custom **Context-based Adaptive Prompting architecture**, enabling dynamic, personalized learning experiences tailored to each student. Learners can study in English and their Indian regional language of choice, making the platform both inclusive and accessible. By placing a sophisticated, private, and adaptive tutor in the hands of every learner, ANEETA empowers students with equitable educational opportunities, ensuring that talent and potential are no longer limited by geography, connectivity, or financial means.

Introduction to ANEETA

Our vision for ANEETA is simple yet transformative: **to democratize access to high-quality NEET coaching** for every aspiring medical student, regardless of geography or income. Success in NEET often depends on costly coaching, leaving millions of talented students behind. ANEETA breaks this barrier with a fully offline, AI-powered tutor that runs on low-cost, government-distributed laptops, no internet required. At its core is Google‚Äôs Gemma-3n model, whose lightweight translation and reasoning capabilities power our **custom multi-agent system**. This system coordinates specialized agents to deliver adaptive, high-quality learning in English and Indian regional languages, tailored to each student‚Äôs needs. This team includes:

- **Mentor Agent:** Serves as a strategic guide, offering study planning, time management, and motivational support, drawing on insights from top experts and past NEET toppers.
- **Teacher Agent:** Serves as a personal tutor, offering clear, in-depth explanations of complex concepts, grounded in official NCERT textbooks.
- **Trainer Agent:** Generates custom NEET-format quizzes on student-requested topics, based on the past three years of question papers.
- **Doubt Solver Agent:** Offers quick, targeted help solving NEET MCQs by leveraging Gemma-3n‚Äôs advanced analytical and reasoning capabilities.

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F23101766%2F72b703ab940c0cb836ebee863101c785%2FANEETA%20Tech%20Report-5_1.png?generation=1754469142005272&alt=media)

This system is designed not only to be effective but also inclusive, with the capability to instruct students in English and a variety of Indian regional languages, ensuring that language is no longer a barrier to learning. The following sections will detail the architecture of this multi-agent system and the innovations that power its offline capabilities.

Technology Stack: Engineering for Local Deployment

Our technology stack was chosen with one core principle: enabling robust, local, offline-first deployment on entry-level laptops. Each component is open source, lightweight, high-performance, and ideal for creating a self-contained AI ecosystem.

- **Gemma-3n:** ANEETA uses Google's Gemma-3n, a lightweight 2B/4B parameter model perfect for consumer CPUs, enabling efficient local deployment. Its out-of-the-box reasoning and translation capabilities excel at explaining complex science and multilingual instruction. ANEETA adapts to a user's laptop configuration by selecting the best-suited model.
- **Embedding Models (nomic-embed-text):** Our RAG pipeline uses nomic-embed-text, a compact, high-performing text embedding model that runs locally, transforming educational content into vector representations without cloud APIs.
- **ChromaDB:** AI-native database for vector search, stores and queries vector embeddings. Its local, persistent, and searchable knowledge base enables ANEETA's offline functionality.
- **Ollama:** Gemma-3n and nomic-embed-text embedding models are deployed locally via Ollama, streamlining model management and allowing focus on application logic.
- **LangGraph:** It was chosen for ANEETA to create and manage a multi-agent system. Its graph-based framework represents agents as nodes, enabling cyclical, robust, and stateful information flow, which is vital for processing complex, multi-step student queries.
- **Streamlit:** Streamlit powers ANEETA's user interface, selected for its simplicity and rapid development of interactive, user-friendly applications, creating an intuitive and engaging learning environment for students with minimal complexity.

ANEETA Architecture

At the core of ANEETA is a multi-agent system designed for robust, stateful, and intelligent orchestration, powered by the reasoning capabilities of Gemma-3n. Rather than relying on a single monolithic model, ANEETA delegates tasks to specialized agents, enhancing accuracy, modularity, and responsiveness. The entire system is built using **LangGraph**, enabling workflows to be defined as stateful, directed graphs that support complex, cyclical interactions.

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F23101766%2F63f399ebfbb6014ebef821e38fd8c0f7%2FStart.jpg?generation=1754500382154364&alt=media)

#

tagline: GemmaThrive is an offline AI app that helps you organize tasks, map ideas, and journal reflectively, privately and distraction-free.
summary:
**üåø GemmaThrive: Technical Writeup**

**GemmaThrive** is an offline-first, AI-powered desktop productivity and wellness assistant tailored specifically for neurodivergent individuals, including those impacted by ADHD, anxiety, burnout, or cognitive overload. Powered by Google's cutting-edge Gemma 3n model via **Ollama**, GemmaThrive integrates intelligent task management, emotional journaling, dynamic project planning, and visual mind-mapping into a seamless, private, and offline user experience.

**Problem Statement**

Current productivity tools primarily serve neurotypical users, often failing neurodivergent individuals by requiring rigid adherence to structured routines, providing limited emotional support, and relying on constant internet access. GemmaThrive addresses these gaps by:

- Offering a deeply personalized, emotionally supportive AI.
- Ensuring complete user privacy and autonomy.
- Delivering structured, manageable, and actionable task breakdowns.
- Operating entirely offline, removing barriers related to connectivity and cost.

**Architecture Overview:**
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F24511302%2F901457f2b02bb2f151064acd13fff4b5%2FSoftware%20Architecture%20Flow%20Diagram.png?generation=1754343628488053&alt=media)

GemmaThrive leverages a modular local-first architecture:
- **Frontend:** React (Vite + MUI + Electron)
- **Backend:** Flask (Python) with subprocess integration
- **LLM Layer:** Gemma 3n via Ollama (gemma3n:e2b)
- **Storage:** Local React state (offline)

**How Gemma 3n is Used**
Gemma 3n is central to GemmaThrive, enabling context-rich, emotionally aware, and structured interactions through:

**- Tasks Tab:** Breaks down tasks into actionable steps.
**- Projects Tab:** Generates subtasks and assigns realistic due dates.
**- Planner Tab:** Creates personalized daily schedules with wellness integration.
**- MindMap Tab:** Structures complex ideas into visual mind maps.
**- SupportMe Tab:** Provides therapeutic journaling prompts and personalized reflections.

All prompts are carefully structured for immediate relevance and actionable insights without relying on external memory.

**Feature Breakdown**

**üóÇÔ∏è Tasks Tab ‚Äî Where Sticky Notes Think for Themselves**
Interactive Kanban board with AI-driven sticky notes, priority color-coding, and drag-and-drop interactivity.

Unlike traditional boards, this one feels alive:
- **Sticky notes that talk back:** Each task is AI-enabled, tap a card and let Gemma suggest the best way to start, break it down into smaller steps, or even reframe your procrastination into action.
- **Color-coded by priority:** Tasks are automatically styled based on urgency and importance ‚Äî helping you focus without overthinking.
- **Drag & drop across columns:** Seamlessly move your notes between To Do, In Progress, Review, and Done. Each column adapts with smooth animations and modern UI polish.

**Gemma‚Äôs Role:** Gemma doesn‚Äôt just suggest, she executes. Tap ‚ÄúLet Gemma Help‚Äù and she‚Äôll turn your vague goal into an actionable task list tailored to your energy, time, and focus level.

**The Problem It Solves:** Overwhelmed minds often avoid starting. This tab removes friction by making task management visual, responsive, and conversational. It‚Äôs not just a board, it‚Äôs a thinking space that works with you.
 
**üß©Projects Tab ‚Äî Where Goals Get Their Own Space**
Dedicated Kanban boards per project, automated subtask generation, due-date assignment, and granular task breakdowns.

Unlike the main Tasks Tab, which manages day-to-day stickies on a unified board, Projects Tab lets you create fully separate boards for each project, so you can focus deeply without mental clutter.

- Manually create projects and add subtasks at your own pace or tap into Gemma‚Äôs planning magic
- **Let Gemma Plan It:** She‚Äôll instantly generate a structured subtask list based on your project title and description
- **Auto-assigns due dates:** Gemma gives each subtask a reasonable deadline so your goals stay time-bound and not just ‚Äúsomeday‚Äù
- **Dedicated Kanban board for every project:** Drag, edit, and delete subtasks across columns just like in the main board ‚Äî but scoped to that project alone
- **Interactive sticky notes:** Tap any subtask to edit it or click ‚ÄúBreak This Down with Gemma‚Äù for even more granular starter steps
- **Track autonomy:** Treat each project as its own micro-environment with full control and fewer distractions

**Gemma‚Äôs Role:** She‚Äôs your strategic co-pilot. Not only does she generate subtasks based on your project‚Äôs scope, she assigns due dates, estimates effort, and lets you further break down tasks with context. You‚Äôre never stuck staring at a blank board again.

**The Problem It Solves:** Big goals often die in general to-do lists. The Projects Tab gives each vision a home, and Gemma turns intentions into timelines. It‚Äôs clarity without chaos, helping you follow through, one board at a time.

**üìÖ Planner Tab ‚Äî Your Day, Designed by Gemma**
Calendar-integrated daily planning driven by AI-generated schedules including wellness and productivity balance.

- **Calendar View:** All your tasks (from Tasks Tab and Projects Tab) appear neatly on a calendar, so you can plan visually and intuitively.
- **‚ÄúLet Gemma Plan My Day‚Äù button:** Tap once, and Gemma will:
     - Pick the most relevant tasks for today
     - Prioritize based on urgency and due dates
     - Insert wellness reminders and breathing space

- **Offline + Dynamic:** No internet needed. Gemma generates your daily plan locally using your actual task data and due dates
- **Checklist + Timeline:** Alongside your calendar, you‚Äôll get a step-by-step breakdown of your day‚Äôs flow so you always know what to do next
- **Includes balance:** Gemma‚Äôs plan isn‚Äôt just about productivity, it includes wellness suggestions.

**Gemma‚Äôs Role:** Gemma becomes your daily planner, wellness coach, and task prioritizer, all in one. She reduces decision fatigue, adapts to your workload, and reminds you to be human, not just productive.

**The Problem It Solves:** Most planners expect you to figure it out. This tab removes the guesswork by letting Gemma structure your day in a way that‚Äôs achievable, healthy, and motivating so you can stop stressing and start doing.

**üß† MindMap Tab ‚Äî Turn Thoughts Into Clear, Visual Structure**
Dynamic mind mapping with automated hierarchical structuring and draggable nodes for intuitive brainstorming.

Whether you're brainstorming a passion project, planning a networking strategy, or untangling a messy thought, this tool helps you organize the mess in your mind.

- Enter any idea or prompt and instantly see it bloom into a visual mind map
- Gemma organizes your thoughts into:
      - Sections like subtopics, questions, ideas, or action plans
      - Clear top-down or radial layouts (your choice!)

- Every node includes context, not just a word, but a helpful explanation so you understand each part
- Offline + AI-powered: The structure is generated locally using your input and enhanced with Gemma‚Äôs semantic understanding

**‚úçÔ∏è SupportMe  ‚Äî Reflect Deeper. Feel Seen.**
Private, conversational journaling with emotionally intelligent prompts, follow-up questions, and insightful summaries.

- **Pick your journal:** Choose from built-in options like Gratitude, Dreams, Relationships Check-in, or create your own
- **Receive a thoughtful prompt:** Let Gemma generate a gentle, emotionally intelligent question tailored to your journal type
- **Write freely in a guided chat flow:** Prompts appear like a conversation. Respond at your pace. Gemma listens.
- **Follow up questions:**  Based on what you write, Gemma asks deeper questions to help you explore feelings and discover patterns
- **Reflection summary:** Once you're done, Gemma offers a personalized insight, often comforting, uplifting, and affirming
- **Progress tracker:** A visual 4-step guide shows where you are: Pick Journal ‚Üí Choose Prompt ‚Üí Write & Reflect ‚Üí Done

No cloud. No login. No judgment. Your entries stay on your device, it‚Äôs your private space to process emotions safely

**Gemma‚Äôs Role:** Gemma acts like an empathetic listener and cognitive mirror, reading between the lines, highlighting your strength, and helping you connect meaning to your experiences. Her responses are grounded in your story.

**The Problem It Solves:** Many people struggle to process emotions or build a consistent reflection habit. The SupportMe Tab makes it easier by giving structure to your healing, a voice to your thoughts, and warmth to your solitude, all without requiring therapy sessions or internet access.

Every tab works offline, privately, and seamlessly, giving you an all-in-one assistant for mental clarity and daily productivity.

**Technical Challenges & Solutions**

1. Stable Local Execution
Used Python's subprocess.run with robust error-handling:
`def call_gemma(prompt: str) -> dict:
    cmd = ["ollama", "run", "gemma3n:e2b", prompt, "--format", "json"]
    result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True)
    return json.loads(result.stdout)`

2. Parsing Gemma Output
Structured prompts resulted in predictable outputs, parsed using:
`const steps = response.split("\n").filter(line => line.trim() !== "");`

3. Interactivity Preservation
React state management allowed editable, interactive tasks:
`{tasks.map((task, index) => (
  <StickyNoteCard key={index} task={task} onEdit={handleEdit} />
))}`

4. Prompt Context Management
Provided complete prompt context in each interaction:
`const followUpPrompt = `Ask follow-up based on journal: ${entry}`;`

5. Multi-Board UI Management
Used unique Droppable IDs with React-beautiful-dnd for distinct boards:
`<Droppable droppableId={`project-${project.id}`}></Droppable>`

**Conclusion & Future Directions**
GemmaThrive empowers neurodivergent users by combining emotional intelligence, structured productivity, and absolute privacy. Moving forward, GemmaThrive will expand into multimodal inputs (audio/image), mobile device compatibility, and encrypted local storage.

GemmaThrive illustrates that the future of AI is empathetic, offline-capable, and personally empowering, redefining what productivity and mental wellness tools can be.

project_title: LENTERA: Offline AI Microserver for Remote & Rural Schools
tagline: Low-cost offline microserver bringing educational content & AI to disconnected schools at <5% of typical internet deployment cost
summary:
üåü Project Overview
**LENTERA** (meaning "light" in Bahasa Indonesia) is a low-cost, offline AI microserver designed to bring generative AI and rich educational content to disconnected schools for less than 5% of typical internet infrastructure costs, helping to close both the connectivity and AI access gaps in underserved communities.

‚ö†Ô∏è Problem
According to Giga (2021), connecting 86,000 schools across 17 countries would require $454M upfront and $1.5B in operational costs - an insurmountable cost barrier for solving the digital divide.

On top of that, the World Economic Forum (2025) warns of an emerging "AI divide" where 2.5 billion people without internet access will be excluded from the AI revolution transforming education, creating a new layer of inequality for communities already struggling with basic connectivity.

Typical solutions remain economically unfeasible in rural areas due to high infrastructure costs, low population density, and longer investment payback periods, making innovative infrastructure-independent approaches essential to bridge this gap.

üí° Solution: Bringing AI to the Last Mile
Powered by **Gemma 3n**, LENTERA is an offline educational AI system that transforms affordable hardware into a powerful learning hub for schools without internet access. It combines:

1. **Offline AI**: On-device Gemma 3n model (E2B quantized) enables intelligent contextual responses without internet connection
2. **Comprehensive educational library**: 120GB+ of curated content from Wikipedia, LibreTexts, Khan Academy, and more
3. **AI-powered learning tools**:
   - **Semantic Search**: Intelligent search that understands query intent and context
   - **Article Summarization**: Creates concise summaries of educational materials
   - **FlashQuiz**: Automatically generates quiz questions from content
   - **MindMap**: Produces visual knowledge maps for complex topics
   - **ELIx**: Adapts explanations according to age/education level
4. **Multilingual support**: Provides native support for local languages
5. **Multi-device**: Creates local Wi-Fi hotspot accessible from any device (phones, tablets, laptops)
6. **Cost-effective**: $350-500 per device with no subscription fees or internet costs

**LENTERA** marks a leap forward from platforms like [RACHEL](https://worldpossible.org/products/rachel-5-500) and [Kolibri](https://learningequality.org/kolibri/about-kolibri/), evolving from static content delivery to interactive, AI-powered learning. It‚Äôs the difference between ‚Äúhere‚Äôs information‚Äù and ‚Äúlet me help you understand.‚Äù And it does so at less than 5% of what typical internet infrastructure requires. As a result, LENTERA delivers advanced technology that's both accessible and scalable for underserved communities.
