project_title: child's friend , old man's partner and  people‚Äò spiritual Home
tagline: help remote people take care of the child and old man with privacy ,listen to depressed people‚Äò trouble anytime provide positive energy
summary:
Project One:'baby Friend' or children's Friend

      There are many Left-behind children worldwild,who are lack of companionship and love.Parents have to leave their baby home due to the work in a big city or any other reason for reality.They worry about the child every moment,Is he lonely in the home?Or No one reply to baby right away? How is the baby feeling?
      Baby grow up in a Left-Behind environment, often develop weak language skills,have poor sense of happyness, which is a pitty even when he grow up.So Can the technology tool sovle this social problem?
      With the help of Gemma 3N,we can develop a good partner of left home baby, a good helper of worried parents at homeÔºåwhich can protect the family and baby privacy completely on the offline mode.We plan to develop a App called 'Baby Friend'.It can also be put in a baby's toy like bear doll,playing the role of a toy or pet with more intelligence,and could talk to.
     The parents can talk to the 'Baby Friend',teach it how to take care of the baby.such as the name ,hobby, personalityÔºålike and dislike,or other details and tips and cautions.How to calm the baby when he feel down?How to comfort him when he miss mum?The parents can upload some voice of their interaction with the baby.The 'Baby Friend' will learn and mimic the parent's sound ray.The 'Baby Friend' can learn the pattern or features of the parents  futher.When the parents go home after a day or several days or several hours,'Baby Friend' can give a report about her baby,How the baby feel,or what subject the baby always talk,which story the baby most like,what is the baby's hope? For example more hugs from parents.How the Language skills and thinging skills develop? what capability is the baby good at and weak of?

       When feel lonely or boring,the baby will try to chat with her toy like a bear with the 'Baby Friend' hide in.The baby speak to 'Baby Friend','Baby Friend' transform the voice to language, then reply to the baby with the voice.The baby can also put in a picture to 'Baby Friend' and ask quesions.In this mode,'Baby Friend' will serve the baby using the chat_casual() function.The baby can upload a picture she draws,and 'Baby Friend' give a reply and encouragement.

There are other situations 'Baby Friend' handle using other special functions.

1.When baby want to listen to storys, 'Baby Friend' will accompany the baby using the chat_story() function.In the storytelling mode,'Baby Friend' can perform the story vivid using voice.it is ready to stop and reply to the baby's questions.It is the interactive story telling style that mimic real mum tell story and baby think,feel and ask question.

chat_story() function is better than chat_casual() in several ways.It have more storys to choose,like Andersen's Fairy TalesÔºåDisney storyÔºåPeppa PigÔºåFairy taleÔºåMythological story all around the world, Japan anime story like One Piece.In's the collection of the excellent story globally that is suited for baby,including diffrent culture and nation.The story can unlock baby's imagination,enhance baby's feeling perception, improve cognitive ability, promote language development,reshape her character.

When a baby want to listen to story,chat_story() choose a story,and act the story vivid using voice that is attactive for the baby.The baby can immerse in the plot,the baby may ask a question,chat_story() will stop story telling,and reply baby's question with patience and love, then go on story telling.The baby can talk about how him feel when he listen the story, and discuss with 'Baby Friend'.
In a short, chat_story() have more excellent story all of the culture and nation.chat_story() can act the story vivid that is attactive.chat_story() can interative with the baby when tell a story,answer questions,discuss the plot and feeling of the baby.

2.When baby want to play house or other role play games.'Baby Friend' will play with the baby using the chat_roleplay() function.The baby like to Fictitious a situation and play with her toy, other frineds,or 'Baby Friend'.'Baby Friend' will 
 cooperate with the baby and play with him happyly.
 For example,the baby will play the role of a doctor,and learn to help a patient.Following the demand of the baby,'Baby Friend' pretend to be a patient, feel very uncomfortable, reply to the baby's inquiry, and Cooperate with the baby to take the injection,and take medicine,then he pretend to recover health and thank the baby.
 Or the baby will play the role of a parent to take care of small baby ,'Baby Friend' will play role of a weak baby.

 Is it intersting? Playing is human or animal's nature,Through playing games,the baby's learn how to solve the problem,take responsibility, overcome difficulties,and gain  a sense of fulfillment and confidence.When playing games,it's like a simulation of real situation and grow-up.Playing role-play games have many benefitions of the baby,and is a nature of the baby,So 'Baby Friend' will take the roleplay games seriously,and accompany the baby to play and grow.
 when the child listen to the story,he may want to play the role of the classical role ,he may choose a situation of the classical film,and ask the 'Baby Friend' to act with her,like The Evil Stepmother of Snow White ask the MagicMirror who is the prettiest woman in the world?It's the extension of chat_story() function,after listen to a story,could act it out.

compare with the chat_casual() function, chat_roleplay() is good at playing role play games with the growing-up baby,it is more open and full of imagination.It can suit to the baby's ability and incline of his age.

 3.When baby feel depressed or other bad emitions,'Baby Friend' will coax the baby with the chat_emotion() function.
 when the baby feels bad,'Baby Friend' will coax the baby with any way.Cheer Up  the baby with all kinds of efforts.
 it will  perform analysis the reason ,and respond accordingly.When the baby feel discarded by their parents,ask why mum not stay by their side,'Baby Friend' will comfort the child,mum is doing something important,she miss the baby and will come back home soon. It will direct the baby to a more active emotion.But when the baby is sick ,have a fever,Baby Friend' will contact with their parents immeditely.

 Compare to the chat_casual() function, chat_roleplay() is more good at handing with emotions,good at coaxing and comforting the baby.It take the parents's advice and instuct of how to coax the baby,and explore which way is right for the baby.

 At last, the parents come home,and ask the 'Baby Friend' how the baby bahave when they are left.'Baby Friend' will use the chat_report() function
 recall the interaction with the baby,analysis and reason ,give a report of the baby.For example,
 Xinxin like to play role-play games recently, she is more creative than before,and her language skills develops quickly.
 she draw many pictures,seems to be intested in drawing right now,You can consider to buy some drawing books for her.she is happy most of the time.Or jary feel lonely and discarded for some time,and I can not coax him easily,please take more attention for him and accompy him for longer time.consider to hug him more.  


Project Two: old man partnership

More and more countries step into the Aging society, old man need partnership and love,but young people are often survive their own work and family and have no enough time and resource to take care of the old man very well.
Old man often have weak enegy and stay at home for long time in a day,often feel neglected by the family ,having  poor 
Sense of participation of life,feel isolation from the society and poor sense of meaning and happiness.  

With the help of Gemma 3N,we can build a product that can  improve old man's life quality,promote their sense of happiness.'old man partnership' is built for improving the health and happiness of the old man.

Most of the app and product is designed for the young man,ignoring the demand of the old man,or lack special desigh for the old man.'old man partnership' is built for helping the old man,and meet their demand.We care about their health and mantal health.

chat_casual() can accompany the old man and reply to old man demand through voice,without need to type in the text.
and suit to old man to speak slowly and loudly,beacuse they react slowly and have poor hearing ability.


chat_health() is proficient in medical knowledge,and aged care, and symptoms of illness,is a good health assistant for the old.when the old man talk about his health conditions,chat_health() serve the old man.it can remind the old man to take medicine on time, provide medical info.

It will provide medical info when old man ask,for example, when old man is not comfortable and measure blood pressure
chat_health() will tell old man if the blood pressure too high ,or is not dangerous?

If chat_health() judge old man may have some disease,it will suggest old man to go to hospital.For example old man tell it find blood in stool,Or it find the old man's language and cognitive ability decline seriously, it will suggest the old man to suspect Alzheimer.

If it is emergency,for example, old man have some premonitory signs of stroke,it will contact the guardian to take action .if no one respond,it will  call the hospital for help using the address info guardian tell it.



chat_news() is built for the news and info demand for the old man. If old man care about society,chat_news() will provide 
society news,and could talk about the news with the old man.The old man still have a sense of society participation.
if old man like to listen family info,like family ethics,chat_news() will tell story of many family which is hot recently.
chat_news()  could choose the right news according the old man's need,and could tell about the news interatively.
For example,Is there something hot recently?yes,our city build a new airplane ,and will open this month.Oh,that's great!My son could come here more conviniently.Yes,it will save some time and money for Tom to come here!
Or Your favarite football player win the competition this week!Oh, he is great,my hero.



chat_playgames() is built for the games that is suited for the old man.It is more slow but still interesting,and could get happiness,and help to maintain cognitive ability.For example,the guessing games


chat_request_from_guardian() is built for the guardian to teach the 'old man partnership' how to take care of the old man,For exmple,Her name,age,his disease history and health records ,character, hobby,likes and dislikes.For example,please help me to take care of my mum,She is 80 years old,she has Short Temper ,please remind her to slow down,and rest a lot.She has diabetes disease, need to take dtugs three times every day,please remind her to take it on time.She is a fan of Dongyuhui.She like to listen to talk show and other language-style jokes.


chat_report() is built for the guardian to ask 'old man partnership' about old man's circumstance.chat_report() first recall the records about the old man and give a report about health and mental health.For example,Your mum take the drug on time quite well.She have a happy time this period.Do not worry.Or He has a lumbago recently,and seems to increase. He is quite depressed and talk little.Consider to take him to hospital.





Project Three: Depressed man's tree hole

While the child and old man is weak and need care and love from others and is easy to be isolated to the familyÔºåoften feel lonely.The adult's life is not easy either.They often suffer from the stress and setbacks.There are painful and unbearable days even for the most lucky man.
Adolescent may suffer from academic pressure and other adolescent troubles such as anxiety or conflicts.
graduate may suffer from frustrating in finding a job.Adult may lose jobs or breakup or divorce.Life is painful.
They may lack enough support from around.Some one could survive,others can not.
Can technology progress help people to relieve pain and promote happiness ?
Yes, technology should help many people,give them enough support,give them professional guidance.In the past,people survive a  mental crisis with luck,But now,we could support people with the technology method,we could  bulid a AI product with  standardized  and copyness , that could serve many people with high-quality mental support. and cost little.
People around the world should find good mental support if they need it, Then the technology progress really benefit mankind,not only to provide convenience,but also to promote quality of life and happiness index.

Depressed man's tree hole is designed to help people to get rid of pain and trouble,with more positive energy and sense of happiness.
There are two mode,offline and online mode.

tagline: Sharing Real-Time Discoveries, Fighting Human-Created Fake News with AI.
summary:
TruthSync: Technical Writeup for the Gemma 3n Impact Challenge
1. Project Overview
TruthSync is an innovative, real-time journalism platform designed to combat the spread of fake news by leveraging Google's Gemma-3n-E4B-it model. The system empowers citizen journalists to create authentic, location-based news articles and a crowdsourced, on-the-ground verification mechanism. This project directly addresses the hackathon's core theme by demonstrating Gemma 3n's multimodal, real-time, and resource-efficient capabilities to create a tangible positive impact.

2. Technical Architecture
The TruthSync application is built on a modern, full-stack architecture that is optimized for mobile-first, low-resource environments.

Frontend (Angular)
The user-facing application is an Angular single-page application (SPA). Its modular structure is designed to be responsive, accessible, and intuitive.

camera/: Handles real-time device camera access, photo capture, and the collection of essential metadata (GPS, orientation).

evaluation/: Facilitates the location-based verification process, allowing users to vote on nearby articles.

services/: A suite of services (ai.service.ts, location.service.ts, post.service.ts) manages communication with the backend, device sensors, and local data.

Backend (FastAPI + Gemma-3n)
The backend is a high-performance server built with FastAPI, acting as the central hub for AI processing, data management, and real-time streaming.

Image Processing: Before being fed to the model, images are processed to handle EXIF metadata (e.g., orientation), ensuring the input is correctly formatted.

AI Model Integration: The FastAPI server orchestrates the Gemma-3n pipeline. It receives image data and user prompts, then streams the generated text back to the client.

Streaming Response: A key technical innovation is the use of real-time text streaming, powered by Server-Sent Events (SSE), to provide a responsive and engaging user experience.

3. Implementation of Gemma 3n
The core innovation of TruthSync lies in its specific and controlled use of the Gemma-3n model.

Multimodal Input: The model is fed with both visual (the captured photo) and textual (a system prompt and optional user description) data to generate a detailed news article. This directly utilizes Gemma 3n's multimodal capabilities.

System Prompt for Controlled Journalism: A carefully crafted system prompt (ÎãπÏã†ÏùÄ Îâ¥Ïä§ Í∏∞Ïûê ÏûÖÎãàÎã§. Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄÎ•º ÌÜµÌï¥ ÏÉÅÏÑ∏Ìûà Í∏∞ÏÇ¨Î•º ÏûëÏÑ±Ìï¥Ï£ºÏÑ∏Ïöî.) ensures the model adopts the persona of a journalist, thereby controlling the tone and style of the generated content to be factual and report-like.

Efficient Resource Management: By deploying Gemma 3n as a selective-parameter-activated model (8B parameters run with 4B memory footprint), the backend is optimized for lower computational requirements. This ensures the system remains responsive, even under moderate load, and demonstrates the model's suitability for a wide range of devices.

4. Global Impact
TruthSync's location-based verification system has the potential to become a powerful tool for fighting misinformation and promoting authentic journalism. By democratizing the news creation process and introducing a community-driven verification layer, it empowers local communities and enhances transparency in journalism.

5. Conclusion
TruthSync is a technically sound and socially impactful application that showcases the power and flexibility of the Gemma-3n-E4B-it model. By combining a modern full-stack architecture with strategic Gemma 3n implementation and a unique verification mechanism, the project delivers a compelling solution to a pressing global problem. The live demo, technical report, and public code repository collectively provide a comprehensive view of our project's innovation and execution.

tagline: Identify species from flower image offline with finetuned Gemma 3n model
summary:
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F961556%2Fe516ba5355fdcf3110913d0804532204%2FScreenshot%202568-08-04%20at%2020.43.19.png?generation=1754315236721267&alt=media)
https://botanist.mekpro.dev

We present a novel approach to fine-tuning Google's Gemma-3n multimodal model for accurate plant species identification on edge devices. Our methodology addresses the fundamental challenges of limited model capacity and lightweight vision encoders through three innovative techniques: multi-task supervised fine-tuning that leverages hierarchical botanical features, model-assisted data curation using consensus mechanisms, and Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) for cross-modal consistency. By training on the PlantNet300K dataset, we demonstrate that careful fine-tuning strategies can overcome the limitations of small-scale multimodal models, achieving significant improvements in plant species identification accuracy while maintaining the efficiency required for offline mobile deployment. This work contributes to both the technical advancement of vision-language models and the practical goal of environmental conservation to promote and track biodiversity through accessible technology.
**Result:** Our fine-tuned model achieves 22% accuracy for exact species identification in Top-5 predictions‚Äîimpressive considering the model runs entirely offline on mobile devices. Even more encouraging, it correctly identifies genus-level classification 66% of the time and can accurately recognize complex botanical concepts like inflorescence types at 58% accuracy. Remarkably, our GRPO optimization, despite operating only on text outputs, improved image classification performance by up to 10%, demonstrating the power of cross-modal learning.

Gemma-3n Botanist Vision LLM: Enhanced Plant Species Identification through Multi-Task Fine-Tuning and Reinforcement Learning

1. Introduction
Picture a botanist deep in a rainforest, miles from the nearest cell tower, discovering an unfamiliar flowering plant. Or imagine a conservation volunteer surveying plants in a remote mountain meadow, needing quick, reliable species identification to document biodiversity. These scenarios play out daily for field researchers, conservationists, and nature enthusiasts worldwide. Yet despite carrying smartphones with impressive cameras, they often can't identify plants on the spot due to lack of internet connectivity or the limitations of existing offline tools.
We developed the Gemma-3n Botanist Vision Model specifically to solve this real-world challenge. Our goal was simple: create a plant identification system that runs entirely on a phone, works without internet, and delivers accurate results even on devices with limited computing power. This meant working within strict constraints‚Äînot just technical ones, but practical ones that field botanists face every day.
Our Technical Approach: We chose Google's Gemma-3n as our foundation because it excels at mobile deployment and requires minimal resources to run‚Äîperfect for field conditions where battery life and processing power are precious. Starting with the PlantNet300K dataset, we implemented a sophisticated fine-tuning strategy to transform this general-purpose model into a botanical expert.
Our approach goes beyond simple species classification. Through multi-task learning, we taught the model to understand botanical relationships‚Äîhow flower color, shape, and inflorescence patterns work together to identify species. This mirrors how human botanists think, using multiple morphological clues to narrow down possibilities. We then applied Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) as a final refinement stage to enhance accuracy and ensure consistent, botanically sound predictions.

2. Technical Approach

project_title: Multimodal News Generation System Powered by Gemma 3n
tagline: Using Gemma 3n Full Multimodal Capabilities
summary:
Introduction **Gemma 3n** is a powerful AI model developed by Google that can understand and generate text, audio, and images, all in one system. It also supports over 140 languages, making it useful in many parts of the world. What makes it special is that it can run directly on devices and doesn‚Äôt need an internet connection, making it ideal for real-world use, even during emergencies. In this write-up, we explore the full potential of Gemma 3n by building News'ly, an AI-powered reporter that takes in voice recordings and visual evidence to automatically generate well-structured news articles. The project demonstrates how a single, self-contained model can perform transcription, image understanding, and narrative generation on end devices, all without needing external APIs or internet access. Real-Life Context Philippines Metro Manila, including flood-prone areas like Marikina, Quezon City, and Manila itself, faces regular inundation during typhoon season. Due to poor drainage, urban density, and its location along major river systems, even moderate rainfall can lead to severe flooding. These conditions disrupt transportation, displace families, and endanger lives, especially during peak months from June to September. As climate change increases the frequency and intensity of extreme weather, the need for rapid, on-the-ground reporting becomes more critical than ever. The Problem Field reporters are expected to stay alert and responsive at all times, especially during emergencies. But under intense pressure, >the manual workload of transcribing interviews, analyzing images, and writing reports from scratch becomes overwhelming. These tasks are not only time-consuming but also susceptible to critical errors. **In high-stakes situations like typhoons or flooding, such delays and inaccuracies can severely impact the public‚Äôs access to timely, accurate, and life-saving information.** The Solution: A Multi Modal Reporter Assistant Powered by gemma 3n A system built to be a reporter's digital field assistant. It streamlines the news generation pipeline by using the multimodal capabilities of Gemma 3n to: 1. Transcribe Interviews: Automatically convert recorded audio interviews into accurate text. 2. Analyze Images: Instantly generate descriptive captions for photos taken at a scene. 3. Draft Reports: Synthesize the transcribed text and image descriptions into a coherent, well-structured news article. 4. Revise & Refine: Allow the reporter to provide feedback and request revisions, ensuring the final output meets standards. 5. Work Offline: Operate entirely offline on a device, a critical feature for reporting from remote areas where internet is non-existent. >This approach transforms a multi-hour manual process into a matter of minutes, enabling real-time, reliable reporting under pressure and freeing up reporters to focus on verification and storytelling, even when there‚Äôs no internet connection. Application Architecture & Workflow 1. Backend (NewsReporterAgent) ‚Ä¢ Handles transcription, image description, report generation, revision, and saving‚Äîpowered entirely by the Gemma 3n model. 2. Frontend (Gradio UI, for DEMO ONLY) ‚Ä¢ Lets users upload media, view AI outputs, give feedback, and save the final report‚Äîall in an intuitive, offline-friendly interface.

Application Workflow

The system follows a simple yet powerful workflow, designed for rapid field deployment, especially in offline scenarios. **How It Works in the Field** **Scenario:** A new's reporter or journalist in flood-prone Metro Manila arrives at a disaster scene. 1. Capture Scene: ‚Ä¢ Take a photo of the location (e.g., a flooded street) ‚Ä¢ Record an interview with a victim or witness using any mobile voice recorder or record directly using the app 2. Upload Inputs to the app: ‚Ä¢ Audio and image are fed into the app running on a mobile device or local laptop 3. Automatic Processing (Offline): ‚Ä¢ The app transcribes the interview ‚Ä¢ Describes the image ‚Ä¢ Drafts a news report using both sources >**Report Generation Guidelines** The quality of the generated report is directly dependent on the input data ‚Äî including the transcribed text, image context, and the prompt itself (**which can be adjusted until it meets our desired standard**). To ensure a more complete and accurate output, it is recommended to provide a longer and more detailed audio recording. If the generated report requires changes, the revision feature supports iterative improvements... 4. Reporter Feedback: ‚Ä¢ The reporter reviews the article ‚Ä¢ Provides comments like ‚Äúadd more urgency‚Äù, "delete this", or ‚Äúfocus on quotes‚Äù 5. Revised Final Output: ‚Ä¢ The AI revises the draft ‚Ä¢ The final version is saved and ready to publish or report live on TV broadcast **The system demonstrates how Gemma 3n can perform all tasks and operate entirely offline while still delivering high-quality multimodal outputs. No server, no API keys, no internet ‚Äî just a mobile phone or laptop.* Challenges & Development Journey Building a multimodal system wasn‚Äôt easy, especially with the goal of using only Gemma 3n‚Äôs capabilities on limited hardware (I had no GPU üòî). 1. **Hardware Bottlenecks** The biggest challenge was the lack of a local GPU, which made most typical deployment strategies impractical. Offline use was especially difficult to test efficiently on CPU-only machines. 2. **Tooling Dead Ends** ‚Ä¢Ollama: As of August 2025, it only supported text for Gemma 3n models, which didn‚Äôt meet my project‚Äôs multimodal needs. ‚Ä¢Unsloth: A very promising library, but it required a local GPU for fine-tuning. 3. **Dependency Friction** I had to rely on the Transformers library, but ran into version-related issues. Newer versions unexpectedly broke audio and image support, forcing me to experiment with different versions to find a stable setup. **To make everything work, these versions were crucial:** `!pip install --upgrade torch torchvision torchaudio` `!pip install transformers==4.54.1` `!pip install -U timm>=1.0.9` 4. **The Kaggle Breakthrough** With inference times on my local CPU being impractically long and deadlines approaching, the project was at risk. The turning point was discovering that Kaggle Notebooks offered a generous 30-hour weekly quota of free GPU usage. I moved my entire development and inference workload to Kaggle, which finally gave me the computational power needed to build, test, and run the model efficiently. 5. **Model Selection** While the 4B version is my preferred choice, it surpasses the memory capacity of the standard Kaggle notebook environment. In my Kaggle notebook code I selected the google/gemma-3n-E2B-it version to stay within the memory limits of the Kaggle notebook environment. 6. **Final Deployment** After using my Kaggle GPU hours to finalize the application, I successfully packaged it and deployed it as a public demo on Hugging Face Spaces, bringing News'ly (my app name ü•∞) to life. *I'm excited to share my work on this project! You can find the live demo, videos, and all the code in the links below. Please feel free to check them out. I'd love to hear your feedback.. ‚ò∫Ô∏è* >Note: The tool supports‚Äînot replaces‚Äîreporters. It speeds up transcription, summarization, and drafting so reporters and journalists can dedicate more time to verification, context, and storytelling.‚Äù

tagline: Creating AI that can be a companion to the elderly
summary:
Project Description
We are all born connected, but many of us face the prospect of growing old alone. This deep, silent loneliness is more than just sadness; it's a condition that affects both mental and physical health. What if we had a friend who would always stand by us, who would reach out first, and share a laugh even on the hardest days?
StandbyMeAI is our answer. It is a proactive, on-device AI companion designed to combat loneliness in the elderly. Powered by the multimodal capabilities of Gemma 3N, it doesn't just wait for a command. It uses its vision to understand the context of a situation‚Äînoticing if you look tired or reminding you to take your medicine‚Äîand initiates conversations with empathetic, emotionally expressive speech. It tells dad jokes, it laughs, it listens.
Running entirely on a low-cost mini-PC, Stand by Me AI ensures privacy and 24/7 companionship without an internet connection. This project, born from a personal worry for loved ones, has become a blueprint. It's proof that you, too, can now build an AI in your own language, for your own family, to ensure they never feel truly alone.

System Architecture
![System Architecture](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F1807291%2Ff03be9973ec5ccd2b9b897c3feb9734a%2Fsystem-arch.png?generation=1754500521915424&alt=media)

Why Gemma 3n was Essential for this Project
Our vision required an AI that was proactive, private, and context-aware. Gemma 3n was the only model that met all our criteria for three key reasons, as highlighted in our video:

- Multimodal Understanding: StandbyMeAI is not a passive chatbot. It proactively initiates conversation based on what it sees. Gemma 3n's ability to process visual information is the core engine that allows it to understand the user's situation and act spontaneously, moving beyond simple command-and-response interactions.
- Privacy-First & Offline Ready: Entrusting an AI with the wellbeing of our loved ones demands the highest level of privacy. Because Gemma 3n runs entirely on-device, no personal data, images, or conversations ever leave the user's home. This creates a truly private and reliable companion that functions 24/7, with or without an internet connection.
- On-Device Performance & Accessibility: We are committed to making this technology accessible to everyone, not just those with high-end hardware. Gemma 3n's efficiency allows the entire system to run on a low-cost Mini PC. This makes it a practical and affordable solution for families worldwide.

Overcoming Technical Challenges
A key part of this project was bridging the gap between a local development environment and a shareable, reproducible demo on Kaggle.
- The Kaggle Memory Constraint: Our initial challenge was significant. The Kaggle environment, even with two T4 GPUs, could not simultaneously load the Gemma 3n model for image analysis and a high-quality TTS model without crashing due to Out-of-Memory (OOM) errors.
- The Unsloth Solution for Inference: We solved this problem by leveraging Unsloth. While widely known for fine-tuning, we discovered it is also an exceptionally powerful tool for inference. By loading unsloth/gemma-3n-E4B-it via Unsloth's FastModel, we drastically reduced the memory footprint, enabling stable, simultaneous operation of both models. This was a critical breakthrough for our public demo.
- Ensuring Real-World Usability (CPU Version): The version shared on GitHub is designed for practicality. It uses the standard Transformers version of Gemma 3n on the CPU and a GGUF version of the TTS model. This ensures that users without access to powerful GPUs can still run, modify, and deploy StandbyMeAI on affordable, common hardware.

Special Recognition: The Unsloth Prize
We are submitting this project for consideration for The Unsloth Prize, as Unsloth was not just a tool, but a pivotal enabler for our project's success in two distinct ways:

project_title: Mentis - A Privacy-First, Fine-Tuned Gemma 3n for Mental Health
tagline: Fine-Tuned with Unsloth, Delivered via Ollama, Accessed via Open WebUI, Designed for Ethical AI Use
summary:
Mentis - A Privacy-First, Fine-Tuned Gemma 3n for Mental Health

Github repository for complete workflow and binary releases: [Mentis](https://github.com/kelesfatih/Mentis)

Mentis is a privacy-first, locally-deployed mental health assistant built on the fine-tuned Gemma 3n (4B) model and grounded in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT). It addresses key barriers to mental health access‚Äîprivacy concerns, cost, and infrastructure gaps‚Äîby operating entirely offline on consumer-grade hardware via Ollama and Open WebUI. Fine-tuned using Unsloth with preference-ranked psychotherapy data (PsychoCounsel-Preference), the model demonstrates improved alignment with clinical communication principles such as empathy, relevance, and safety. Through quantized deployment (GGUF, 8-bit) and parameter-efficient tuning (QLoRA), Mentis delivers structured psychoeducation and emotional triage without reliance on cloud infrastructure or third-party APIs. It is designed as a zero-barrier, scalable intervention point for individuals underserved by traditional mental health systems.

Technical Summary
| Component             | Description                         |
| --------------------- | ----------------------------------- |
| Base Model            | Gemma 3n 4B                         |
| Tuning Framework      | Unsloth + QLoRA (4-bit)             |
| Dataset               | PsychoCounsel-Preference (filtered) |
| Quantization          | GGUF 8-bit                          |
| Inference             | Ollama                              |
| Interface             | Open WebUI                          |
| Therapeutic Framework | CBT                                 |

tagline: Child Protection
summary:
Technical Writeup
Google - The Gemma 3n Impact Challenge

1. Introduction & Motivation
Children today are increasingly exposed to emotional and behavioral harm from inappropriate content. This includes online exposure to violent or sexual material, offensive language, and toxic behavior, often found in movies, social media, and other digital platforms, as well as offline exposure through social environments, where family members, peers, or caregivers may model or directly engage in harmful behaviors. Children absorb and mirror behaviors they constantly see or hear, especially in formative years. Repeated exposure to harmful stimuli can negatively affect children‚Äôs emotional and psychological development, potentially leading to lasting behavioral and issues or trauma. 
The problem is exacerbated by the diversity of children‚Äôs backgrounds: age, neurodiversity, culture, trauma history, and personal sensitivities all shape what constitutes ‚Äúharmful or inappropriate‚Äù for the child, highlighting the need for nuanced and context-aware protection strategies. Existing current abuse detection systems and content moderation tools rely on pre-defined set of harm categories. They often fail to capture nuanced and context-dependent forms of harm. Furthermore, few systems prioritize real-time analysis, privacy, and customizability, all of which are essential for protecting children in both home and institutional environments.
Our proposed system, GemmaGuard3N, reimagines child protection through an intelligent, adaptable, privacy-conscious lens. Built using Gemma 3n, a state-of-the-art open multimodal LLM designed for running with high efficiency on low-resource devices. Our solution is capable of processing long-form visual and multilingual audio streams from diverse sources. GemmaGuard3N leverages zero-shot reasoning and customizable prompting to enable customizable real-time detection of potential harm tailored to individual children's needs.

2. Problem Statement
We define the problem as the detection of harm indicators in live or recorded video streams involving children, where ‚Äúharm‚Äù includes: 
‚Ä¢	Inappropriate language, behavior, or gestures 
‚Ä¢	Psychological abuse or aggression 
‚Ä¢	Unsafe content exposure (e.g., sexual innuendos, substance use) 
‚Ä¢	Emotionally disturbing interactions or tones 
Key Technical Requirements
‚Ä¢	Multimodal Understanding: Detect harm from both visual and auditory inputs.
‚Ä¢	Privacy-Aware Processing: Ensure that content is analyzed locally or through secure channels to protect user privacy.
‚Ä¢	Real-Time or Near-Real-Time Performance: Provide immediate alerts to caregivers upon detecting signs of harm.
‚Ä¢	Personalization: Support customizable definitions of harm based on each child‚Äôs individual needs.
‚Ä¢	Zero-Shot Capability: Eliminate the need for training a custom dataset for every use case.
‚Ä¢	Multilingual Support: Accurately process audio in multiple languages to accommodate diverse populations.
‚Ä¢	Long-Form Video Handling: Continuously analyze long-duration videos such as CCTV footage, movies, and online content without interruption.

3. System Architecture
GemmaGuard3N comprises four core modules:
1. Input Handling
The system supports a variety of video sources:
‚Ä¢	Real-Time CCTV Streams via camera IP URLs.
‚Ä¢	Local Videos, including uploaded movie clips or home surveillance footage.
‚Ä¢	YouTube Links, allowing analysis of online content before sharing it with children.
2.	Preprocessing and Feature Extraction 
‚Ä¢	Video Frames: Sampled at 1 frame per second (FPS).
‚Ä¢	Audio: Extracted and converted to 16 kHz WAV format.
‚Ä¢	Temporal Alignment: Maintained to synchronize video and audio cues accurately.
3. Harm Detection with GemmaGuard3N
A lightweight, multimodal method leveraging Gemma 3N:
‚Ä¢	Dynamically crafts prompts based on user-selected harm indicators.
‚Ä¢	Applies a sliding window approach to process long videos in overlapping segments.
‚Ä¢	Detects nuanced patterns using token-level SoftMax probability scoring from MLLM logits.
4.	Feedback and Alert System
‚Ä¢	If harm is detected, parents or guardians are notified. 
‚Ä¢	Each flagged instance includes harm probability score and a timetable to indicate segments of concern.
‚Ä¢	Recorded evidence, such as audio/video snippets, is provided to support parent review and informed decision-making.

4. Methodology
We designed the GemmaGuard3N method to detect harm indicators in real time from multimodal video inputs. The method consists of the following steps:
‚Ä¢	Step 1: We curated a general list of harm indicators (e.g., violence, sexual content, verbal abuse, and inappropriate language). Optional harm indicators are also collected from users to extend this list based on their specific child safety requirements.
‚Ä¢	Step 2: We craft a negatively framed prompt for the Gemma 3N using the selected harm indicators. For example: ‚ÄúDoes this video contain any of the following: violence, sexual content, inappropriate language, or verbal abuse?‚Äù A "Yes" response indicates the presence of harm. Prompts are carefully constrained using system- and user-level instructions to ensure response (‚ÄúYes‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo‚Äù) only.
‚Ä¢	Step 3: To enable Gemma 3N to process longer videos, we implement a sliding window approach. Videos are divided into short, overlapping chunks to reduce inference load, based on the output of a preprocessing and feature extraction module. The window size is dynamically adjusted depending on device memory and model capacity. Overlaps are introduced between windows to prevent missing brief harmful segments (e.g., a single swear word). Each chunk is sent to Gemma 3N for evaluation.
‚Ä¢	Step 4: For each window, we extract the logits associated with the ‚ÄúYes‚Äù and ‚ÄúNo‚Äù tokens generated in response to the crafted prompt. A SoftMax function is applied to these logits to compute the probability of a ‚ÄúYes‚Äù response as a confidence score. A window is flagged as harmful if the "Yes" probability exceeds a defined threshold. This design is inspired by the QGuard paper [1], which used token-level SoftMax probabilities to detect unethical or harmful text prompts in the context of malicious attacks.

5. Implementation Details
We build GemmaGuard3N using a modular pipeline composed of the following core components:
‚Ä¢	For video processing, we employ OpenCV for efficient frame sampling and real-time stream handling. Frames are extracted at configurable intervals to balance computational efficiency and temporal coverage.
‚Ä¢	For audio processing, we use Pydub and Librosa to segment, normalize, and convert raw audio streams into model-compatible formats.
‚Ä¢	For model inference, the backbone of our system is Gemma 3N, a multilingual, multimodal vision-language model developed by Google. We leverage the HuggingFace Transformers library with PyTorch to run inference over synchronized audio-visual segments.
‚Ä¢	For the user interface, we implement an interactive web demo using Gradio, which supports real-time user input, file uploads, and video visualization.

6. Conclusion 
GemmaGuard3N, powered by Gemma 3n, is a powerful proof-of-concept for socially responsible, AI-driven child protection. It transforms the way we approach video analysis, offering not just detection but contextual, human-aware safety for those most vulnerable. We believe our technical architecture and methodology can inspire a new class of safety applications built on Gemma3n, ones that are as empathetic as they are intelligent.

7. Citations
[1] T.‚ÄØLee, J.‚ÄØYoo, H.‚ÄØCho, S.‚ÄØY.‚ÄØKim, and Y.‚ÄØMaeng, ‚ÄúQGuard: Question‚Äëbased Zero‚Äëshot Guard for Multi‚Äëmodal LLM Safety,‚Äù arXiv preprint arXiv:2506.12299‚ÄØv1, June‚ÄØ2025

This is an offline AI-powered chatbot app built with **Flutter**, using the **flutter_gemma** package to run the **Gemma 3n** model entirely on-device. Users can chat with the app anytime, 24/7 ‚Äî no internet required. Its primary goal is to help users manage stress through conversation and emotional support. When the app detects that a user's stress level has reached a critical point, it will offer to connect them with a mental health helpline.

Each helpline is linked to verified psychological support services. If the call goes through, a summary of the recent conversation will be forwarded to the counselor to provide helpful context.

**üîπ MVP Features:**
- Chat Support: Multilingual conversations powered by Gemma 3n via flutter_gemma.

project_title: Medical-Gemma-3N: Offline Emergency AI for Remote Areas, Disasters and First Aid
tagline: From model to mobile: fine-tuning, evaluation, and full offline deployment in real-world emergency scenarios
summary:
Medical-Gemma-3N is a fully offline, end-to-end AI assistant designed specifically for handling emergency medical scenarios in remote or low-infrastructure environments‚Äîplaces where there‚Äôs no reliable internet, no nearby healthcare professionals, and often, no time to wait for help.

We built this project entirely from scratch:

- Started with a baseline evaluation of the Gemma‚Äë3n‚Äë4B model to assess its performance on emergency medical instructions and triage benchmarks.
- After confirming the base model achieved only 36% accuracy, we built a custom dataset of over 86,000 emergency medical Q&A pairs, using public datasets and real-world manuals from WHO, Red Cross, FEMA, and other sources.
- We then fine-tuned the model using LoRA and Unsloth, enabling efficient training on limited hardware. The resulting model reached 71.5% accuracy, nearly doubling the baseline.
- For inference, we used Ollama to test and debug the quantized GGUF version of the model locally before deploying to mobile‚Äîallowing us to simulate real-world offline performance in development.
- Finally, we deployed the model fully on-device using Flutter and the flutter_gemma library, which supports both base weights and LoRA adapters for mobile inference‚Äîno cloud or servers required.

This is not just a fine-tuned model‚Äîit's a complete and operational end-to-end pipeline:
- Custom data preparation pipeline with embedding-based RAG augmentation
- LoRA-based fine-tuning with parameter-efficient training (only 76.9MB trained)
- Evaluation loop with AI judges to track model improvement over time
- Cross-platform mobile app with critical offline-first features:
     - Global emergency number lookup by country (using local geolocation)
     - A multilingual chatbot interface for general medical questions
     - A dynamic, model-driven triage system where questions 4+ are generated live by the model on-device
     - Visual aid: users can take a photo (e.g., wound or rash), and the model uses contextual prompts to assist diagnosis

Everything runs locally. The model lives on the device. No internet is required‚Äîmaking it ideal for:
- Rural villages in the jungle, desert, or mountains
- Disaster zones where infrastructure is down or damaged
- First responder kits and offline field medical teams
- Low-resource educational contexts for teaching health and first aid

We believe this project represents what the Gemma 3N initiative is really about: accessible, open, socially impactful AI that performs in the real world‚Äîat the edge, without compromise.

project_title: Breathing Reminder Engine for Autonomous Thoughtless Human Enhancement
tagline: In a highly intelligent world, AI can do everything. It can no longer just assist in creation, but can even remind you - are you breathing?
summary:
Title: Local AI-Based Silence Detection and Interaction System

This project is a local, lightweight AI system that continuously monitors microphone input, detects prolonged silence, and responds with intelligent prompts generated by a local language model. The system architecture consists of the following functional modules:

Microphone Input Module
Captures real-time audio data from the user's microphone.

Audio Sampling Module
Processes incoming audio signals into a form suitable for silence analysis. It ensures consistent sampling intervals and filters out irrelevant noise.

Silence Detection Module
Analyzes the audio stream to detect periods of inactivity. If silence exceeds 10 seconds, it triggers a downstream response. This logic is configurable and designed for low-latency response.

Local Language Model Invocation Module
Upon detecting prolonged silence, this module engages a local language model (e.g., Gemma or Llama.cpp) to generate contextually appropriate prompts. The model runs entirely offline to preserve privacy and reduce dependency on external APIs.

Output Interface Module
The generated response is delivered to the user through a terminal-based interface and/or voice feedback using a text-to-speech engine. This enables seamless, real-time interaction without relying on cloud infrastructure.

Use Cases:

Productivity assistants reminding users to stay focused

Speech therapy tools prompting vocal activity

Ambient computing interfaces in quiet environments

AI interaction demos for embedded or offline systems

Key Characteristics:

Fully local processing; no network dependency

Modular and extensible architecture

Low-resource and privacy-preserving

Designed for real-time, reactive AI behavior

summary:
In today‚Äôs fast-evolving technological landscape, equipping students with hands-on STEM experiences is essential. 

Key Innovations:

Democratizes Access: By turning everyday mobile phones into powerful control hubs, this approach eliminates the need for expensive robotics equipment upgrades. Schools can make their current robots more capable using devices already familiar to students, and my migrating existing robots to a esp32 board, to enable AI based training. 

Budget-Friendly Upgrades: Utilizing affordable, readily available components, this project modernizes robotics infrastructure, opening doors for all schools to offer advanced learning opportunities regardless of budget constraints.

Seamless AI Integration: The solution incorporates artificial intelligence effortlessly into classroom robots. This unlocks dynamic features and creative problem-solving challenges, empowering students to dive deeper into coding and robotics. The entry barrier is lowered as there is no need for custom hardware or cloud access in classrooms. Students can install the app and edit the source code using Android studio. 

Fosters STEM Engagement: With intuitive, visual interaction enabled by mobile controls, students become more engaged and inspired‚Äîfrom curious beginners in elementary labs to advanced learners in technology centers.

Scales Across Facilities: Designed to fit diverse educational settings, this mobile-based system maximizes technology investments by adapting from simple school labs to high-tech learning environments.

Future-Proof Learning: Keeping pace with rapid AI advances, the platform supports continuous upgrades and expansion, ensuring that educational robotics stay relevant and cutting-edge.

My email is prashobh07@gmail.com , please use email for contacts


What challenges did we solve?

Coding the Siyenoove robot in micropython was an unknown. This is because the robot came with firmware for Joy sticks and was written in python. Since the servos of the robot is not having any sensors, it was hard to write the code to initialize the bot and keep its movements smooth. we used threaded implementation in micropython to make smooth simultaneous movement for dance movements option. 

Android app of the Google Gallery edge was modified to enable the communication to robot. This is a new implementation which aligns to the robot's requirements for messages. 

Why is this the right approach? 

By enabling a general purpose board like ESP32, which costs around 5$ in larger units, and robot costing less than 50$ , we extend the reach to train students on AI and robotics to more than 3x number of students. 
Modern robots with high programmability costs atleast 150$. Since the platform is completely open and Gemma 3n can run on any phone, additional hardware is not needed, saving costs exceeding 3x.

tagline: fully offline, AI-powered learning application
summary:
InstructAI ‚Äì Technical Write-up


Demo, APK & Source Code

Demo Video: https://youtu.be/3XUDqbxLxNE?si=RjmUL-UWQUlVvxcZ

APK Download: https://github.com/prashantpatil0/InstructAI/releases/download/v1.0.0/InstructAI.apk

Source Code: https://github.com/prashantpatil0/InstructAI


Overview of InstructAI

InstructAI is a fully offline, AI-powered learning application developed using Flutter and MediaPipe's GenAI framework. It empowers users to generate personalized course roadmaps and interactive lessons without needing an internet connection. The app uses Google‚Äôs Gemma 3n LLM (.task model) to run all inference directly on-device.


Architecture Overview

1] Frontend ‚Äì Flutter

Splash screen for permission handling and model existence check

Download screen for manual .task model setup

Home screen to browse recommended and custom course prompts

Roadmap screen to display AI-generated learning paths

Learn screen for module-wise lesson generation and content viewing


2] Model Inference ‚Äì MediaPipe GenAI (Native Android)

Model (gemma-3n-E2B-it-int4.task) loaded using LlmInference

Model interaction is handled via platform channels

Streamed generation with LlmInferenceSession.receiveBroadcastStream()

Model reset with _resetModelSession() to avoid context buildup


3] Data Storage ‚Äì Hive (Flutter)

Stores all saved course roadmaps and progress

Courses can be resumed, regenerated, or continued at any time

Storage is lightweight and entirely local


- Core Functionality & Implementation

1] Splash Screen (Model Check & Permission)

Checks for internal storage permission

Uses Directory('/storage/emulated/0/InstructAI/model') to verify if the .task model file exists

If not found, navigates to the model download setup screen


2] Model Download Setup

Creates target folder: /storage/emulated/0/InstructAI/model

Displays download link for user to manually download the model:


Includes instructions to manually move the file into the correct path


3] Model Inference Setup

Native Android side loads the .task file using LlmInference.createFromFilePath(path)

Streaming responses handled with:

_streamChannel.receiveBroadcastStream({ "prompt": userPrompt })

Resets session after each inference:

inferenceSession?.close()
inferenceSession = LlmInferenceSession.create(inference)


4] Roadmap Generation (Recommended/Custom)

Prompts sent to the model using structured instruction format:

Custom: "Create a roadmap for learning [topic]..."

Recommended: Predefined prompts with course title and outcomes


Output parsed and saved locally with Hive for later retrieval


5] Course Detail & Learning Flow

Displays full roadmap

Allows selecting a module via dropdown

Collects user input/focus area

Sends roadmap + selected module + user input as context for lesson generation


6] Lesson Streaming

Flutter UI displays token-by-token streamed lesson from model

Markdown output rendered with flutter_markdown

Stream cancellation or session reset occurs if user exits screen mid-inference



How We Used Gemma 3n

We used Gemma 3n E2B int4 quantized model in .task format

It is responsible for:

Generating compact, structured course roadmaps

Creating detailed module lessons from roadmap and user input


Entire inference happens offline using MediaPipe's LlmInference

Streaming logic is used to provide real-time output for a responsive UX

Reset logic ensures no memory accumulation across multiple sessions




Challenges We Overcame

1. Manual Model File Setup
Due to Android‚Äôs storage restrictions and model size, we designed a manual download+placement flow.


2. Stable Streaming Inference
Platform channels were carefully managed to support real-time streaming without crashes or leaks.


3. Model State Management
Session reset logic was critical to avoid prompt accumulation or interference across multiple sessions.


4. Polished Offline UI/UX
Despite working offline, we focused on keeping the UI fast, responsive, and intuitive across screens.




Why These Technical Choices Were Right

Gemma 3n is a small, quantized LLM with impressive performance for on-device use.

Flutter enabled fast and attractive UI development across platforms.

MediaPipe Tasks allowed us to use native inference without building our own LLM runtime.

Hive ensured quick and reliable local storage with minimal overhead.


These choices enabled an AI learning app that works fully offline, is lightweight, and supports future extensibility‚Äîmaking it ideal for users with limited or no internet access.

tagline: A local-only open-souce document intelligence agent accessible to visually impaired users.
summary:
What it does

Dina is a local-only, open-source, cross-platform document intelligence agent that allows blind users to effectively navigate, understand, and query electronic and printed documents like letters, receipts, expense reports, invoices, tax forms, employee handbooks, training manuals, and other types of structured business documents which visually impaired employees must work with during their day-to-day activities.  Unllike apps like [Be My Eyes](https://www.bemyeyes.com/be-my-eyes-for-windows/) and [Google Lookout](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.accessibility.reveal&hl=en_US), Dina is specifically designed to help blind users understand, navigate and query the information in customer and internal documents and to use this information effectively in business processes and workflows and IT systems that may be inaccessible to blind employees.

An Innovative Approach to Personal Development Guidance Using Natural Language Processing with Gemma 3N
authors: Veli Yikilmaz, Mustafa Bay, Harunn Gokce
summary:
Project Description: A Step-by-Step User Journey
Welcome to the Personalized Learning Assistant. Our goal is to transform the static, one-way learning process into a dynamic, interactive, and deeply personal dialogue between the user and our AI tutor, powered by Google's Gemma 3n.

Below, we will walk you through a complete user session to demonstrate how our application creates a unique learning path from scratch for any topic imaginable.

The Spark of Curiosity - Choosing a Topic
The user's journey begins on a clean, minimalist interface designed for a single purpose: to capture curiosity.

Enter a Topic: The user types any subject they wish to learn into the text box. It can be anything from a scientific concept like "Black Holes" to a historical event like "The French Revolution".

Select a Language: The user chooses their preferred language for the entire experience (English or Turkish).

Initiate the Journey: They click the "Start Level Determination Quiz" button. At this point, the application hands over the reins to Gemma 3n to begin the personalization process.

The Assessment - How Much Do You Know?
Instead of immediately overwhelming the user with information, our assistant first seeks to understand them.

1. Real-Time Quiz Generation: In just a few seconds, Gemma 3n generates a 3-question multiple-choice quiz tailored specifically to the chosen topic.

2. Conceptual Questions: These are not simple trivia. The questions are designed to probe the user's foundational understanding of the subject's core concepts.

3. Determining the Level: The user answers the questions. Their score (e.g., 0/3, 1/3, or 2+/3) is used to categorize their knowledge level as Beginner, Intermediate, or Advanced. This assessment is the cornerstone of the entire personalized experience.

The Custom Lesson - Content Tailored Just for You
Once the user's level is determined, the "Topic Content" tab comes to life. Gemma 3n now acts as a personal tutor and writes a comprehensive lesson from scratch, with its style and depth precisely calibrated to the user's level:

A Beginner will receive a lesson rich with simple analogies, foundational definitions, and a clear, step-by-step introduction.

An Intermediate user will get more detailed explanations, exploring the nuances and connections within the topic.

An Advanced user will be presented with in-depth analysis, technical specifics, and comparative insights.

This ensures the user is always challenged but never overwhelmed, maximizing engagement and comprehension.

Reinforce and Explore - The Mini-Quiz and References
A great lesson is supported by great tools. Alongside the custom lesson, two other tabs become available:

üìö References Tab: Gemma 3n provides a curated list of reliable sources (websites, books, articles) for users who wish to continue their learning journey beyond the application.

‚ùì Mini-Quiz Tab: To solidify what has just been taught, a new 10-question quiz is ready. After taking the quiz, the user receives an instant score. More importantly, for every incorrect answer, Gemma 3n provides a clear explanation of why the chosen option was wrong and why the correct one is right, turning mistakes into valuable learning opportunities.

The Deep Dive - An Interactive Dialogue
The learning doesn't end with the quiz. The final and most powerful step is the deep dive.

At the bottom of the "Topic Content" tab, a Q&A box invites the user to engage in a dialogue. They can now ask any follow-up questions they have about the material they just read. For example:

"Can you explain the concept of an event horizon in simpler terms?"

"What was the main difference between the Girondins and the Jacobins?"

"Why is this considered a key turning point?"

Gemma 3n, acting as a Socratic learning partner, provides contextual answers based only on the information presented in the lesson, ensuring a focused and clarifying conversation. This transforms passive reading into active, inquiry-based learning.

Conclusion
In a single, seamless session, the user has gone from expressing a simple curiosity to having their knowledge assessed, receiving a bespoke lesson, testing their comprehension, and clarifying their doubts through a personal dialogue. This is the power of the Personalized Learning Assistant: a truly adaptive, effective, and private educational journey for anyone, anywhere.

Leveraging the powerful Gemma 3N model, it offers robust translation capabilities for both spoken and written input. tagline: Accessible AI Education for the World's 1.3 Billion Disconnected Children
summary:
Internet Created One More Education Inequality

Over 1.3 billion school-age children lack internet access at home, creating an unprecedented educational divide. This isn't about capabilities or curiosity, but about connection, the essential foundation for learning in the digital age.

The shocking reality:
- **Two-thirds of children ages 3-17** are cut off from online educational resources
- **Most vulnerable populations**: Rural communities, urban slums, refugee camps, and disaster-affected areas
- **Sudden disconnection**: Even connected communities lose access during natural disasters, conflicts, or infrastructure failures
- **The result**: A widening cycle of disadvantage that traps children in poverty and exclusion

The Text-Only Learning Trap

For centuries, learning has been trapped in static formats: books, websites, and now even ChatGPT, all deliver education through walls of text with minimal interactivity. Children learn by doing, creating, and exploring, yet our digital tools have regressed to glorified textbooks.

Traditional educational technology falls short because it:
- Requires constant internet connectivity
- Delivers passive, one-size-fits-all content
- Lacks real-time adaptation to student needs

Our Solution: The Educational Internet in <6GB

TutorLM transforms 44TB of educational content, the world's largest repository of human knowledge, into a 6GB package that can run on a solar-powered laptop anywhere on Earth. Using Gemma 3(n) trained on 11 trillion tokens, we've created an AI tutor that works completely offline.

This isn't just compression; it's educational revolution packaged for universal access.

The Magic of Multimodal, Offline AI: How It Works

TutorLM replaces the passive screen with a Collaborative Human-AI Canvas, where learning becomes an interactive conversation between student and AI.

project_title: SaveMe - the digital twin rescue app
tagline: A multimodal Android app paired with a website providing expert-level answers on highly complex machinery in low-connectivity situations.
summary:
Product Idea
SaveMe addresses a critical challenge faced by hardware and infrastructure companies: how to provide instant, reliable access to complex technical information when and where it‚Äôs most needed. In high-stakes environments - like bringing systems online in low-connectivity locations or managing emergencies in remote areas - technicians shouldn‚Äôt be flipping through manuals.

SaveMe puts a fast, privacy-first AI assistant in every technician‚Äôs pocket. Working entirely offline, the app responds instantly via voice and text to spoken questions and visual input, offering concise, relevant answers on the spot.

During the **envisioned online setup**, SaveMe collects and structures all relevant documentation, drawings, and procedures in a format optimized for multimodal AI models. This can be done by either fine-tuning the model or embedding the data as fast-searchable context. The result is a digital twin of the machinery - an intelligent, self-contained knowledge application - working locally on the user‚Äôs smartphone.

The **offline user experience** is designed to be natural and intuitive. A technician simply points their phone‚Äôs camera at the equipment, clicks the single app-button and asks a question. The app processes voice and visual input locally and delivers a clear, immediate response in both text and speech without requiring any network connection. During offline usage, the app consists of a single button only for extra user-friendly interaction.

Minimum viable product

For our minimum viable product we minimized components to the essentials while preserving high user value and monetization potential.

The **setup process** is done on our website www.save-me.app. This website lets customers enter expert knowledge in plain text via a simple input box, saves this text to a private database and returns a unique 5-digit token. Entering that token in the Android app pulls the text as model context onto the device. Once the download is done, both model and context live *entirely offline* on the smartphone.

The **on-device usage** after model and text download consists of a single button, which takes an image and records voice. The latter is converted to text together with the input image, context and system prompt fed into Gemma 3n. The resulting text is displayed within the app and read out loudly. The predefined system prompt instructs the model to output precise answers based on the provided context.

With this foundation in place, SaveMe already delivers on its promise: in moments of need it provides precise, reliable answers with **complete data privacy**, powered by Google‚Äôs latest edge LLM. The next steps are clear ‚Äî support richer data types, refine the user experience, and continue proving that the best help is the help you can carry in your pocket, wherever human engineering takes us. 

Architectural decisions

The architectural decisions followed logically from MVP constraints and goals. On the website, which we built using PHP, HTML, CSS and MariaDB, expert knowledge can be entered into a text box. A token is generated and both text and token are stored in the database. When providing an available token, an API returns the corresponding text.

The Android app was built based on Google's AI edge gallery and MediaPipe with image and text input. Also, Gemma3n's lightweight, multimodal capabilities make it well-suited for this edge deployment. For voice generation we used Android's built-in text-to-speech system and for voice-to-text conversion we temporarily used the open source model Whisper with plans to migrate to MediaPipe's on-device audio support once stable.

Architectural details

The following description follows our public app repository at www.github.com/JahnKhan/saveme-app.

project_title: GEMMASRA: GEMMA 3n  Based Science Rationality Assistant
tagline: GEMMASRA is  GEMMA 3n  Based Science Rationality Assistant to Promote Scientific Temper.
summary: Scientific temper‚Äîthe capacity for evidence-based reasoning, skepticism, and critical inquiry‚Äîis a fundamental attribute of modern citizenship and a constitutional duty in India. However, its development is often hindered by widespread pseudoscience, misinformation, and lack of access to scientific education. This project  presents the design and implementation of a Science Rationality Assistant (GEMMASRA) powered by Gemma Large Language Models (LLM) to address this gap. The assistant is designed to engage users in interactive dialogue, explain scientific concepts in accessible language, and critically evaluate unverified claims. It leverages Gemma 3n LLM capabilities in natural language understanding, multilingual generation, and context-sensitive reasoning to simulate scientific thinking processes. A custom prompt-engineering strategy and curated dataset of verified scientific content were used to align responses with rational inquiry principles. The assistant was evaluated on three dimensions: accuracy, engagement, and promotion of critical thinking. The Gemini Flash model was utilized in automated evaluation of the GEMMASRA.  Results indicate that the system significantly improved users' ability to differentiate between evidence-based and pseudoscientific claims.

Ultimately, the goal of this project is to provide a specialized tool that can analyze an image of a plant and then output a detailed, text-based scientific assessment of any diseases it finds.

tagline: An AI Companion for Moments When Millions Converge
authors: Rithik Purohit, Mahesh Lambe, Ravikant Khamitkar, Padmanabh Kulkarni, KrishnaShingan1122
summary:
Nimittam is an offline, privacy-preserving mobile application designed to assist pilgrims during large-scale events such as the Kumbh Mela, where connectivity is limited and crowd management is crucial. Built using Gemma 3N, Google‚Äôs lightweight on-device AI model, Nimittam offers a seamless, intelligent experience while strictly adhering to the principles of No Cloud, No Leaks, and No Latency.

The application serves two primary functions: navigation and contextual event assistance, both fully operational without internet access. With preloaded local maps and AI-powered camera-based landmark recognition, Nimittam helps users locate essential points of interest including toilets, medical tents, ghats, and lost and found centers without relying on GPS or mobile data. This offline navigation capability ensures that even in highly congested or remote areas, pilgrims can move confidently and safely throughout the event.

In addition, Nimittam provides real-time multilingual translation, leveraging Gemma 3N‚Äôs Universal Speech Model to break language barriers that commonly arise in diverse gatherings. Pilgrims can interact with the app through both text and images, enabling smooth communication across regional languages without the need for cloud services or server-based translation. Whether reading a sign, understanding a pamphlet, or interpreting directions from volunteers, users receive instant, on-device assistance tailored to their preferred language.

The app also addresses one of the most emotionally critical challenges of such events, the separation of individuals from their groups. Nimittam helps in reuniting lost elders and children, using a privacy-focused workflow that runs entirely offline, ensuring sensitive data such as images and identities remain secure.

By combining offline multimodal AI, a user-centric design, and a strong commitment to privacy, Nimittam transforms even the most basic smartphones into intelligent, context-aware assistants. It enhances not only safety and accessibility but also the overall spiritual experience of participants. As such, it stands as a meaningful and deployable solution aligned with the mission of the Gemma 3N Challenge to build responsible, real-world AI tools that work for everyone, everywhere.

tagline: NexusRX is an AI health assistant that uses Gemma 3n via Ollama to give fast, accurate diagnoses and treatment suggestions.
summary:
Frontend: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (Designed for a responsive, intuitive, and efficient user interface)

Backend: Python (Flask Framework) (Orchestrating robust communication and data processing)

Core AI Model: Gemma (Leveraged via Ollama for efficient, local Large Language Model inference)

Project Overview:
NexusRX is a smart desktop health assistant designed to give users fast, reliable, and privacy-focused medical support right from their own device. Built for simplicity and real-world usability, it acts as a helpful companion for understanding symptoms, exploring possible conditions, and receiving preliminary advice ‚Äî all without needing an internet connection.

Powered by Google‚Äôs Gemma 3n language model through Ollama, NexusRX delivers conversational and intelligent medical insights with impressive accuracy. Whether you're dealing with common symptoms or need a deeper explanation of a condition, NexusRX responds in real time with thoughtful, easy-to-understand guidance.

What sets NexusRX apart is its offline-first architecture. Unlike typical health chatbots that rely on cloud servers and require sign-ins, NexusRX runs locally on your machine, giving you full control over your data. There‚Äôs no account needed, no data collection, and no background tracking ‚Äî just fast, intelligent help when you need it most.

The user interface, built using CustomTkinter, is clean, modern, and focused on clarity. A straightforward chat experience makes it easy to describe symptoms or ask questions, while the AI assistant delivers information tailored to your input without jargon or filler.

NexusRX was created for students, families, and even small clinics looking for a lightweight yet capable tool to support everyday health needs. It is not designed to replace medical professionals, but to serve as a first line of understanding ‚Äî a way to feel more informed and less anxious before visiting a doctor.

In a time when accessible healthcare tools are more important than ever, NexusRX offers an approachable, private, and intelligent solution built for everyone.

tagline: Navigate your health in the right direction, privately
summary:
üîó Gemma 3n Impact Challenge Deliverables At a Glance

| Deliverable | Location |
| --- | --- |
| **The Video Demo** | https://youtu.be/_w0J7syoQEw  |
| **Public Code Repo** | https://github.com/barun-saha/health-compass |
| **The Technical Writeup** | This post.  |


Windows [installation file for Health Compass](https://github.com/barun-saha/health-compass/releases/tag/v0.1.1) is available on GitHub. Please note that this file is **unsigned**. (Ollama needs to be installed separately; see the instructions on the GitHub project description.)

In addition, a separate screen recording of Health Compass demonstration (annotated; without audio) is also available for reference at https://youtu.be/6QMgsdwrSGc (also attached to this post as media at the end).

---

---


üß≠ Health Compass: Your Private Guide to Medical Clarity

**Struggling to make sense of your medical test reports, but worried about sharing private health data with online AI tools?**
*Health Compass* is here to help‚Äîwith fully offline, secure, and intelligent explanations powered by Gemma 3n running locally via Ollama.

**Key Features**:

- üîí **Privacy First**: Your data never leaves your device. No uploads. No cloud processing. Health Compass runs entirely offline on your own computer, ensuring complete control and confidentiality.
- üß† **Built on Open, Local AI**: Our AI engine‚ÄîGemma 3n‚Äîis optimized for offline inference via Ollama, combining robust language understanding with layout-aware medical reasoning. It reads your reports like a clinician would, surfacing what matters with clarity and care.
- üìÑ **Designed for Real-World Medical Data**: Whether it‚Äôs blood work, imaging summaries, or tabular test results, Health Compass preserves layout and structure for accurate context interpretation‚Äîthanks to its carefully benchmarked PDF extraction pipeline.

üéØ **Why Choose Health Compass?**
- No internet required‚Äîworks entirely offline
- Understands layout-heavy medical documents
- Offers clear, empathetic explanations for non-experts
- Transparent, modular, and open-source compliant

Whether you're a patient seeking clarity or a caregiver looking to support loved ones, Health Compass empowers you to navigate complex health information with confidence‚Äîand total peace of mind.

---


üå± Why Health Compass? The Frustration That Sparked It All

Most people look at their medical test results and feel overwhelmed. Numbers like ‚ÄúCRP‚Äù or ‚ÄúT3 uptake‚Äù don‚Äôt mean much without clinical context‚Äîleaving patients confused, anxious, or forced to search the Web for answers. That's the first frustration.

The second? In today‚Äôs AI boom, many users attempt to upload their reports to cloud-based tools just to get some interpretation‚Äîaccidentally exposing deeply personal health data in the process.

**Health Compass was born to address both pains head-on**:  
- It translates medical jargon into plain language summaries,  
- _and_ does so entirely offline‚Äîno cloud calls, no data leakage, no GPU dependencies.

At the heart of this architecture is **Ollama**, a secure and lightweight local LLM runner. It powers **Gemma 3n** directly on the CPU, letting anyone with a modest laptop safely understand their health reports.

**Health Compass uses Gemma 3n (specifically, Gemma 3n E2B) and Ollama because**:
- Gemma 3n is small enough to run on CPU, yet powerful enough to correctly follow given instructions.
- Gemma 3n can correctly identify user intents and relevant entities.
- Having trained on a world body of knowledge, Gemma 3n can already answer most questions, including those related to the healthcare domain.
- Gemma 3n is multilingual, making it a great choice for regions with rich linguistic diversity, such as India.
- Ollama is one of the best and easiest solutions to run a Generative AI model locally, offline.
- Ollama supports a large number of models, including the different generations of Gemma, which offers users the freedom of choice.

---

üåç What's the Potential Impact?

Health Compass makes medical literacy personal, private, and local. Moreover, Health Compass is Open-Source.

- Instead of uploading sensitive PDFs to an LLM server, users keep everything on-device.  
- They can ask everyday questions‚Äî_‚ÄúIs high creatinine bad?‚Äù_‚Äîand get conversational, grounded answers.
- The system has no accounts, telemetry, or cloud APIs. It's engineered for **low-connectivity regions, privacy-sensitive users, and everyday accessibility.**

By wrapping Gemma 3n inside **Ollama‚Äôs containerized, on-device runtime**, Health Compass enables reasoning that‚Äôs safe, scalable, and empowering‚Äîeven for those unfamiliar with AI or medicine.

---

üß† Technical Concepts

Health Compass is more than a concept‚Äîit‚Äôs mature engineering. Here‚Äôs how it works:

- **Gemma 3n E2B via Ollama**:  
  - Ollama spins up Gemma 3n E2B locally via its CLI, with promptability and endpoint routing.
  - Runs comfortably on CPU with token-efficient chunking for larger documents.
- **Planner-Executor Agent Pattern**:
  - User intent ‚Üí structured JSON plan ‚Üí agent executes ‚Üí result rendered.
  - Modular separation lets new tools drop in easily.
- **PDF Interpretation**:
  - Extracted using `pdftotext`, preserving document layout without cloud services.
  - Summarized by Gemma 3n E2B, with agent fallback if context is lost or clarification is needed.
- **Electron Shell & Secure IPC**:
  - Prevents direct Node access from the UI.
  - Uses preload scripts to bridge context securely and configure LLM selection per environment.
